loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty O. is 58 years old and married with three children. She sells drinks to make a living. Betty is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize and cocoyams

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy O. sells roasted beef (called 'poomo' in Nigeria). Roasted beef is used in the preparation of Nigerian soup. Lucy is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more beef to roast and sell to her customers in Benin City, Edo State. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to roast and sell

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Бахтиёр мужчина , который занимается куплей, откормом и продажей скота.Каждый свой займ он использует для увеличения бизнеса животноводства.Он благодарен, что кредиты улучшили его семейное положение увеличили оборот скота.На следующий займ Бахтиёр хочет закупить ещё несколько баранов и корм для них.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor is a man who is involved in buying, feeding and selling livestock. He uses every one of his loans for growing his animal husbandry business. He is grateful that the loans improved his family conditions and increased livestock turnover. Bahtiyor wants to use this loan to purchase a few more rams and feed for them.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rams and livestock feed

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.en:
A. Tutiniso is a widowed mother. She is entrepreneurial and this quality has allowed her to live comfortably and support herself and her dear son. Tutiniso has devoted herself to rearing animals. At the same time, she is preparing to become a successful professional. She wishes to improve the rearing conditions in her small stable and for this reason, she is requesting a loan of 4000 TJS. Tutiniso wishes to use the loan to purchase two calves, and she appeals to your generous heart.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith O. is 49 years old and married with two children. She sells sarongs and baby items such as diapers, flasks, etc. She has been in this business for a long time. Faith is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs and baby items to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and baby items to sell

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
With the hope of improving her family’s standard of living, Nargiza entered the sphere of commerce four years ago. She sells children's clothing in the local market of Dj.Rasulov district. With the profits from her business, Nargiza not only supports her family of four, but also her retired parents. She is lively and cheerful, hard-working and committed to the success of her business and the welfare of her family. Nargiza is requesting a loan of 3000 TJS to purchase inventory for the summer season. She hopes to continue to develop her business and successfully support her family.

loans.use: To purchase garments to sell for the summer season

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is married and has been blessed with 2 beautiful daughters. She also has four parents who depend solely on her for all their needs. With such a big financial obligation, Stella started a retail store last year in Machakos. She is now seeking a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to increase the stock in her retail store. Her five year strategic plan is to operate a wholesale shop. Her dream is to see her children get the best education and help the needy in the society.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
E. Marhabo has a business selling women’s underclothes and dressing gowns. She has a good, busy location for her business with many people passing by, but she is concerned with the cost of rent and may move to another location. Marhabo has been in business for three years. Her husband has been struggling with illness, which is a real concern for Marhabo. She does her best to help him, and would like to see him recover completely. Marhabo has requested a loan of 3000 TJS to help her purchase more inventory. Periodically, she has the opportunity to attend trade shows and display her products. She’d like to have some additional inventory to take with her to the shows so that she can work on improving her sales and increasing her income.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria I. sells foodstuffs like tubers of yam, garri (roasted cassava), etc. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

Victoria is 60 years old and she is a widow with seven children. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.en:
I. Abduaziz started his business because he needed to support his wife, and what better way to do so than by selling clothing and footwear for women! He started selling at market places three years ago, and since then he has not quit the business because it generates good profits. His wife (pictured) helps him with the business. Abduaziz cannot slow down his sales because of the economic crisis and because expenses never stop accumulating. Abduaziz currently offers apparel at a good price as competition is stiff and he wishes to retain customers. He is requesting a loan of 3000 TJS, which he will use to purchase new merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en: J. Zuhro is 50 years old and is working to support her single son who is the drive for her to live. She is operating her own clothing sales business, which she has owned for more than three years. The savings she earns from her business goes to improve their health and living conditions. Zuhro is requesting this 3,000 Somoni loan to purchase more merchandise to restock and increase her inventory. Her business is growing and she has shown that she can increase sales with a larger supply of product. loans.use: To purchase new clothing for women in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Rasoolan Abdul Khaliq Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan baji is married to A. K., and they have lived in the city of Arifwala, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Her husband is a painter by profession and paints people’s houses. He also sells paint boxes to shops. He has eight years of experience in this business. Rasoolan baji is applying for a loan to buy paint boxes and tools for her husband so that he is able to grow his business. Rasoolan baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality.

Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell.
Mahmood begum baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to sell.
Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.
Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Rasoolan baji is seated on a chair in this photo.

loans.use: To buy paint boxes and tools

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: K. Madina is married with a small daughter and a son. Madina’s store, which sells kid’s clothing, is located at one of the busiest city markets. She has been in this business for three years. Madina is a serious and prudent business owner. Her perseverance, together with lending services from “IMON International”, has enabled her to gradually expand her business. There are many vendors and competition in clothing sales is high. However, Madina’s pleasant manner and willingness to meet clients’ needs have helped her to keep a loyal clientele. Madina is requesting a loan of 4,000 Somoni to purchase an assortment of clothing items in bulk. Her responsibility, stable business growth, and prompt payment record characterize Madina as a consistent and serious entrepreneur capable of loan repayment. loans.use: To purchase new clothing in bulk

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: M. Munira is 34 years old and she and her husband have two children. To improve her family position and to support her husband with family expenses, Munira started her business six years ago. She bakes “lepeshka” (the national bread: circular flat loaves with a decorated top) at home. Having many customers, Munira sells the majority of her products just from her place. Munira is doing her best to ensure her children have the best future. Now she requests 800 USD that she is planning to spend on the purchase of flour wholesale as required for her business. Munira is grateful for all supporting her and promises to manage the loan with accuracy. loans.use: To purchase flour wholesale for baking the national bread, “lepeshka”

loans.name: Osaretin

texts.en: Osaretin is 37 years old and married with 5 children. She sells yams wholesale and retail. She is requesting the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
Bakhtiyor is a young and energetic man with the desire to improve his family's living conditions. He is 22 years old and lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He has a retail shop where he sells spare parts for foreign cars. He has been involved in this business for more than 5 years, since before, he has helped his father. He provides cars with spare parts and his family with the necessary food and other needs.

Bakhtiyor has a great demand for spare parts thus he wants to buy more goods in order to hold on to his clients. He wants to take out an individual loan of 3000 Somoni to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop inventory.

Bakhtiyor is happy about this loan and would like to thank everyone for their trust and support.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for cars to sell

loans.name: Shumaila Kosar Muhammad Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Shumaila Kosar baji owns a two-room brick house in a city called Arifwala, Pakistan and has been living in it with her family for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is M. A. and he works in a factory for a monthly wage.

Shumaila baji operates an embroidered clothes business, taking orders from her relatives and neighbors. She completes a dress in 4 days and charges US$ 3 for each dress. She does this work to pay the utility bills. She is applying for a loan to buy material (cloth, colored thread, and beads) for her embroidered clothes business.

She is the group leader for four other women from her locality. Shahida Parveen baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Sajida Parveen baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit to sell. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart to carry loads. Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for her food-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Note: Shumaila baji is the lady in a black shawl in this photo.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for preparing embroidered dresses

loans.name: Oisha

texts.en:
For the past 3 years, Oisha has had her own business selling traditional dresses for women in the market. She has been a tailor for many years and together with the help of her daughter (pictured), Oisha sews and then sells the traditional women's dresses in the market. She started her own business because she knew it would bring in good returns. Not only does it help meet the needs of herself and her husband, but she is also able to help her parents and her grandchildren financially. Oisha is requesting a loan to help purchase new inventory in order to fill all her orders from her buyers.

loans.use: Purchasing  new traditional dresses for women

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.ru: Хасанов Курбон проживает в Варзобском районе. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Возраст 38 лет. Курбон более 17 лет занимается производством. Он изготавливает ворота, бочки и т.д. В данный момент он просит кредит для закупа сырья, чтобы изготовлять качественные, новые ворота.
texts.en:
Kurbon H. lives in the Varzob district. He is married and has 3 children. He is 38 years old. Kurbon has been involved in manufacturing for over 17 years. He makes gates, barrels, etc. Currently, he is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials in order to make quality, new gates.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.en:
S. Jahongir is dedicated to rearing rabbits and cattle. With a lot of effort and sacrifice, he carries out this work every day for the purpose of improving the living conditions of his family, bringing the daily bread to his table and, at the same time, saving for the improvement of his dwelling, which needs a lot of help because it is in bad condition which, little by little, he has come to improve.

His family admires him for the fact that his multiple efforts have permitted him to bring food to his home and that in addition, Jahongir has managed to keep his family in good living conditions. The need that this gentleman faces is that he needs to invest in his business through the purchase of cows for its development. By this he hopes that IMON International with the help of Kiva will offer him the loan so that he can do well, along with his family.

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to expand his business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria sells dried fish and other foodstuffs. She is 52 years old and married with 6 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more dried fish and foodstuffs to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish and other foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen E. sells provisions. She 32 years old and married with a child. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She is indeed grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Ermahmad

texts.ru: Хасанов Ермахмад проживает в районе Варзоба. Возраст 22 года. Холост. Ермахмад более 4 лет занимется бизнесом. Он покупает уголь и перепродает его подороже. Он имеет у себя дома склад, где хранит уголь. Он еще занимается доставкой. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота. Клиент хочет накопить полученную прибыль и сыграть свою свадьбу.
texts.en:
Ermahmad H. lives in the Varzob district. He is 22 years old, single. Ermahmad has been involved in business for over 4 years. He buys coal and resells it at a higher price. He has storage at home where he keeps coal. He is also involved in deliveries. He is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover. Client wants to save the resulting profit and hold his wedding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha is the mother of 4 children. In 2001, she started selling vegetables in an open air market in a small town. In 2002, she opened a kiosk where she sold only vegetables. Last year, she got a loan of Kshs. 20,000 from SMEP, which she used to buy second-hand clothes. She is now requesting for a loan of Kshs. 30,000 to increase her stock of second-hand clothes, because the demand has increased.

loans.use: Increase stock/ expand business

loans.name: Imuentinyan

texts.en: Imuentinyan O. is 44 years old and married with 5 children. She is a fashion designer and she also sells sarongs. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Vaidullo

texts.en:
S. Vaidullo is a 53-year-old. He is married and has a child. Vaidullo owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated by the grocery store. His wife (pictured) and son help him with his business.

Vaidullo, being engaged to this business for more than 15 years, has enlarged his clientele and has many constant customers. He is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni to increase his stock. Vaidullo is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  foodstuffs to expand his little store

loans.name: Nurbibi

texts.ru: Хамдамова Нурбиби проживает в Варзобском районе. Возраст 62 года. Вдова, имеет 3 детей. Сын находится на заработках в России. Сама клиентка занимается пашивом национальных платьев. Сырье закупает в городе Душанбе. Кредит просит для закупа сырья, чтобы предоставлять качественные услуги.
texts.en:
Nurbibi H. lives in the Varzob district. She is 62 years, a widow and has 3 children. Her son works in Russia. The client is involved in making traditional dresses. She buys her materials in the city of Dushanbe. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials in order to offer quality service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious A. is 38 years old and married with 5 children. She is a fashion designer and she also sells sarongs. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.en:
T. Azimjon is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 7 years. He bakes traditional bread called “lepeshka” at home. He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. He gets up early and bakes the lepeshka and other bread so that people have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast.

All the input materials such as flour, salt, and yeast must be purchased in the local market. Now due to high demand, Azimjon wants to increase the amount of bread he bakes so he is requesting a loan of 800 USD. The loan will be spent for purchasing flour and charcoal for baking the “lepeshka”. Azimjon deeply appreciates the trust and support you offer him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  flour wholesale for baking  “lepeshka”

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary I. sells drinks and cooked foods. She is 53 years old and married with 7 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy D. sells provisions and drinks. She is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a very cheerful and inspiring lady. She has defied all the odds. In 2004, at over sixty years old, and after having educated all her children, she opened a kiosk. Beatrice has been blessed with 9 children. Currently, she has 2 staff and wants to expand her business so that she can create more employment opportunities. She is requesting a booster loan of Kshs. 20,000 to purchase more stock for her kiosk.

loans.use: Increase stock/ expand business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice O. is 42 years old and married with 6 children. She fries and sells chin-chin. "Chin-chin" is a type of pastry in Nigeria that is made from flour, sugar, and baking powder. She is requesting the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more bags of flour to fry more chin-chin to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour to sell

loans.name: Busulwa East Mary Walusimbi Group

texts.en: Mary W. is forty-years old, married, with eight children, all schooling. Mary sells fried chicken; it is so far eight years for her, doing this type of business. She is using the loan to purchase chicken from the market, charcoal, and cooking oil to fry the chicken for sale to customers. The loan will improve her business because she will be able to fry much more chicken to meet the demand of her customers daily; she is doing well compared to previous days. Her dream is to construct a house.

loans.use: Purchasing chicken from market, charcoal, and cooking oil

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Gift O. is 39 years old and married with 2 children. She is a hairdresser and also sells hair extensions and cream to her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Busulwa East Nabawesa Dorothy Group

texts.en: N. Dorothy is a married business lady aged thirty-nine and blessed with five children, all schooling. She has a salon she is been operating for over ten years. She is using the loan to purchase salon items such as hair products (food, relaxer, treatments, combs, etc.) and other salon equipment she was missing. Her salon business is improving in that community members are encouraged to do something by observing what she is doing. Being a hard-working lady, her future hope is to build a house

loans.use: purchasing salon items

loans.name: Badal

texts.ru: Мунаварова Бадал проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 58 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Бадал имеет магазин, где торгует запчастями от велосипеда. Муж вместе с сыном работают продавцами. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 10 лет. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Badal M. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 58 years old, married and has five children. Badal has a store where she sells spare parts for bicycles. Her husband and son work together as salesclerks. She has been engaged in this type of business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her inventory

loans.name: Kaswa North Nabufu Peninah Group

texts.en: N. Peninah is a married lady, thirty years old and blessed with four children who are all going to school. She has been in her business of selling bananas for over three years. She is using the loan to purchase bananas in volume which is adding stock as in capital to her business. She is a hard-working business lady whose dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: purchasing bananas in volume for her business

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Ниезматова Фарида проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 30 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Фарида более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Оа имеет торговую точку, где в основном торгует хозяйственными товарами. Муж работает продавцом. Кредит, просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
30-year-old Farida N. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is married with three children. For more than five years, Farida has been engaged in trade. She has a salesbooth where on the whole she sells household products. Her husband works as a salesclerk. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her inventory.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her inventory

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is twenty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, a boy and two girls who are all currently in primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the western region of Ghana. Paulina is a petty trader. She sells textiles – underwear for both men and women. She hawks her wares in her community.

Paulina buys the textiles from Kumasi. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy bales of textiles in bulk to expand her business. She desires to give her children quality education and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy underwear for resale

loans.name: Majengo Mapya Group

texts.en:
Hadija is a member of the Majengo Mapya borrower group in Lala, Iringa. She is a 28-year-old woman, married, and the mother of 3 children. Her children are ages 12, 8, and 3. She also cares for one other dependent.

Hadija started her own business 3 years ago selling clothes. She works 6 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 400,000 Tanzania schillings.

This is Hadija’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Hadija hopes to save money, to improve her home, get more food for her family, pay school fees and expand her business.

(Rose, the other member of the Majengo Mapya borrower group, has also requested 250,000 Tsh in order to support her own business selling clothes.)

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Байматова Манзура проживает в районе Кабадияна. Возраст 44 года. Муж развелся, из-за бесплодия Манзуры. Манзура имеет 2 детей. Она более 10 лет проработала учительницей. В данный момент она занимается торговлей национальных материалов. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 10 лет. Кредит просит для расширения бизнеса, она хочет купить сеззоный товар и еще одну точку на вещевом рынке. Клиентка после развода с мужем взяла двоих детей из детского дома. Она хочет, чтобы у детей было хорошее будущее.
texts.en:
44-year-old Manzura B. lives in the Kabadiyana district. Her husband left because Manzura is unable to bear children. After the client divorced from her husband, she adopted two children from an orphanage. For more than ten years, she has worked as a schoolteacher. At the moment, she is engaged она in the sale of national materials, an activity she has similarly been involved in for more than ten years. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business. She wants to buy seasonal goods and yet another booth in the merchandise market. She hopes that her children will have a better future.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: God Is Good Group

texts.en: Charlotte is thirty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children. She is a food vendor. Charlotte is the leader of a trust bank group called "God is Good." She is shown at the right of the photograph. They are a group of seven but only two showed up at the meeting. Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors, or farmers. They work to support their spouses in providing for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares, or goods from other towns, and sometimes from nearby communities, and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for a loan to help them procure more goods to enable them to expand their businesses. It is the heartfelt desire of the group members to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a member of the Mwangata COF borrower group in Mwangata, Ilala. She is a 27-year-old woman, she is married, and she is the mother of 2 children. Her children are ages 3 and 8.

Monica started her own business selling potatoes 3 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Monica’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 300,000 TZS in order to expand her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Monica hopes to pay for school, to save money, and to get more food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes

loans.name: Benkadi 1 De Toura Nabitokan Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 1 est un groupe  de femmes mariées du village de Toura Nabitokan de la ville de SAN, région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 22 ans, au moins 7 enfants et ont comme activité la  culture  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe BENKADI 1  de Toura  Nabitokan ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  le prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 1 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35.000 à 25.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI 1 is a group of married women from the village of Toura Nabitokan, town of SAN, SEGOU region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families.They have an average age of 22, at least 7 children and their business is the cultivation of peanuts. Anxious in making their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of BENKADI 1 group of Toura Nabitokan decided to join the loan program Soro Yiriwaso 2 years ago. After having repaid correctly the preceding loan, they are on their second rural loan. This loan will be used to buy sufficient quantities of peanuts seeds, small materials and inputs for cultivation mainly at the big market of Kamparana. After the farming season, the harvests are stored for some time for them to gain value before being sold out at the big market of Kamparana and in surrounding markets by retail (often in bulk), for cash, to customers from the big towns. Members of group BENKADI 1 each intend to make, after the sale of their crops, a profit of 25.000 to 35.000 FCFA which will be used to repay interest on the loan and current family expenses.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inputs, seeds and small materials

loans.name: Kaswa North Namwase Maria Group

texts.en: N. Maria is the group leader of Kaswa north. She is a married woman forty-five years of age, blessed with ten children, the youngest of whom is still going to school. She is also looking after two siblings. She has been in the business of selling used clothes for over fifteen years. She is using the loan to purchase used clothing, normally consisting of skirts, tops, and gentlemen's clothing to sell to customers. She is adding capital to her business, whereby, now that it is doing well, she is able to purchase used clothing in bigger volumes. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: Purchasing used clothing, like skirts, tops, and men's clothing

loans.name: Abdukahhor

texts.ru: Абдукаххор Зоитов проживает в районе Шахритуза. Возраст 50 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Сын находится в России на заработках. Абдукаххор более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. За счет прибыли клиент хочет построить дом сыну. Кредит просит для покупки скота.
texts.en:
Abdukahhor Z. lives in the Shahrituza district. He is 50 years old, married and has two children. His son is working in Russia. For more than 15 years, Abdukahhor has been engaged in raising livestock. He raises and sells cattle. With the accumulated profit, the client hopes to build his son a home. He is requesting a loan in order to buy livestock.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bighorn cattle

loans.name: Yesu Ne Me Kanea Group

texts.en:
Francis is fifty years old. He is married and has three children. He is a trader and deals in jewels.

Francis is the leader of a trust bank group called “Yesu ne me Kanea” which literally means “Jesus is my Light”. They are a group of thirteen members but only two showed up at the meeting.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and or farmers. They work to support their spouses to provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well.

The members have been in business for sometime and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses. It is the heart’s desire of the group members to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is twenty nine years old. She is married and has one son who is currently attending primary school. She lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the western region of Ghana. Angelina is a retail seller of eggs. She sells at the market square in her community. Angelina buys crates of eggs from nearby poultry farms. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Angelina has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy crates of eggs in bulk to expand her business. She hopes to give her child quality education and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs for resale

loans.name: Benkadi 1 De Toura Nouakan. Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 1  est constitué de femmes mariées du village de Toura Nouakan de la ville de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et au moins 4 enfants.
Elles ont comme activité agricole la culture de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe BENKADI 1 de TOURA NOUAKAN ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  le  prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 1 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 30 000 à 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI 1 is made up of married women from the town of Toura Nouakan, in the city of San, within the region of Segou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families. They are on average 38 years old and less than 4 children.

Their business is farming, specifically growing peanuts. To improve their profits from their farming business, the members of the group of Benkadi 1 of Toura Nouakan decided to join the loan program Soro Yiriwaso 2 years ago. Having fully repaid their previous loan, they are on their second loan.

This loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small equipment, fertilizer for their farming - they will purchase it solely from the large market in the town of Kimparana. After the the off-season, the harvests are brought in; during that time-period and they are are sold for value to the big market of Kimparana and in the surrounding markets. In detail, the they are sold at wholesale for cash to a clientele generally coming from the large cities.

The members of group Benkadi 1 will each earn a profit from this business, after the costs of their agricultural products, their profit will be between 30 000 à 20 000 FCFA. They will use these profits to repay the interests of the loan and to pay for their families' expenses.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and small equipment

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is forty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters who are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Western Region of Ghana.

Gloria is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew. She prepares the food in her house and sells at the market square. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from Kumasi. She has been in business for fourteen years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

Gloria desires to give all her children a quality education and to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
La señora Amalia C. C.  tiene 33 años y es madre soltera de dos hijos, uno de 12 años de edad y el otro de 9 años, los cuales acuden a una escuela de la zona.

La señora Amalia vive en alquiler en el pueble de Tiraque a una hora y media de la ciudad de Cochabamba. En su domicilio es donde tiene su taller de costura de prendas de vestir para mujeres, las cuales distribuye a los puestos de venta en las ferias de los pueblos de Colomi y Tiraque. Tiene más de 5 años de experiencia en la confección de prendas de vestir para mujeres.

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de materiales para la elaboración de las prendas de vestir (tela, hilo y otros) y de ese modo incrementar la confección actual de prendas de vestir que tiene, y así poder mejorar sus ingresos y por consecuencia su nivel de vida. La señora Amalia espera poder incrementar el número de prendas que elabora y en futuro sacar otro préstamo para poder actualizar la maquinaria con la que trabaja para la elaboración de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Amalia C. C. is 33 years old and is the single mother of two children. One is 12 years old and the other is 9 years old and both go to school in the area.

Amalia lives in a rental in the town of Tiraque, an hour and a half from the city of Cochabamba. She has a seamstress shop in her home for women’s clothing, which she distributes to the booths at the markets in the towns of Colomi and Tiraque. She has more than 5 years of experience making women’s clothing.

She will use the loan for the purchase of materials to make pieces of clothing (fabric, thread, and others). This way, she will increase her current clothing production and will be able to improve her income and as a result, her quality of life. Amalia hopes to be able to increase the number of clothing pieces that she makes and in the future, obtain another loan so that she can update the machinery that she works with for her clothing production.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for the purchase of fabric and other materials for the production of women's clothing.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles N., aged 38 years, is married to Mirian and blessed with two beautiful children aged 11 and 7 years. He lives at Kayole Estate which is near the Soweto slums, and his trousers stall is at Mutindwa market 6 km from his rented house. Charles has been running his trousers stall for eight years and his monthly profit is about 10,000 Kenyan shillings (approximately $130). His wife Mirian operates their electronics shop. Charles wants to use this loan to increase the stock of ladies’ trousers in his shop, as well as to buy bulbs, aerials (antennas) and electrical wires for their electronics shop. Charles hopes that the generated income will enable him to provide for his children's school fees, food for his family, and the ability to live in a better house. He aspires to improve his standard of living in future and to be able to take care of his siblings. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To increase the stock of ladies' trousers in his shop, as well as to buy bulbs, aerials and wires for his electronics shop

loans.name: Benedit

texts.en: Benedit E. is married with nine children. He is a 49-year-old farmer. He hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to hire laborers to clear his farmland. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To hire laborers to clear his farm

loans.name: Kaswa South Muyonje Florence Group

texts.en:
M. Florence is the group leader of the Kaswa South women's group. She is a married woman of 47 blessed with five children. Three of her children are going to school and two are married. She also looks after two dependents who are also schooling. 

She has been in the poultry business for more than 12 years. She is using the loan for purchasing chicks, chicken feed and drugs for healthy poultry, which can easily attract customers. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: Purchasing chicks, chicken feed and drugs for healthy poultry, which can easily attract the customers

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en: Florence M. is one of the executive members of Balikyewunya group in Gayaza and has a decorating business that has been running for over 20 years. She also keeps pigs at home. She is a friendly lady and this has won her customers because of her free nature. She is able to make a weekly profit of about 50,000/= and this usually increases in some seasons like Easter and Christmas and on special occasions.  Florence is a married mother of five children who are still in school and she cares for five grandchildren. Her main challenge is paying her children’s school fees. This is one reason Florence works so hard.  She needs a new loan to buy more decorating materials like nets and veils and to buy two pigs for her farm.

loans.use: To buy more decorating materials and more pigs.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 38 years old and married with two children. He is a farmer. He hopes for a loan of N50,000 to hire laborers to clear his farm. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To hire more laborers to clear his farm

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en: K. Catherine is the leader of her subgroup of Balikyewunya in Gayaza. She is a hard working lady with a business selling used clothing from daily markets called Mubuulo for over five years now. She is grateful that when she joined her lending group, she could not afford to buy some of the necessities in her home but she is now able to do so. She is a mother of four children all going to school and she needs a loan to be able to buy more used clothing for her stock.

loans.use: Buying more used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice , a member of th Kyumbi Young Ladies' Self-Help Group, started her retail business in Machakos, a semi-arid area of Kenya. Due to drought and the declining purchasing power of the area, she relocated her business to Makutano, a trading centre that is growing rapidly. Alice is married and has three children. She is requesting for a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to increase her stock. Her dream is to ensure that her children get the best education. She also aspires to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: Increase stock/ expand business

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: amy S. est une vendeuse de beignets accras pain thon et tout ce qui intervient dans le petit dejeuner.elle a une tres grande experience dans ce domaine.mariee et mere de sept enfants elle sollicite un credit de cinquante mille(50 000)frs pour augmenter son fond de roulement et repondre a la demande acrue de sa clientele.
texts.en:
Amy S. sells fritters, Accra-style tuna sandwiches, and everything people want for breakfast. She has a lot of experience in this domain. Married and the mother of 7 children, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 frs to increase her working capital and respond to the heightened demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Kaswa South Nakalwago Lydia Group

texts.en: N. Lydia is a married woman of 42 years leading Kaswa south group. She is blessed with seven children. Four of them are going to school. She deals with farm produce like sweet potatoes, maize, rice, etc and she has been in her business for fifteen years. She says produce mostly is seasonal but at least now she handles. She is using the loan to purchase farm produce in bigger volume like rice, sweet potatoes, cassava, maize, etc for sale. Her stock is improving and her future hope is to enlarge her business so she will be able to stock even in times of scarcity and to obtain a shop aside her business.

loans.use: To purchasing farm produce in bigger volume

loans.name: Benkadi  1 De Toura Peulh Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 1  est un groupe  de femmes mariées du  quartier Peulh du village de Toura de la ville de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et au moins 8 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes  excelle principalement  dans  la culture d’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe   BENKADI 1 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  le prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième   prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Kimparana  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 1 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35000 à  25000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI 1 is a group of married women of the Peulh neighborhood, in the Toura village of the city of SAN (Segou Region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali) who live in large extended traditional families with their children, husbands, in-laws, etc... They average 43 years of age and have at least 8 children. They mostly grow peanuts.

Eager to make their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the BENKADI 1 group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, 2 years ago. After having repaid the previous loan without problems, they are now seeking their second farming loan.

This loan will be used to buy, at the grand market in Kimparana, a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Kimparara and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their products, the members of the BENKADI 1 group count on turning a profit of XOF 35000 to 25000 (ca US$ 75 to 55) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith R. H. tiene 19 años y es soltera. Vive con sus padres, tiene un hermano menor que acude a la escuela. 

La Srta. Judith se dedica a la venta de alimentos para ganado lechero (Soya, harina de maiz, afrecho, harina de arroz, alimento balanceado) al por menor, vive en una zona de produccion lechera, por lo que vende mayormente a los vecinos que se dedican a esta actividad. Ella tiene 3 vacas lecheras, entrega leche a una microempresa la cual produce yogurt. Requiere del credito para poder comprar alimentos para poder vender mas y asi ahorrar para pagar sus estudios universitarios y tambien ayudar a su hermano para sus gastos en la escuela. 

En un futuro ella tiene el deseo de terminar sus estudios universitarios y realizar una maestria.
texts.en:
Judith R. H. is 19 years old and single. She lives with her parents and has a younger brother that goes to school.

Judith sells retail food for dairy cattle (soy, corn flour, bran, rice flour, balanced nourishment). She lives in a dairy production area and sells mainly to neighbors that engage in this business. She has 3 dairy cows and she gives milk to a small business that makes yogurt. She needs the loan so that she can purchase food to be able to sell more and save money to pay for her university studies and help her brother with his school expenses.

In the future, she would like to complete her university studies and earn a Master’s degree.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy cattle food for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase stock/ expand business

loans.name: Nakasero East Nasozi Joyce Group

texts.en:
N. Joyce is a married woman of 28 years blessed with five children, who all are going to school. She is also looking after two dependents who are also schooling. She is a group leader of Nakasero East. She has been in the banana business for more than four years. 

She is using the loan to purchase bananas from villages to supply to the markets. She is adding capital as well as stock to her business. She is a young, hardworking businesslady whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase bananas from villages to supply to the markets

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura is a member of the Mwangata C borrower group in Mwangata C, Ilala. She is a 40-year-old woman, married, and the mother of four children. Her children are aged 20, 16, 12 and 8 years old.

Ashura started her own business selling clothes three years ago. She also has a general goods shop in the Ilala neighborhood. She works twelve hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Ashura’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more things for her shop. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Ashura hopes to do repairs, save money, get more food for the family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her shop

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is married and is blessed with 3 children. He and his wife run a retail store and bake cakes. He started the business as a grocery shop in 2003 and later expanded into the baking business. He is requesting a loan of Kshs. 30,000 to increase his stock. His dream is to build a business empire in Machakos.

loans.use: Increase stock/ expand business

loans.name: Osakpanmwan

texts.en: Osakpanmwan O. is 31 years old and single. He is a farmer. He is hoping for the loan of N50, 000 to hire laborers to clear his farm and enable him plant more crops. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To hire more laborers.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married. She sells various products, like cosmetics, clothing, dishes, etc. at small market in Kamenka. She has been in this business for 12 years. Her monthly income is 3-4 thousand UAH.

Although Galina has many repeat clients, she practices an individual approach. She changes her products with the seasons. Galina's business goal is to develop her business and attract even more clients and increase her sales. Galina loves to grow vegetables in her garden and loves to play with her granddaughter, who is only a few months old.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal goods

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: fatou D. mere de huits enfants  est vendeuse de charbon de bois a la cite asecna aouakam.elle evolue dans cette novelle activite et demnde un pret de tris cent mille(300 000)frs pour accroitre son stock afin de pouvoir gerer les aleas de l'hivernage.ses revenus lui permettent de prendre une tres bonne partie des depenses de son foyer en charge.
texts.en:
Fatou D., the mother of eight children, is a seller of charcoal in Cite Asecna Aouakam. She is advancing in this new business and is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs to increase her inventory in order to manage the vagaries of the off-season. Her revenues enable her to cover a very large part of the expenses in the household she supports.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Maria Adelaide

texts.pt:
Maria Adelaide M. nasceu na cidade da Matola, tem 49 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos. Parou de estudar na 5 classe quando o seu pai faleceu deixando lhe sem condições financeiras para poder continuar. Maria tem todos os filhos a freqüentar escola o mais velho tem 15 anos e estudam nas escolas publicas locais.

Maria vive com o seu marido, pensionista militar. Aprendeu a fazer negocio em boane e tem mais de 18 anos de experiência. Vende roupa diversa e produtos alimentares como  arroz, produto base para alimentação da maioria, pratica preço de quase um dólar americano o kilo. Em media rende 700,00MT por dia e consegue poupar algum no final de cada mês.

Maria nunca solicitou empréstimo, nem com outras instituições, e este é o seu primeiro no valor de 25.000,00MT para compra e venda de produtos de primeira necessidade. Maria não tem enfrentado dificuldades para aquisição de produtos, vive a 15 km da cidade de Maputo. Descobriu o escritório da Hluvuku-Adsema quando passava e tendo na semana seguinte aproximado. Propõe se a pagar sem problemas para poder aceder a novos créditos que serão para compra de mais produtos assim como uma viatura para ajudar no transporte de mercadoria para o negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Adelaide M. was born in the city of Matola. She is 49 years old, married and the mother of five children. She left school in grade five when her father died, leaving her without the financial wherewithal to continue. All her children to go to school – her oldest is 15 years old. They attend local public schools. Maria lives with her husband, who is a military pensioner. She learned her business skills in Boane and has more than 18 years of experience. She sells various clothes and food items such as rice, the dietary staple for most people. The actual price is almost $1 US per kilo. On average, she earns 700 MT per day, and manages to set some aside at the end of every month. Maria has never asked for a loan before, and never with another institution. This, her first loan for an amount of 25,000 MT, is to purchase and sell basic necessities. Maria does not face any difficulty in acquiring these goods, living 15 km. from the city of Maputo. She discovered the offices of Hluvuku-Adsema when she passed by and the following week she approached them for a loan. She intends to pay the loan without trouble in order to be able to accede to new loans, which will be to purchase more products such as a vehicle to help in transporting merchandise for her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo Trabaja como Cheff, recibe contratos para eventos matrimoniales, bautizos, cumpleaños y otros.
Es soltero y su trabajo le ayuda a poder solventar sus gastos de alimentación y vestimenta. 
Vive en la Zona de Villa El Carmen de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa en Anticrético
Requiere el crédito para la compra de Vajillas, y cristalería en general.
Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la tercera vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Gonzalo works as a chef and receives contracts for weddings, baptisms, birthdays, and other events. He is single and his work helps him to be able to settle his food and clothing expenses. He lives in the Villa El Carmen area of the city of La Paz in an “anticrético” house. He needs the loan for the purchase of dishes and general glassware. This is his sixth loan with Impro, and the third time that he needs Kiva’s support. His good payment history makes him a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dishes and glassware for his catering business.

loans.name: Osas

texts.en: Osas I. is 31 years old and single. He is hoping for a loan of N50,000 to hire more laborers to clear his farm. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To hire more laborers

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate A. is 29 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She is a farmer. She is hoping for a loan of N50, 000 to hire more laborers to enable her clear her farm. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To hire more laborers

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children – all sons. All are currently in the senior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the western region of Ghana.

Paulina is a trader. She trades in foods such as yams, plantains, etc. She sells at the market square in her community. Paulina buys the food from nearby communities. She also supplies to chop bar (cafe) operators and she treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

Paulina has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy food in bulk to expand her business. She wants to give her children a quality education and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy food

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are currently in the senior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the western region of Ghana.

Emilia is a food vendor. She prepares kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves -- often accompanied by fried fish) and sells it at the market square in her community. She also distributes the kenkey to other retailers and she treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She buys bags of maize from nearby communities.

Emilia has been in business for sixteen years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk to expand her business. She wants to give her children a quality education and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline O. is 32 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She is a farmer. She is hoping for a loan of N50,000 to hire more laborers to clear her farm. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To hire more laborers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his store

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is twenty-three years old. She is married and has a daughter in primary school. She lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the western region of Ghana. Cecilia is a trader. She sells phone cards by the road in her community. Cecilia buys the cards from Kumasi. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy snap cards in bulk to expand her business. She wants to give her daughter a quality education and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy snap cards

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama Y. est couturière de profession à Assahoun. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans. Agée de 42 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. avec ce crédit, Ama souhaite acheter une machine à coudre et des pagnes pour les revendre à la clientèle.
texts.en:
Ama Y. is a seamstress by profession in Assahoun. She has been in this business for five years. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three. With this loan, she wishes to buy a sewing machine and some pagnes (colorful West African cloth) to resell to her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and cloth to resell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is twenty years old. She is single and has no children. She lives with her mother and siblings in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the western region of Ghana. Sarah has just completed the senior high school and is awaiting her results. At the moment, she sells super glue in a shop by a roadside in her community. Sarah buys gallons of glue from Kumasi. She has been in business for barely a year and wants a loan to buy more gallons of glue to expand her business. She wants to save some money and further her education.

loans.use: To buy super glue

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna O. is 49 years old. She is married and has 3 children. She is a farmer. She is hoping for a loan of N50,000 to hire more laborers to clear her farm to enable her plant more crops. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To hire more laborers to clear her farm

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: Alice L. est âgée de 37 ans, mariée sans enfants. elle tient une boutique dans laquelle elle étale plusieurs articles. Pour augmenter la taille de son commerce, Alice souhaite avec ce crédit, approvisionner son magasin de nouveaux articles afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de la clientèle ; et par ricochet une augmentation des recettes et l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Alice L. is 37 years old, married, and without any children. She has a shop in which she displays several items. To increase the size of her business, she wishes to use this loan to supply her store with new items in order to respond better to customer needs. Consequently, she would increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Manasseh

texts.en: Manasseh is twenty-six years old. He is not married and has no children. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the western region of Ghana. Manasseh is a trader. He trades in cereals and other foods, such as rice, beans, yam, etc. Manasseh buys the food from nearby communities and supplies it to high schools in his community. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand his business. He wants to save for his future and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en:
Yaw is thirty-two years old. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the western region of Ghana. Yaw trades in textile materials. He sells in a shop in his community. He also hawks (sells door-to-door) and treks to other towns to sell. Yaw buys the textiles from Kumasi. He has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand his business. 
He wants to give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy textile materials

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria trabaja como comerciante de libros y revistas; tiene un puesto de venta ubicado en la ceja de El Alto. Es madre soltera de tres hijos que dependen de ella, la mayor le ayuda en la actividad comercial.

Vive en alquiler ubicado en la Villa Loreto de la misma Ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de mercadería (LIBROS Y REVISTAS).
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el comportamiento de pago del préstamo anterior le faculta para aprobarle otro.
texts.en:
Maria sells books and magazines from her vending stall located on the outskirts of El Alto. She is a single mother of three dependent children. The eldest child helps her with the business. She lives in a rental property located in the Villa Loreto neighborhood of El Alto.

Her loan will be used to buy merchandise (books & magazines). This is her second loan with IMPRO. Her payment history from the previous loan allowed her to be approved for another one.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase books & magazines

loans.name: Amessi

texts.fr:
cette dame exerce comme activité  la boulangerie, ce commerce lui réussit bien et elle est très connue dans son quartier, beaucoup de gens viennent acheter chez elle pour revendre ou consommer. Les matières nécessaires à la fabrication de pain sont   épuisées alors qu’elle a des commandes de ses clients. Pour satisfaire ses clients  elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 04 sacs de blé, 02 sacs de sucre et des bois de chauffage. 
Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This is a woman who earns revenues from a bakery business, which is doing well. She is renowned in her district. Many people, resellers and consumers, come and buy from her. Her necessary supplies for making bread are exhausted, yet she has orders from her customers. To satisfy them, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy four sacks of wheat, two sacks of sugar, and some firewood. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, and firewood

loans.name: Mareme

texts.fr: mareme D. est vendeuse de poissons seches et autres produits de mer au marche de auakam.elle est veuve mere de neuf(09) enfants  et evolue dans ce domaine depuis plus de cinq(05) annee.elle sollicite un pret de cinquante(50 000)frs afin d'accroitre son stock etbprevenir l'accroissement de la demande qui se justifie habituellement par la rarete du poisson pendant l'hivernage.son activite lui permet de soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mareme D. is a seller of dried fish and other ocean products at the Auakam market. She is a widow and mother of nine children. She has been improving in this domain for over five years. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 francs in order to increase her inventory and to anticipate the growth in demand, which is usually justified by the dearth of fish during the off-season. Her business allows her to support her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: Elise G. est revendeuse de pagnes et de tissus à Assahaoun. Agée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elise exerce ce commerce depuis 5 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des marchandises afin de mieux satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle. Elle compte sur cette aubaine pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Elise G. is a re-seller of panges (colorful wax cloths) and fabric in Assahaoun. Aged 39 years, she is married and the mother of one child. Elise has been in this business for five years and she hopes that with this loan she will be able to buy merchandise so that she can better satisfy the needs of her clients. She is counting on this good fortune to help improve the conditions of her family's life.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy "pagnes" (colorful wax cloths) for re-sale

loans.name: Koudjoukalo

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier de démakpoè, elle est célibataire et pour subvenir à ses propres charges elle a appris le métier de la couture, elle a ouvert un atelier qu’elle a appelé « Couture la GRACE »,elle y fait aussi le commerce de pagnes et de tissus. Elle tire beaucoup de revenu du commerce de pagne et de tissus, elle veut agrandir son stock de pagnes, pour cette raison elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes  05 tissus et divers.
texts.en:
This woman is a resident of the neighborhood of Démakpoè, she is single and in order to provide properly for those she cares for she teaches the subject of making clothes. She opened a workshop, which she called "Grace Fashion". She also stocks and sells "pagnes" (colorful wax cloths) and fabric. She gains a lot of revenue by selling "pagnes" and fabric. She wants to increase her stock of "pagnes", for this reason she is requesting a loan to buy 10 sets of "pagnes", 5 sets of fabric and a variety of other items.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy "pagnes" (colorful wax cloths) and fabric

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en: Isoken A. is 49 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She lives in Benin City. She is a farmer. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to hire more laborers to clear her farm. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To hire more laborers.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married. She has a 10-year-old son named Roman. Natalya owns a small store in the local mall in her hometown of Berdyansk, a town in the south of Ukraine near the Azov Sea. It is a neat little resort that is popular in summer when many people from all over Ukraine, Russia, and other neighboring countries come down to the sea for vacations.

Natalya sells clothing and beach items. Natalya’s business benefits from the tourist season. She currently has about 35,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her monthly income amounts to 10,000 Grivnyas.

Natalya has been in the trade for 12 years. She is presently seeking a loan of 12,100 Grivnyas to diversify assorted merchandise in her little store and increase her turnover capital. Fellow businessmen characterize Natalya as an entrepreneur of integrity who always has a professional approach and manages her venture very skillfully. We believe these characteristics will help her succeed in her business and repay the current loan without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Dadja

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a appris le métier de la menuiserie, il a ouvert son propre atelier qu’il a appelé « DON DE DIEU ». Outre les commandes de ses clients, il fabrique des meubles qu’il expose pour attirer le regard des passants. Les matières nécessaires à son activité de menuiserie étant épuisées, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 08 planches, 10 chevrons  et divers. Ainsi il pourra satisfaire de manière convenable ses clients.
Il est marié et père d’un enfant. C’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman teaches carpentry. He opened his own workshop call "Don de Dieu" (Given by God). In addition to order from his clients, he makes furniture which he shows to attract passersby. The materials he needs for his business are exhausted, so he is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy 8 planks of wood, 10 rafters and a variety of other items. In this way he will be able to satisfy the needs of his clients. He is married and the father of one child. It's with the revenues from his business that he supports his family.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy planks, rafters and a variety of other items

loans.name: Kossiwa Cécile

texts.fr:
Faute de moyens, cette femme a abandonné les études pour apprendre la coiffure. Après son apprentissage, elle a ouvert son propre atelier qu’elle a nommé «  LA PATIENCE ». Elle a associé à ce métier le commerce de produits de beauté. Elle a remarqué que le commerce de produits de beauté marche bien, elle veut l’agrandir et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 25 mèches, 15 tissages, 5 Curly et divers.
Elle est célibataire et subvient à ses propres charges grâce aux revenus de cette activité.
texts.en:
Due to a lack of means, this woman abandoned her studies to be a hairdresser. After her apprenticeship, she opened her own business, which she called "La Patience" (The Passion). She has been involved in the business of selling beauty products. She has noticed that the business of beauty products is going well and she wants to increase this business and is requesting a loan from WAGES for 25 hair extentions, 15 weaves, 5 for curly hair and a variety of items.

She is single and will support the needs of those she cares for with the revenues from this business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions, weaves, curly hair and a variety of other items

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is divorced. He has a son who stayed with him after the divorce. Sergei has always tried to make sure his son has everything he needs and he has worked hard to meet his family's needs as a single parent.

Five years ago, he started his small business selling animal feed and pet supplies. Sergei sells his inventory in the central city market. He has gained much experience by working in this sphere of business. Currently, he has about 12,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. His net profit is about 5,000 Grivnyas.

Sergei is seeking a loan of 10,400 Grivnya to restock his inventory and raise additional income as a result. He is hoping to develop his small venture and to continue improving his financial standing. Sergei admits he is very grateful to his family because they helped him start this business.
