Sergei is hoping to use some of the income that the loan funds generate to buy new household appliances that would make his family's live much more comfortable.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Cette femme est  veuve et mère de 06 enfants. Pour subvenir convenablement aux charges de ses enfants, elle a entamé le commerce de céréales. Une partie de son stock étant épuisée, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 4 sacs de maïs, 3 calebasses d’ignames et divers.
texts.en:
This woman is a widow and the mother of six children. To support the needs of her children, she has started a business selling cereals. One part of her stock has been exhausted; she wants to resupply and is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 4 sacks of corn and 3 calabashes of yams and a variety of other items.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains/ cereals and various other items

loans.name: Volver A Empezar Group

texts.es:
“Volver a empezar” es un grupo D. 10 socias que se agruparon recientemente, algunas ya tuvieron la experiencia D. haber trabajado con Pro Mujer hace dos o tres años, se retiraron porque cambiaron D. domicilio o zona y ahora vieron la oportunidad D. volver a empezar con otro grupo, es el caso D. la señora Maruja Y. que tiene 53 años D. edad, casada y venD. verduras en el mercado “Rodrigues”, ella necesita el préstamo para tener más mercadería por esta razón se integró a un grupo nuevo, además que es la Presidenta.

A igual que Maruja todas tienen diferentes negocios como la venta D. jugo, comida, pan, café, atención D. llamadas y necesitan el préstamo para la compra D. mercadería o incrementar su capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
“Volver a empezar” is a group of 10 members that got together recently. Some of them already had experience of having worked with Pro Mujer two or three years ago and they retired because they moved house or neighbourhood but now see the opportunity to start again with another group. This is the case of señora Maruja Y. who is 53 years old, married, and sells vegetables in the "Rodrigues" market. She needs a loan to get more merchandise and for this reason she joined the group again. She is also the President.

Just like Maruja, all the women have different businesses like selling juice, food, bread, coffee, working in call centres, and they need loans to buy merchandise or to increase their working capital

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise/increase working capital/COMPRA DE MERCADERIA/INCREMENTAR CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Kaboli

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier de d’agoè-adougba qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays où le bol de céréales est moins cher, ainsi elle arrive à réaliser de bons profits sur ces ventes. Son stock a diminué, voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de maïs, 02 sacs d’haricots et divers.
texts.en:
This woman is a resident of the neighborhood of Agoè-adougba, which is located in the outskirts of the city of Lomé. She earns her income with the revenues from her business selling cereals and grains. She gets her supplies from the middle of the country where buying cereals is less expensive and, as a result, she is able to earn good profits from her sales. Her stock has diminished and she would like to re-supply, so she is requesting a loan to purchase 10 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of beans and a variety of other items.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals/ grains

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos; Kety de 28 y Wilfredo de 19 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir, negocio en el cual vierte todo su tiempo, ya que al estar su esposo de viaje por trabajo y sus hijos ya mayores, su mayor distracción es su negocio. Doris recibe pedidos de sus vecinos, colegios, y otros, los cuales recurren a su buen gusto para obtener las prendas deseadas, puesto que ella tiene un gran paciencia para elaborar dichas prendas mucho esmero y cariño, teniendo como resultado buenas ventas. Pero este trabajo requiere de mucha precisión, ya que elabora patrones ya determinados y buena vista para realizar la costura. Para un futuro cercano, Doris quiere tener un taller textil muy grande para contratar a más gente que la ayude. Ella se encuentra en su noveno préstamo grupal y siempre le ha ido muy bien trabajando con Microfinanzas PRISMA, ya que siempre fue muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de tela para cumplir con el pedido de buzos que le hicieron de un colegio de un distrito aledaño.
texts.en:
Doris is a very hard working woman who is 50-years old. She lives with her husband and children: Kety (28-years old) and Wilfredo (19-years old) in their own home. For the last (3) three years she has dedicated herself to sewing clothing. The business takes up all her time as her husband travels for work and her children are older, so she is mostly busy with work.

Doris receives orders from her neighbors, colleagues and others who rely on her good taste to obtain the clothes they want. Because she has great patience to work with the garments, taking great care and love for the work it results in strong sales. The work requires much precision to create a certain pattern with a keen eye for sewing.

For the near future, Doris wants to have a large textile workshop to contract large with more people. She is requesting her ninth loan with the group and always has worked well with the microfinance group PRISMA as she is always punctual with her debt. The funds will be invested in the purchase of fabric for a neighboring school in the district.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric to make clothes

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: seynabou M. est vendeuse de vaisselles depuis plus de deux(02)ans.elle a une tres grande experience dans ce domaine elle est mariee et mere de deux(02)enfants et compte sur son activites pour soutenir son mari dans les charges domestiques.elle sollicite un pret de cent(mille)frs pour augmenter son stock .
texts.en:
Seynabou M. has been a seller of dishware, pots, and pans for over two years. She has a lot of experience in this domain. She is married and the mother of two and is counting on her business to help her husband with domestic expenses. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to increase her inventory of goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is single. She is a small-scale entrepreneur from Melitopol where she runs a business selling household items in the central marketplace. Nadezhda offers a nice selection of merchandise at her kiosk, which is located in a very favorable location. She has been running this venture for over 10 years. Vending experience and additional funding have helped Nadezhda’s business grow and expand. Presently, she has about 15,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her net monthly profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas.

Nadezhda is requesting a loan of 11,000 Grivnyas to increase her turnover capital and generate additional income. She enjoys running her small business and is very grateful to her friends who encouraged her to start her business many years ago and have been very helpful ever since. Nadezhda can be characterized as a very diligent and hard-working entrepreneur. We believe her strive for further expansion of her trade and determined attitude will help her repay the current loan and achieve sucess in her business endeavors.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Télou

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est né à tsévié, il est venu à Lomé en 2005 et pour subvenir à ses charges,il a commencé le commerce de charbons de bois. Etant un homme à exercer ce commerce, il  réussit à attirer les clients. La pluie a endommagé une partie de son stock, il veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 25 sacs de charbons et assurer le transport.
texts.en:
This gentleman was born in Tsévié. He came from Lomé in 2005. To support himself, he started doing commerce in charcoal. Being a man working in this business, he is successful in attracting customers. The rain has damaged part of his stock. He wants to stock up again and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 25 sacks of charcoal and to cover the transportation costs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married. She has two grown children who live with her. She sells sports outfits and footwear in the central market of her home town of Melitopol. Nadezhda’s kiosk is located in a busy part of the market which helps her keep her business running. She has been in this trade for 10 years. Her business has grown up to 15,000 Grivnyas in merchandise. Her net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas.

Nadezhda is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted merchandise and generate additional income. She enjoys working with this type of inventory and believes it is a niche where she feels most comfortable. Nadezhda’s trade has benefited a lot from lending services. She has repaid all her previous loans without any problems. We believe her focused attitude and determination will help her repay the current loan on time as well.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Koussi

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale dans sa propre boutique qu’elle a appelé « Petit à petit », elle fait face en ce moment à une rupture de stock, elle voudrait reconstituer son stock et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 06 cartons de biscuit « régal », 05 cartons de spaghetti, 04 bidons de 25 litres, 05 sacs de riz et divers. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.
texts.en:
This is a woman who earns revenues from commerce in grocery items in her own shop she calls “Petit à Petit” (meaning, Little by Little). Right now, she is facing an inventory shortage. She would like to replenish her stock and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy six boxes of Regal cookies, five boxes of spaghetti, four 25-liter drums, five sacks of rice, and various other items. She gets her supplies at the grand marketplace of Lomé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet M. has been a farmer for many years. With her 2 sons and her meager savings, she started a laundry business in Athi River. Her two sons are part of her staff. She is requesting for a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to buy equipment for her laundry. Harriet hopes that this loan will help to expand her business and enable her to generate enough profit to send her sons to college.

loans.use: Buy machine for her laundry

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred A. is 59 years old. He is married and has 6 children. He is a farmer. He is hoping for a loan of N50,000 to hire more laborers to clear his farm. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To hire more laborers

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with grown children. She is an entrepreneur from Kahovka where she runs a small business selling women’s clothing in the local city market. Yelena started her business 24 years ago. She took a risk and launched a vending business because she couldn’t find any other way to support her family and feed her children. Yelena worked hard to make her business succeed. Presently, she has 40,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her monthly profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas.

Yelena is seeking a loan of 10,300 Grivnyas to increase her inventory. She works hard to keep her business running in these times of economic recession. However, she stays very optimistic about the future and is willing to work even harder to see her business flourish and develop further.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Koudjoukalo

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’atsanvé non loin d’agoè au nord de la ville de lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente des objets plastiques. Le stock dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de bien vendre et de  subvenir aux charges de sa famille, pour cela elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 03 douzaines de seaux plastiques moyen, 02 douzaines de seaux plastiques grand et 02 douzaine de glacière. Avec ce qu’elle gagne de ce commerce, elle contribue aux charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is married and the mother of three. She lives with her family in the Atsanvé district, not far from Agoè in the north of the city of Lomé. She earns revenues from selling plastic items. The inventory she currently has does not allow her to sell much and to meet family expenses. To do so, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 3 dozen medium-sized plastic buckets, 2 dozen large ones, and 2 dozen coolers (insulated containers). With what she earns from her commerce, she helps with covering household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic products to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 28 años, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace un año se dedica a la atención se sus cabinas de Internet, negocio que implementó para poder solventar sus gastos personales y los de su hogar, ya que sus padres que ya están ancianos. Felizmente, este negocio le permite realizarlo en su propia casa sin tener que salir a las calles a ofrecer alguna mercadería. Por otro lado, también comenta que le resulta un poco esclavizante, ya que debe permanecer ahí todo el día. Aparte de sus cabinas de internet y en el afán de conseguir más ingresos, está planeando comprar golosinas y bebidas para ofrecer a sus clientes cibernautas. Para el fututo, Elizabeth necesita comprar más computadoras, además de tener un servicio de llamadas telefónicas para incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy responsable y puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita complementará su negocio comprando más golosinas y mandará a confeccionar los módulos para su centro de llamadas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 28 years old, single, and lives in her parent's home. For the last year she has dedicated her attention to her internet booths, a business she started to meet her own personal expenses and also those of her home, since her parents are getting older.

Fortunately, this business allows her to work in her own home without going out on the street to sell merchandise. On the other hand, this means the business can feel a bit enslaving, since she must remain there all day. Apart from her internet. Apart from her internet booths, in an attempt to increase her income, she is planning to buy candy and drinks to offer to her internet clients.

For the future, Elizabeth needs to buy more computers. Additionally she would like to have a telephone calling service to increase her profits. This is her second loan with MFP and she has always been very responsible and punctual with her payments. With the money she is asking for she will round out her business by buying more candy and sending the modules for her call center to the manufactures.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sweets and investment in another part of her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margaritas Group

texts.es:
“Margaritas” es un grupo de  trece señoras  y pertenecen al Centro Focal “German Busch”, todas tienen  negocios pequeños como la venta de juguetes, otras cuentan con un taxi conjuntamente con su esposo y requieren el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento a su movilidad y la mayoría se dedica al   tejido de alfombras  y  mantas, por ejemplo Maria Antonia C. de 34 años de edad, confecciona alfombras  hace 10 años, creando siempre nuevos diseños y necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como la lana. 

Su presidenta es Maritza S., cuenta que “Margaritas” es un grupo muy unido y son solidarias entre ellas.
texts.en:
Margaritas is a group of thirteen women and part of the German Busch "centro focal". All of the women own small businesses selling merchandise such as toys. Others operate taxi businesses with their husbands and need loans to maintain their vehicles. Most of them, though, work at making and selling woven textiles such as rugs and blankets. For example, Maria Antonia C., 34, has been making rugs for 10 years, always creating new designs. She needs a loan to buy wool and other raw materials.

The president of the group, Maritza S., says that Margaritas is a close-knit group whose members look out for one another.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and services for a range of businesses.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is 49 years old. He is married and has 9 children. He is a farmer. He is hoping for a loan of N50, 000 to hire more laborers to clear his farm. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To hire more laborers.

loans.name: Atsu

texts.fr: Ce monsieur habite dans le quartier de novissi à Lomé, il est célibataire et exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu pour subvenir à ses besoins le commerce  de boissons locales alcoolisées appelées « DEHA ». Faisant présentement face à une rupture de stock, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 bidons de boissons locales alcoolisées.
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in the Novissi district in Lomé. He is unmarried. And to support himself, he earns revenues from commerce in a local alcoholic beverage called “DEHA”. Presently facing an inventory shortage, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 20 drums of local alcoholic drinks.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alcoholic drinks

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa es una mujer muy emprendedora, tiene 42 años, está felizmente casada y tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 12 años, la casa donde habitan es propia, la cual les costó mucho esfuerzo conseguir. Ella y su esposo trabajan muy duro para poder brindarles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y vieron en los préstamos de MFP una opción para incrementar la producción de su negocio. Desde hace 19 años se dedican a la elaboración de calzado, optaron por esta actividad debido a la experiencia que tuvieron al trabajar en una fábrica de este rubro. Entonces decidieron tener su propio negocio, en el cual les va muy bien. A ambos les agrada esta labor, aunque algunas veces tengan una que otra dificultad, pues no es fácil, ya se requiere de mucha paciencia y muchas horas de dedicación. Felipa está permanentemente comprando mercadería y se traslada al centro de la ciudad, que queda a 2 horas de su hogar en busca de los materiales necesarios para elaborar los zapatos y coordinar los pedidos con sus clientes. Es por ello que no se le ubica en su taller, el cual está instalado en su casa. Por otro lado es su esposo quien permanece trabajando en el taller y es a quien encontramos (en la foto) fabricando los zapatos. Este es el su segundo préstamo individual de Felipa con Microfinanzas PRISMA, ella siempre ha sido muy responsable y puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de cuero, suelas, pasadores, etc., para elaborar más zapatos y satisfacer los pedidos de su clientela.
texts.en:
Felipa is a very enterprising woman. She is 42 years old, happily married, and the mother of 2 children (ages 15 and 12). Her family lives in their own home, which took much effort to build. She and her husband work very hard to provide their children a good quality of life. The loans from MFP were an option to increase production in their business.

For 19 years, they have been making various kinds of footwear. They chose this line of business because they both had previous experience working in a shoe factory. Since deciding to go into business for themselves, they have done very well. Both Felipa and her husband enjoy what they do. Even though they occasionally may be in disagreement, which is never easy, they manage to be patient with each other and put in many hours of work and dedication.

Felipa is continually buying merchandise and moved downtown, which is 2 hours from their home, in search of the necessary materials to produce shoes and to coordinate orders with customers. This is why she is never at the shop, which operates out of their home. In the photo, her husband is seen in their workshop making shoes.

This is Felipa’s second individual loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She has always been very responsible and punctual with her payments. The requested funds will be used to purchase large quantities of leather, soles, pins and other supplies for making shoes so that she can fulfill her customers’ orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur vend les pièces détachées, il a associé à cette activité le commerce des cartes de recharges. La vente de pièces détachées marche bien pour lui car il est le seul à exercer ce commerce dans son quartier ce qui lui permet de bien vendre. Voulant rehausser son stock, il sollicite de WAGES du crédit pour acheter des rouleaux de fils de bobine, divers pièces détachées et des cartes de recharge.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who sells spare parts. He has included with this business the commerce of mobile phone recharge cards. The selling of spare parts is going well for him because he is the only one in this business in his area. This allows him to sell a lot. Wanting to replenish his stock, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy rolls of coil wire, various spare parts, and some recharge cards.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy recharge cards and rolls of coil wire

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora que vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 15 años de edad. Desde hace 20 años, junto a su esposo, se dedica a la elaboración de zapatillas para niños, incursionando en este negocio debido a que notó la rentabilidad de trabajar a pedidos, los cuales le realizan algunos comerciantes del un centro comercial, de donde también adquiere los materiales e insumos para elaborar las zapatillas. Jessica está constemente transladando la mercadería, es por ello que muy pocas veces está en su casa, donde está su taller, mientras su esposo (en la foto) es quien realiza todo el proceso de fabricación. Ellos compran algunas plantillas con novedosos diseños infantiles, los cuales arman en un molde y proceden a pegar y a unir con la suela, dándoles los acabados finales. El negocio es muy rentable, debido a que las zapatillas para niños son muy solicitadas; además, Jessica y su esposo ponen mucho de su esfuerzo y cariño en su trabajo. Su esposo comenta que luego de la ardua tarea se siente gratificado cuando ve las ganancias de la larga jornada, sintiéndose muy útil para el bienestar de su familia. Jessica es una clienta muy antigua en Microfinanzas PRISMA, anteriormente trabajó en bancos comunales, pero este es su primer individual y es muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero de este préstamo comprará más plantillas de zapatillas para niños para elaborar toda la producción del último pedido que le realizaron.
texts.en:
Jessica is 40 years old; she is a hard-working woman and lives with her husband and her two children, who are 12 and 15 years old. For the past 20 years, she and her husband have been making children's shoes, entering this business because they saw the profits that could be made.

They get orders from some shopkeepers in a shopping center, where they also buy the materials they need to make the shoes. Jessica is constantly transporting their merchandise, so she is rarely at home, where their workshop is located. Her husband (in the photo) is the one who does most of the manufacturing of the shoes. They buy insoles with new children's designs, which they put in a mold and glue to the sole, then put the finishing touches on their shoes.

This business is very profitable, since children's shoes are always in demand; in addition, Jessica and her husband put a lot of effort and caring in to their business. Her husband commented that after a hard day of work, he feels gratified when he sees the income from the long day, and he feels very useful in providing for his family's well-being.

Jessica is a long-standing member of PRISMA Microfinances. She previously worked with communal banks, and she has always been punctual in making her payments, but this is her first individual loan. With the money from this loan, she will buy more insoles for children's shoes to make all the shoes from the last order that they received.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make shoes

loans.name: Benkadi 2 De Toura Nabitokan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 2 est composé de femmes mariées du village de Toura Nabitokan de la ville de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et au moins 4 enfants.
Elles ont comme pratique  agricole la culture  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe BENKADI 2 de Toura  Nabitokan ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  le  prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Kimparana  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 2  comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25 000 à 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The BENKADI 2 group is made of married women of the Toura Nabitokan village, in the city of SAN (Ségou Region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), who live in traditional families. They average 48 years of age, and have at least 4 children. Their farming businesses consist in growing peanuts.

Eager to make their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the BENKADI 2 group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago. After having repaid the previous loan without problems, they are now seeking their second farming loan.

This loan will be used to buy, at the grand market in Kimparana, a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Kimparara and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their products, the members of the BENKADI 2 group count on turning a profit of XOF 25000 to 20000 (ca US$ 55 to 45) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es socio del Bancomunal Los Sureños, es casado tiene 44 años, tres hijos de 18, 17 y 11 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Luis es Cuzqueño, desde que llego a Lima  empezó trabajar en un taller de mecánica como ayudante por mas de 10 años, hasta que se independizó, con los ahorros alquilo un local y puso su taller de mecánica, cuenta con una persona que lo ayuda.    
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió como trabajar con los prestamos que recibe.
Luís necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para compra de repuestos, de pernos, soldaduras para su taller de mecánica. 
El sueño de Luís es comprar un carro, para darlo en alquiler, y poder techar su casa.
texts.en:
Luis is a member of the “Los Sureños” (The Southerners) Community Bank. He is 44 years old, married, and has three children. His children are 18, 17, and 11 years old and are studying in public school.

Luis is from Cuzco. Since he arrived in Lima, he began to work as an assistant in a mechanic shop for more than 10 years. Since he became independent, he has rented a place with his savings and has set up a mechanic shop, where he has a helper.

Since becoming part of Finca, he has learned how to work with the loans that he receives.

Luis needs a loan of 800 PEN for the purchase of spare parts, bolts, and welding parts for his mechanic shop.

Luis’ dream is to buy a car so that he can rent it, and to be able to roof his house.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts, bolts, and welding parts for his mechanic shop.

loans.name: Mouri

texts.fr:
Cette femme s’est lancée en 2007 dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle souhaite commencer le commerce de cartes de recharges c’est pour ça qu’elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 50 cartons de cartes de recharges TOGOCELL, 7 cartons de cartes MOOV et 5 cartons de cartes ILLICO.
Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant, avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce, elle contribue aux charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This woman began to sell groceries in 2007. She hopes to begin selling phone cards and that is the reason why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 50 cartons of phone cards for TOGOCELL, 7 cartons of cards MOOV, and 5 cartons of cards of the ILLICO brand.

She is married and the mother of one child. With the earnings from her business, she helps support the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rechargeable phone cards for re-sale

loans.name: Julia Veronica

texts.es:
Julia es socio del Bancomunal Los Sureños, es conviviente tiene 24 años, tres hijos de 9, 3 y 7 meses, solo el mayor esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Julia  no termino el colegio se quedo en tercero de segundaria por que salió embarazada, se puso a trabajar como ambulante vendiendo sandalias en los mercados, pero hace un año y medio decidió alquilar un puesto  en el mercado. y se puso a vender ropa de niño y ropa interior. 
Desde que Julia esta en Finca, aprendió ha ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos. 
Julia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de mercadería ropa interior brasieres.
El sueño de Julia es tener un negocio propio para no pagar alquiler.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the “Los Sureños” (The Southerners) Community Bank. She is 24 years old and has three children who are 9 years old, 3 years old, and 7 months old. Only the oldest is studying in public school.

Julia did not finish high school. She remained in her third year because she left when she was pregnant. She began to work as a street vendor selling sandals in the markets. However, a year and a half ago she decided to rent a space in the market and she began to sell children’s clothing and underwear.

Since Julia became a member of Finca, she has learned to be responsible and punctual in her payments.

Julia needs a loan of 800 PEN for the purchase of merchandise (underwear, bras). Julia’s dream is to have her own business so she doesn’t have to pay rent.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (underwear, bras)

loans.name: Benkadi 2 De Toura Nouakan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 2 est constitué  de femmes mariées du village de Toura Nouakan de la ville de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et au moins  5 enfants. Elles cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe BENKADI 2 de Toura Nouakan ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  le  prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 2 de Toura Nouakan comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25.000 à 15.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The BENKADI 2 group is made of married women of the Toura Nabitokan village, in the city of SAN (Ségou Region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), who live in traditional families. They average 45 years of age, and have at least 5 children. They grow peanuts.

Eager to make their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the BENKADI 2 group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago. After having repaid the previous loan without problems, they are now seeking their second farming loan.

This loan will be used to buy, exclusively at the grand market in Kimparana, a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Kimparara and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their products, the members of the BENKADI 2 group count on turning a profit of XOF 25000 to 15000 (ca US$ 55 to 35) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David W. is a 46-year-old businessman, married to one wife with whom he has three children. His primary business is being a wholesale and retail supplier of potatoes, cabbages, peas, tomatoes and onions in the Kangemi Market near Nairobi. He has been in the business for the past 17 years and is now able to make a monthly profit of about 45,000 Kenyan shillings (about $550).   

David plans to use this loan to boost his primary business and to invest in the timber business. This will be his sixth loan from KADET. Before getting financing from KADET, he never borrowed from another financial institution.

David aspires to expand and grow his business so as to be able to achieve his goals, such as buying a plot of land, building a good permanent house and educating his children to the highest level.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for a wholesale produce business, and to invest in timber sales

loans.name: Lila

texts.es: Lila tiene 51 años, es natural de la ciudad de Piura, al norte de Perú. Llegó a Lima en busca de un mejor porvenir, ahora vive y trabaja junto a su hermana en la venta de productos de belleza. Siendo soltera y sin hijos siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar muy duro, dedicándole todo su tiempo a ello. Sale desde tempranas horas de la mañana a ofrecer los cosméticos de casa en casa de sus vecinas y a cualquier lugar donde tenga oportunidad de venta. A Lila siempre le ha gustado su trabajo, ya que le gusta interactuar con la gente, pues es una persona muy carismática. Ella piensa en grande y quiere progresar, al igual que su hermana, quien es su mano derecha y a quien encontramos en su casa (en la foto) ofreciendo la mercadería de Lila, que generalmente no se le encuentra en casa por las constantes visitas que realiza para ofrecer y cobrar el pago de sus productos. En un futuro cercano, Lila quiere tener un bazar grande donde exhiba toda su mercadería y no tener que salir tanto de casa. Ella es una clienta muy antigua de MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos, además le gusta el trabajo en su banco comunal porque entre todas sus compañeras son muy buenas amigas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para tener en stock, para que tanto ella y su hermana puedan seguir obteniendo buenos ingresos a través de este negocio.
texts.en:
Lila is 51 years of age and comes from the city of Piura in northern Peru. She arrived in Lima in search of a better future. Now she lives and works, along with her sister, selling beauty products. As she is single and has no children, she has always been a hard worker and dedicates most of her time to that. She goes out in the early morning hours from house to house and offers her cosmetic products wherever it is possible to sell them. Lila has always enjoyed her work and she likes to interact with people because she is very charismatic. She has high hopes and she wants to get ahead, just like her sister who is her "right hand" and who we see in her home (in the photo) displaying Lila's merchandise. But usually they are not at home because of the constant trips they are making to in order to take orders and collect payments for their products. In the near future, Lila wants to have a large store where she can display her merchandise and not have to go out all the time. She is a long-standing client of Microfinanzas PRISMA and has always been very punctual in all her payments. She also enjoys working with the communal bank because she and all of her partners are such good friends. The money that she is requesting will be used to buy a larger quantity of beauty products to have on hand so that she and her sister will be able to continue receiving a good income through this business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es: Olimpia tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo Rolando, de 51 años, quien es chofer de taxi, y con su hijo Álvaro de 15 años. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la costura, siendo ésta una de las actividades que más le gusta realizar, Olimpia ofrece sus servicios en uno de los mercados más conocidos del distrito de Puente Piedra, en la ciudad de Lima. Ella elabora prendas de vestir y también trabaja arreglándo ropa a la medida de cada uno de sus clientes, los cuales recurren a ella para subir una basta o achicar alguna talla. Además, en su mismo puesto ha implementado un espacio para la venta de productos naturales, los cuales ofrece en una pequeña vitrina detrás de su máquina de cocer, así logra ingresos que complementan a los que trae su esposo y pueden cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Gracias a su perseverancia y ganas de trabajar, Olimpia está logrando muy bueno frutos, los cuales le dan las fuerzas necesarias para seguir labrándose un futuro mejor, ya que en adelante quiere comprar otro carro con el que también hagan taxi. Este es su noveno préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de tela y productos naturales; además, hará refaccionar el carro de su esposo, ya que está presentando algunos problemas.
texts.en:
Olimpia, 53, lives with her husband, Rolando. He is 51, and he drives a taxi. They also live with their 15 year old son, Álvaro. She has been a seamstress for 20 years. This is one of the activities she most likes to do. Olimpia offers her services in one of the most well known fairs in the Puente Piedra district in the city of Lima. She makes clothing, and she also tailors clothes for each of her customers. They come to her to raise a hem or take in a size. She also has set up space in her place to sell natural products. She has them in a small display case behind her sewing machine. That way she gets income that compliments what her husband earns and can cover the household expenses. Thanks to her perseverance and desire to work, Olimpia has achieved good results. This gives her the necessary strength to keep working for a better future. She would like to buy another car to be used as a taxi. This is her ninth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She has always been very punctual in all of her payments. She will use the money she is asking for to buy a greater quantity of material and natural products. She will also refurbish her husband’s car because it has some problems.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing materials and repair her husband's car

loans.name: Patricia Ynes

texts.es:
Patricia es socio del Bancomunal Los Sureños, es casada tiene dos hijos de 9 y 7 años que están en el escuela estatal.
Patricia  no pudo estudiar por que tenia que trabajar para ayudar a sus hermanos en la alimentación, ella se dedica a las ventas desde que estaba el colegio, ella trabaja por las mañanas cocinando y limpiando y por las tardes cuida aun niño. Y se dedica ala venta  de productos de belleza por catalogo. 
Desde que Patricia esta en Finca ha aprendió ahorrar y a invertir el dinero que recibe del préstamo.
Patricia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo.
El sueño de Patricia es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the Los Sureños Community Bank. She is married and has two children. The children, who are nine and seven, go to the state school. Patricia could not study because she had to work to help feed her siblings. She has been in sales since she was in school. She works in the mornings cooking and cleaning. In the afternoon she takes care of a child. She sells beauty products by catalog. Since Patricia has been with Finca she has learned to save and to invest the money she receives from the loan. Patricia needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy beauty products by catalog. Patricia’s dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products by catalog

loans.name: Benkadi 3 De Toura  Nabitokan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 3 est composé de femmes mariées du village de Toura Nabitokan de la ville de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans, au moins 4 enfants et  cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe BENKADI 3 de  Toura  Nabitokan ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  le  prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 3 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 30 000 à 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The BENKADI 3 group is made of married women of the Toura Nabitokan village, in the city of SAN (Ségou Region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), who live in traditional families. They average 47 years of age, and have at least 4 children. They grow peanuts.

Eager to make their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the BENKADI 3 group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago. After having repaid the previous loan without problems, they are now seeking their second farming loan.

This loan will be used to buy, exclusively at the grand market in Kimparana, a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Kimparara and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their products, the members of the BENKADI 3 group count on turning a profit of XOF 30000 to 25000 (ca US$ 65 to 55) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa en sus actividades como madre y comerciante. Desde que se separó de su pareja se dedicó a atender a sus dos hijos, quienes son ya jóvenes, y junto a ellos vive en la casa que con mucho esfuerzo lograron construir. Elena siempre tuvo en interés de tener un negocio propio y para lograrlo tuvo que trabajar como comerciante ambulante por muchos años, con el paso del tiempo logró ahorrar y pudo instalar una tienda de abarrotes dentro de su casa, para la cual, también sus hijos mayores le ayudaron con el capital necesario para algunos productos. Ahora viene trabajando desde las 6 de la tarde hasta la media noche, pues la demanda en su zona es mayor por las noches y requiere aprovecharla para incrementar y diversificar sus productos. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 5 años con el apoyo de sus hijos y espera que la inversión que han hecho sea muy provechoza, pues una de sus ambiciones es ampliar su local e instalar un bazar donde pueda contar con la variedad de productos que solicitan sus clientes. Este es su octavo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y gracias al banco comunal que integra logró potencias sus aptitudes sociales, ya que el trabajo dentro de su grupo demanda mucha integración entre los miembros. Los 2000 soles que viene solicitando los invertirá en la compra de abarrotes y algunos productos nuevos que desea implementar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking woman who takes her jobs as mother and businesswoman very seriously. After she separated from her husband, she dedicated herself to taking care of her two children who were young at the time. They live together in a house that took much effort to build. Elena always had an interest in having her own business and so she worked as a traveling saleslady for several years. Over time, she saved enough money to buy some products to open a grocery store from her home. The children help with the business.

She works from 6pm to midnight, since demand in her area is greater at night. Her business has to be well-stocked with a diversified line of products. The grocery has been in operation for 5 years, thanks to the support of the children. Elena hopes the investment she has made is worthwhile, because she has ambitions of expanding her shop and opening a bazaar where one can find a variety of products frequently requested by her customers.

This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she thanks her communal bank group for utilizing the power of its social network and demanding cooperation among the members. Her loan of 2000 soles will be used to buy groceries and other new products that she would like to introduce into her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es una mujer de 36 años, su afán de progreso la llevaron a potenciar sus capacidades comerciales en beneficio de su familia, pues sus hijos son su mayor motivador. Elegir la venta de productos naturales ha sido una de las mejores decisiones que tomó, ya que  estos productos son muy solicitados debido a sus propiedades curativas, por lo que es un negocio muy rentable. Para obtener mayores pedidos, Julia sale a ofrecer sus productos de casa en casa a sus clientes, siendo largas horas de caminata pues recorre varios lugares de su ciudad, regresando a altas horas de la noche a su casa. Por ello, para evitar estas caminatas, Julio desea invertir en la instalación de una tienda naturista en su casa, ya que la empresa con la que trabaja le puede brindar facilidades de pago para obtener grandes cantidades de productos y espera aprovechar esta oportunidad. Este es su octavo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, en su banco comunal, lo que más le agrada es el esfuerzo que cada miembro realiza para el progreso de su grupo. Con los 2000 soles que ahora solicita incrementará su capital de trabajo para obtener mayor cantidad de productos.
texts.en:
Julia is a 36 year-old woman. Her family’s welfare drives her to maximize her business capacity. Her children are her primary motivation. Her choice to sell natural products has been one of the best decisions that she has made. These products are very much in demand because of their curative properties. It is a profitable business. To obtain the most requests for her products, Julia sells them door to door to her customers. She works long hours selling her products in various neighborhoods in the city. She returns to her house late at night. In order to stop working such late hours, Julia would like to install a permanent natural products store at her house. In this way she can buy a larger quantity of products from the company that she represents. This is her eighth loan with PRISMA Microfinance, a cooperative bank. She is most thankful for the effort that each member makes towards the progress of the group. With the 200 soles that she seeks she will increase her working capital so that she can buy a greater quantity of products.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Trust In God Group

texts.en:
Stephen B., 45 years old, is married and the father of four children. One is in elementary school, two are in the junior high school, and the eldest works as a trader. Stephen is an auto mechanic. He learned his skills and received his training in Kumasi, and he has been servicing vehicles for 18 years. Thanks to his hard work and sense of commitment, many people service their cars at his garage. His primary problem has to do with maintaining adequate funds, as he pre-finances most of the work. He is requesting a loan to buy auto parts so he can meet his customers' expectations.

Stephen is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Trust in God.’ He is the one standing at the back in the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell their wares at the local market square. Some of them journey to other towns to sell their goods on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for loans to help them procure more goods so to be able to expand their businesses.

In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy auto parts for his vehicle repair business

loans.name: Oscar Leopoldo

texts.es:
Oscar es socio del Bancomunal  Los Sureños, es casado tiene tres hijos de 11 6 y 4 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Oscar trabaja en construcción civil, pero no siempre hay trabajo, decidió llevar cursos de chocolatería, aprendió hacer chocotejas y las vende en las tiendas y mercados de su barrio diario vende 150 chocotejas, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa y su hija.
Desde que Oscar esta en Finca, su capital aumentado, tiene mas mercadería. 
Oscar necesita un préstamo de 600 soles, para la compra de una batidora para hacer kekes.
El sueño de Oscar es poner una panadería.
texts.en:
Oscar is a member of the Community Bank "Los Suenos". He is married and has three children, aged 11, 6 and 4 years old. They are attending the community school.

Oscar is a construction worker but there isn't always work for him. He decided to attend chocolatier courses and he learned how to make chocolates. He sells them to stores and in the neighbourhood markets. Daily he sells 150 chocolates. His wife and daughter help him with his business.

Since Oscar has been with Finca (Kiva Field Partner) his capital has been increasing and he has more merchandise.

Oscar requires a loan in the amount of 600 soles to purchase an electric mixer to make cakes. Oscar's dream is to set up a bakery.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an electric mixer to make cakes

loans.name: Benkadi 4 De Toura Nabitokan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 4 est composé de femmes mariées du village de Toura Nabitokan de la ville de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans, au moins 4 enfants et  cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Benkadi 4 de Toura  Nabitokan ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  le  prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 4 de Toura Nabitokan comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 30 000 à 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The BENKADI 4 group is made of married women of the Toura Nabitokan village, in the city of SAN (Ségou Region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), who live in traditional families. They average 47 years of age, and have at least 4 children. They grow peanuts.

Eager to make their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the BENKADI 4 group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago. After having repaid the previous loan without problems, they are now seeking their second farming loan.

This loan will be used to buy, exclusively at the grand market in Kimparana, a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Kimparara and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their products, the members of the BENKADI 4 group count on turning a profit of XOF 30000 to 20000 (ca US$ 65 to 45) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Sr. De Ccoyllority Cachimayo Group

texts.es:
Este es el banco comunal “SR. D. CCOYLLORITY CACHIMAYO”, Los miembros D. este banco son originarios del distrito D. Cachimayo, ubicado a 40 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Los socios alternan sus actividades del hogar con la ganadería y la agricultura en primer orden, después se dedican al comercio minorista, algunos socios tienen una tienda D. abarrotes, otros venden celulares y zapatos en el centro comercial paraíso en Cusco, otros socias tienen una tienda D. locería ellas venden ollas, platos, vasos y demás; otro grupo D. socias venden leche fresca que sus vacas producen, una tiene restaurante, y otros 2 socios trabajan brindando el servicio D. taxi. Para lo cuál requieren el préstamo para poder reinvertir en sus diferentes actividades y continuar con el progreso económico D. sus hogares.

Nuestros socios se encuentran muy agradecidos y valoran el apoyo prestado debido a que en este distrito la banca financiera es escasa, del mismo modo se comprometen a cumplir eficientemente y disciplinadamente con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This is the Sr. D. Ccoyllority Cachimayo community bank. The members of this bank are natives of the Cachimayo district, some 40 minutes from the city of Cusco.

The members alternate their work at home with businesses, mostly farming and raising livestock which they then sell, but other members operate groceries or sell cell-phone serices or footwear in Cusco's Paraiso shopping area. Still other members have a "loceria" [don't know--might be loncheria or snack bar] store where they sell pots, plates, drinking glasses and so on. Another group of members sells fresh milk straight from their own cows. One member owns a restaurant and 2 others operate taxi services. They need loans so that they can invest in their different businesses and continue to improve their economic well-being.

Our members are grateful for the help the loans offer them in a region where bank financing isn't widely available. They are committed to being disciplined about repaying the debt within the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 De Toura  Nouakan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 4  est constitué de femmes mariées du village de Toura Nouakan de la ville de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, au moins 6 enfants et  cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe BENKADI 4 de TOURA NOUAKAN ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  le  prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 4  comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35 000 à 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The BENKADI 4 group is made of married women of the Toura Nabitokan village, in the city of SAN (Ségou Region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), who live in traditional families. They average 35 years of age, and have at least 6 children. They grow peanuts.

Eager to make their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the BENKADI 4 group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago. After having repaid the previous loan without problems, they are now seeking their second farming loan.

This loan will be used to buy, exclusively at the grand market in Kimparana, a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Kimparara and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their products, the members of the BENKADI 4 group count on turning a profit of XOF 35000 to 20000 (ca US$ 78 to 45) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Union Costaneras Group

texts.es: Inocencia C. es una de las más antiguas integrantes del grupo “Unión Costaneras” ,con 63 años de edad, hace 6 años que administra el negocio de tejido y venta de aguayos (telas coloridas confeccionadas artesanalmente)  y necesita el préstamo para la compra de lana de oveja y tintes. Al igual que Inocencia, sus compañeras tienen diferentes negocios pequeños como la venta de ropa, paraguas, sombreros, medias, mantas, verduras, queso, carne y tienda de barrio, todas aseguran que necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería y tener variados productos que ofertarle a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Inocencia C. is one of the oldest members of the Union Costaneras group. At 63 years old, she has operated a textile business for 6 years, selling "aguayos" (a traditional hand-made, brightly-colored fabric). She needs the loan to buy sheep's wool and dyes. Inocencia's fellow members have a range of small businesses selling clothes, umbrellas, hats, socks, blankets, produce, cheese, meat and everyday grocery items. All of them need loans to buy merchandise that they will then resell to their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Obotantim Group

texts.en:
Comfort F., 36 years old, is the divorced mother of a daughter, who is currently in school. Comfort is a committed, creative, and hardworking single mother who is prepared to work hard to provide for her child. She is a trader and trades in grocery products like skimmed milk, rice, bags of sugar, and cartons of vegetable oil, as well as offering boxes of body lotions, hair creams, and so on. She started her business seven years ago. She is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Obotantim,’ which translates as 'Solid Rock.' Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. They are requesting a loan to upgrade their businesses in order to increase sales. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es socio del Bancomunal Los Sureños, es conviviente tiene 25 años, dos hijos de 5 y 1 años el mayor esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Miguel no terminó de estudiar en la escuela por motivos económicos, tenia que trabajar, consiguió trabajo como cobrador de combi, gracias a un amigo lograr comprarse  una moto-car. lo da en alquiler y el hace taxi en un carro alquilado.   
Desde que miguel esta en Finca, es mas responsable aprendió a invertir bien el dinero del préstamo.
Miguel necesita un préstamo de 600 soles, para comprar llantas a su moto-car.
El sueño de Miguel es comprarse un carro para dar servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
Miguel is a member of the Community Bank "Los Suenos". He is 25 years old and lives with his common-law wife. They have two children, aged 5 and 1 years old. The eldest is attending the community school.

Miguel did not complete his schooling due to a lack of financial resources. He was forced to start work, and he started working in a bus collecting fares. Thanks to a friend he later managed to buy a motorcycle taxi of his own. He rents it out and he himself rents a car to provide taxi services.

Since Miguel has been with Finca (Kiva Field Partner) he has learned to be more responsible and he has learned to invest the loans allocated to him.

Miguel requires a loan of 600 soles to purchase new tires for his motorcycle. Miguel's dream is to purchase a car to use as a taxi.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new tires for his motorcycle.

loans.name: La Bendicion Group 4

texts.en:
Marta M., in the center, is the group leader of La Bendicion (or The Blessing). This group lives in a batey, which is a commune created by sugar companies as a place for the sugar cane harvesters and their families to live. Unfortunately, the sugar industry has dwindled and there is no more work in the fields. Many of these bateys, including this one, have become shanty towns, rampant with unemployment. However, the enterprising group of people in La Bendicion decided to start their own businesses to support their families.

Marta is the 31-year-old mother of eight children. She took out a loan three years ago to start her own business selling clothes. Before taking out the loan, she did not have a job and had to depend completely on her husband, who works in construction. With the extra income from her new business, she has been able to send all of her children to school.

Marta is asking for another loan to procure more inventory so that she can sell larger quantities of clothes. She hopes that one day she can grow her business enough to be able to send her children to college.

On behalf of Marta and the entire La Bendicion group, thank you for providing opportunity to those who need it most!

loans.use: To buy new clothes to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 5 De Toura Nabitokan Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 5  est un groupe de  femmes mariées du village de Toura Nabitokan de la ville de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans, au moins 4 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe BENKADI 5 de TOURA  NABITOKAN ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  le  prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 5 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 30 000 à 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The BENKADI 5 group is made of married women of the Toura Nabitokan village, in the city of SAN (Ségou Region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), who live in traditional families. They average 47 years of age, and have at least 4 children. They grow peanuts.

Eager to make their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the BENKADI 5 group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago. After having repaid the previous loan without problems, they are now seeking their second farming loan.

This loan will be used to buy, exclusively at the grand market in Kimparana, a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Kimparara and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their products, the members of the BENKADI 5 group count on turning a profit of XOF 30000 to 25000 (ca US$ 65 to 55) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Happy Group

texts.en:
Deborah O., 25 years old, is married and the mother of a child, who attends school. Deborah is an achiever and works tirelessly to help her husband provide food for the family. Because of her hard work, she was elected the group leader. The group was given the name ‘Happy’ trust bank. She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph.

Deborah prepares and sell cakes to her customers. She mostly vends her wares at the community market. Most of her fellow group members are also petty traders in the market. She is requesting the loan to buy a bulk supply of goods in order to enhance her profit. She dreams of providing better care for her child from the increased business proceeds. In her group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk for her cake vending business.

loans.name: Ndung'u

texts.en:
Ndung'u N. is a married businessman with two children. He owns a carpentry shop at the Kangemi Shopping Center in a middle- and low-income estate on the outskirts of the city of Nairobi. He has been running the business for the past seven years and now makes a monthly profit of about 7,500 Kenyan shillings (about $95).

Ndung'u plans to use this loan as working capital to buy raw materials for his workshop. He learned about KADET through his friends who are also members of his borrowing group at KADET. Ndung'u hopes to grow his business and to eventually be able to buy more of his own tools, such as a circular saw.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To obtain working capital to buy raw materials for carpentry.

loans.name: Justina Angelica

texts.es:
Justina es socio del Bancomunal Los Sureños.
Justina es conviviente tiene 29 años, cuatro hijos de 12, 10 y 4 años que están estudiando en el escuela estatal y su ultimo hijo  de 9 meses.
Justina no termino la escuela, por que salio embarazada, se puso a trabajar como empleada en casas, junto su plata y sus hermanos que están en el negocio de  moto-car., le animaron que se comprara una moto-car el cual lo da en alquiler, pero ella sigue trabajando limpiando  en casas.
Desde que Justina esta en Finca, aprendió a valorar el trabajo, el dinero, aprendió aprovechar las oportunidades de trabajo que se le presenten. 
Justina necesita un préstamo de  800 soles, para la compra de llantas para su moto-car.
 El sueño de Justina  es seguir trabajando hasta que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the Communtiy Bank "Los Suenos".

Justina lives with her partner and she is 29 years old. They have four children, aged 12, 10, and 4 years old. They are all attending the community school. The youngest is a baby of 9 months.

Justina did not complete her schooling because she became pregnant. She started work as a maid in private homes. But she saved her money and because her brothers have motorcycle taxis they encouraged her to buy one and rent it out. She did so but she is still providing maid services.

Ever since Justina has been with Finca (Kiva Field Partner) she learned the value of work and the value of money. she learned to take advantage of opportunities that present themselves.

Justina requires a loan in the amount of 800 soles to buy new tires for her motorcycle taxi.

Justina's dream is to keep working to see her children grow up to have a career.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new tires for her motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 54 years old, is divorced and has four children who are all still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Techiman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.

Mary is a trader. She deals in textile materials, primarily selling ready-made clothes and lace materials. She sells at the market square and also hawks her wares in the neighborhood.

Mary has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy more textile goods. She aspires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Agyenkwa Group

texts.en:
Mary is 45 and is married with seven children, all of whom are in school. Mary started her fish business thirteen years ago.  Many people buy from her in the market place in her town. She prepares and serves her customers very tasty fish and for that reason she is a favorite of many. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She wants a loan to buy increased stocks of assorted fresh fishes, in order to have increased sales and income to support her children's education and her business growth. In the photograph she is the one sitting second from the right, in the brown dress. 

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Agyenkwa’, which literally means Saviour. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They request the loan to upgrade their business to increase sales. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and for peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk fish

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience T. is 43 and is married. She has four children who are all still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Techiman in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She is a trader who sells textile materials. She sells ready-made clothes and lace materials at the market square and also in her community. Patience has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy more textile goods to increase her stock. She aspires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 41, married and has four children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Martha is a trader who sells cereals such as maize. She sells in the market square and also supplies food vendors in her community. Martha has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy maize in bulk. She aspires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Zuara

texts.en: Zuara is 45, married and has three children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Zuara is a trader who sells cereals such as maize. She sells at the market square and also supplies food vendors in her community. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy maize in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Adom Wowim Group

texts.en:
Lawrence T. is 25. He is married and has two beautiful girls who are in school. He works hard to provide for his children. He is an auto mechanic in his community. He started providing maintenance for his clients five years ago and acquired his skills from his competent master in Kumasi. Because of his rich experience he has attracted lots of customers who come to his garage to service their cars. His only challenge is that he pre-finances most of the work before his customers pay him. He said this has helped him maintain lots of customers. With the loan he wants to buy engine parts like jack plugs, gaskets, etc. 

He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Adom wowim’. He is the only male and is sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and for peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy auto parts

loans.name: Dios Todo Lo Puede 2 Group

texts.en:
Nicolasa M. (pictured above in red) used to be a housewife, until she got a divorce. Now she has her own business. Her kids are still her priority and she insists on calling them her babies, even though they are now 13 and 14. She received a loan with Esperanza two years ago and with that began her business. Nicolasa sells health, beauty, and basic hygiene products from her home; in that way she can still be close to her kids. She lives in Barrio Lindo in San Pedro D. Macoris. Even though translated it means Beautiful neighborhood. Barrio Lindo can have its troubles. To name the most prominent ones, there is no constant running water - sometimes the town is left three to four days without water.  Electricity goes out unpredictably every day,  sometimes for a few hours but sometimes for half a day, and crime has risen so much that you cannot walk by yourself after it gets dark. Yet with all those circumstances Nicolasa’s business has proven to be successful. She is now on her third loan with Esperanza and is quite satisfied with her steady income. She laughs and smiles at me, confessing that she wishes her business can keep on gaining momentum because one day she hopes to own her own car. 

Please strongly consider loaning to Nicolasa.  She is diligent and deserves an opportunity to grow her business and eventually own her own car. Esperanza thanks you for your time and consideration.

Maira Flores
Summer Intern ‘09

loans.use: to purchase Amway health products, cosmetics, and hygiene products to grow her home business

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita, es separada tiene 37 años, no tiene hijos.
