Luz es secretaria ejecutiva  trabaja en una asociación que vende seguros  de vehículos, ella por su parte se dedica a la venta y compra de moto-car.
Desde que Luz esta en Finca aprendió a llevar la administración de su negocio, a invertir, a sacar su ganancia. 
Luz necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles,  para la compra de de una moto-car.
El sueño de Luz es tener una tienda para venta de repuestos y motos
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Community Bank "Melcochita". She is 37 years old, she is separated and she has no children.

Luz works as an executive secretary for a car insurance company. Aside from that she also works as a buyer and seller of motorcycle cars.

Since Luz has been with Finca (Kiva Field Partner) she has learned to better administer her business and she has learned to invest wisely.

Luz requires a loan in the amount of 2600 soles to purchase a new motorcycle car. Luz's dream is to have a store to sell spare parts for motorcycles.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle car.

loans.name: Huzaima

texts.en: Huzaima is 35,  is married and has four children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Techiman in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She is a trader who sells clothes. Huzaima sells at the market square and in her community. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy more textile goods to increase her stock. She aspires to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita.
Doris es separada tiene 42 años, tiene un hijo de 11 años que estudia en la escuela estatal. 
Doris trabajaba en una joyería pero la dueña murió y la joyería cerro se quedo sin trabajo y se dedico a la venta de productos de belleza  por catalogo hasta llegar a ser líder zonal, actualmente tiene  a su cargo ochenta vendedoras. Tiene en las ventas nueve años.
Desde que Doris esta en Finca aprendió a como controlar su negocio y como hacerlo crecer.
Doris necesita un préstamo de  3000 soles, para productos  de belleza por catalogo, 
El sueño de Doris es comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the Community Bank "Melcochita".

Doris is separated and she is 42 years old. She has an 11-year old son who is attending the community school.

Doris used to work in a jewelery store but the owner passed away and the store closed down. She was left without work so she decided to start selling beauty products through catalogue. She has since become the regional leader and has in her team eight other sellers. She has been in sales for the past nine years.

Ever since Doris has been with Finca (Kiva Field Partner) she has learned to better administer her business and now knows how to make it grow.

Doris requires a loan in the amount of 3000 soles to purchase beauty products through a catalogue. Doris' dream is to buy a car.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products through a catalogue.

loans.name: Fuente De Bendicion Group 5

texts.en:
Diser (pictured center) is the group leader of the solidarity group Fuente de Bendicion (or Fountain of Hope). This group is requesting their first loan, in order to start or improve their own businesses. The members of this group are all neighbors who live in the coastal town of Sabana de la Mar in the northern part of the Dominican Republic.

Diser is the youngest of the group at age 19, but her work ethic and business savvy have led her friends to choose her as their leader. Her mother started a salon some years ago and now Diser is running it herself. She will use this loan to buy beauty products such as nail polish and hair products. She says she is very excited because she loves her job and looks forward to increasing the number of customers. 

Diser is is not married and has no children, which allows her to put a lot of time into her business. She hopes to build her business up enough so that she can support a family sometime in the future.

On behalf of Diser and the entire Fuente de Bendicion group, thank you for providing opportunities to those who need them most!

loans.use: Beauty supplies such as nail polish and hair products

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina  es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita 
Marina es casada tiene 47 años, tres hijos de 28, 21 y  7 años que esta en la escuela estatal.
Marina  tenia su bodega en su casa, la tuvo que cerrar por que  se enfermo y ya no podía atender;   se dedico a tejer chompas a mano para una empresa que exportadora por cuatro  años, hasta que le empezó a doler la espalda  y dejo de tener. Su esposo le regalo una maquina tejedora, se capachito con charlas de cómo hacer chompas, ella vende a los puestos de mercado y a sus vecinas     
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a  llevar sus cuentas entradas salidas y a guardar su capital.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la  compra de una maquina ovilladota, y para la compra de lanas.
El sueño de Marina es crecer en su negocio hasta llegar a exportar a otro país.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Melcochita cooperative bank. Marina is married, 47 years old, and has three children ages 28, 21, and 7 in the public school. Marina had a general store in her home; she had to close it because she became ill and could no longer tend to it. She made hand-knit sweaters for an export company for four years, until her back started to hurt and she had to stop. Her husband gave her a knitting machine, which allowed her to take on projects such as sweaters, which she sells to posts in the market and to neighbors. Since she has been in Finca, she has learned how to track her earnings and expenditures, and how to safeguard her capital. Marina needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy a yarn spinning/winding machine and wools. Marina’s dream is to grow her business until she exports her products to another country.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a yarn spinning/winding machine and wools.

loans.name: Benkadi 7 De Toura Nabitokan Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 7 est un groupe de six  de femmes  toutes mariées du village de Toura Nabitokan de la ville de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 23 ans, 3 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe BENKADI 7 de TOURA NABITOKAN ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  le  prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 7 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25.000 à 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses  courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The BENKADI 7 group is made of six married women of the Toura Nabitokan village, in the city of SAN (Ségou Region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), who live in traditional families. They average 23 years of age and 3 children. They grow peanuts.

Eager to make their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the BENKADI 7 group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago. After having repaid the previous loan without problems, they are now seeking their second farming loan.

This loan will be used to buy, exclusively at the grand market in Kimparana, a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Kimparara and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their products, the members of the BENKADI 7 group count on turning a profit of XOF 25000 to 20000 (ca US$ 55 to 45) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en: Kofi is 46 and is married. He and his wife have 3 children who are all still in school.  He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Kofi is a trader who sells polythene bags. He sells in the market square and also treks to sell in other communities. Kofi has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy more polythene bags to increase his stock. He aspires to give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy polythene bags

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita.
Lucy es casada tiene 48 años tiene 5 hijos que son mayores y  trabajan.
Lucy trabajaba cociendo en su casa por muchos años, dejo por que la confección empezó a bajar las clientas preferían ropa hecha y ella decidió vender productos de belleza por catalogo y también da servicio de impresión en su casa.
Desde que Luz esta en Finca  aprendió  la importancia de ahorrar 
Lucy necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles para la compra de una impresora 
El sueño de Lucy es comprar una moto-car, para darlo en alquiler.
texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the Melcochita cooperative bank. Lucy is married, 48 years old, and has 5 children that are grown and working. Lucy worked cooking in her home for many years, but she stopped because demand waned and her customers preferred hand-made clothing. She decided to start selling beauty products by catalog and also offering printing services in her home. Since Lucy has been with Finca, she has learned the importance of saving. Lucy needs a loan of 1,600 soles to buy a printer. Lucy’s dream is to buy a moto-car to rent out for additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a printer.

loans.name: Fear Not Group

texts.en:
Ernestina is 29. She is divorced and has two children; one is in school and the other is still breastfeeding. As a single mother, responsibility for her family rests on her shoulders. For that reason she is serious about her business. She prepares pastries such as meat pies and sells them on the streets. She started selling four years ago and has seen a dramatic improvement in her business. She requests a loan to buy flour, sugar, margarine etc., to produce pastries in larger quantities

Based on her commitment and hard work she was made the group leader of a trust bank group called ‘Fear Not’. She is the one squatting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and for peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy margarine, flour, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: July

texts.es:
July es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita. 
July es madre soltera tiene 30 años, una hija de 8 años que estudia en la escuela estatal.
July  estudio contabilidad  en el instituto Gilda y termino decidió poner un negocio de venta de lubricantes  pero no le fue bien por que daba mucho crédito, traspaso su negocio a otra persona.
Nuevamente decidió poner un negocio esta vez con su hermana, de venta de carne de res  y  vacuno actualmente tienen cuatro años vendiendo. 
Desde que July esta en Finca los préstamos han sido de mucha ayuda para capitalizarse, siente que es un respaldo.   
July necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles para la compra de carne de res de carnero. 
El sueño de July es comprar un puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
July is a member of the Melcochita cooperative bank. July is a 30-year old single mother, and has one daughter who is 8 years old and in public school. July completed her accounting studies at the Gilda Institute. She decided to start a business selling lubricants, but it did not go well for her because she gave out too much credit. She transferred her business to someone else. She decided to start another business selling beef, in partnership with her sister, which she has been doing for four years. Since July has been with Finca, the loans have been a great help in capitalizing her business and a great support. July needs a loan of 3,000 soles to buy meat. July’s dream is to buy a stall at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat.

loans.name: Rahinatu

texts.en: Rahinatu is forty-six years old. She is married and has eight children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She cooks the food at her residence and sells by the road side in the day time. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from Kumasi market. Rahinatu has been in business for over thirty years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice in bulk. She aspires to give her children good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Bony

texts.es:
Bonny es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita.
Bonny es conviviente tiene 39 años, tiene  un hijo de 19 años que esta estudiando educación superior.
Bonny trabajaba en un mercado vendiendo en un puesto hasta que salio embarazada y decidió dedicarse a las ventas de  de golosinas  en un modulo que la municipalidad le ha dado, ella tiene quince años  vendiendo golosinas 
Desde que Bonny  esta en Finca  aprendió a manejar su dinero y a ser responsable con los pagos.
Bonny necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles, para la compra de golosinas, va comprar una  vitrina, exhibidores para gaseosas.  
El sueño de Bonny es tener una tienda de bazar o una  panadería  en su casa.
texts.en:
Bonny is a member of the Melcochita Community Bank. Bonny is 39 and in a common law marriage. She has a 19 year old son who attends the university. Until she became pregnant, Bonny used to work selling at a stand in the market. She decided to sell sweets from a stand that the municipality gave her. She has been selling sweets for 15 years. Since Bonny has been with Finca, she has learned to manage her money and to be responsible with her payments. Bonny needs a loan for 2,200 PEN to buy sweets, a display case, and refrigerated display cases for soft drinks. Bonny’s dream is to have a store or bakery in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets, a display case, and refrigerated display cases for soft drinks

loans.name: Doris Monica Achungo

texts.en:
Doris K. is a business lady in Vihiga Town, Western Kenya. She is 33 years old, married, and has two school-going children. To make a living, Doris owns and operates a boutique in Majengo Market.

She sells mainly new clothing for adults and children. Apart from clothing, she also sells jewellery to female clients. Doris has been engaged in her business for more than eight years and earns approximately 15,000 Kenyan shillings (about $190 U.S.) a month in profit.

Doris had tried to access business capital from an informal welfare group in her locality, which disintegrated due to mismanagement. It was at this point that she learned about KADET from another lady friend who was an existing KADET client. Doris joined KADET to gain access to financial services so she could better engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings. This will be her fifth loan from KADET.

In future, her hope is to invest and buy land, and build a residential house for her family.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock.

loans.name: Mari

texts.en: Mari is forty years old. She is married and has six children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Mari is a trader. She deals in cereals, such as maize. She sells at the market square and also supplies to food vendors in her community. She buys bags of maize from the nearby communities. Mari has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy maize in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Happy Family Group

texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old and married. She is a plantain seller and sells at the community market where she lives. She obtains her stock of goods from the surrounding villages and retails them to her customers. She lives with her husband, who is usually able to help her buy her plantain stock, but recently there has been a fall in demand in his business and he has not been able to provide her with enough money to make her purchases. Due to inadequate capital, she is not able to pick enough plantains from her suppliers. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy plantain stock. With her two years of selling experience, she was chosen to be the group leader.

Mary is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Happy Family.’ She is the one sitting in the middle of the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of plantains

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia  es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita.
Cecilia es casada  tiene 47 años tiene  cinco hijos de 28- 22, 20, 18 y 14 años  este ultimo esta estudiando en  la escuela estatal. 
Cecilia  es de Huancavelica llego a Lima, se dedico a cuidar a sus hijos, pero vio la necesidad económica en su casa y  se puso a trabajar en la cachina, ella junta por las noches  botellas,  fieros, reciclaje y los vende en la cachina, también se  dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo.
Desde que Cecilia esta en Finca aprendió a ahorrar y valorar el dinero.
Cecilia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la  compra de productos de belleza por catalogo.
El sueño de Cecilia es tener un puesto para venta  de  fruta.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a member of the Melcochita Community Bank. Cecilia is 47, married and has five children; 28, 22, 20, 18, and 14. The last one attends the state school. Cecilia is from Huancavelica. She came to Lima and spent her time taking care of her children. But, she saw the economic need in her house, and she went to work at the “cachina” (used goods market). In the evenings she gathers bottles, metal, and recyclables. She sells them at the cachina. She also sells beauty products by catalog. Since Cecilia has been with Finca, she has learned to save and value money. Cecilia needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy beauty products by catalog. Cecilia’s dream is to have a fruit selling stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products by catalog

loans.name: Nyame Naye Group

texts.en:
Belinda started her fish business five years ago in the market of the town where she lives. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty fish in the market. She buys stocks of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Many people buy from her in the marketplace. She is 28 years old and single, and she currently lives in a rented apartment. She is requesting a loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fresh fish to allow for increased sales and income. She is the one standing at the back in the group photograph.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame Aye,’ which means "God has done it." Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. They request the loan to upgrade their businesses in order to increase sales. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es  socia del Bancomunal Melcochita.
Maria es Viuda tiene 44 años, cuatro hijos el menos tiene 14 años que esta en al escuela estatal.
Maria  empezó a trabajar en casas cocinando por varios años, ahorro hasta poner una bodega  en su casa hace dos años, pero igual ella sigue saliendo a trabajar en casa mientras que su hija se queda  atendiendo al publico.  
DesD. que Maria esta en Finca aprendió a  valorar el dinero que tiene en sus manos y a ser responsable con  el pago del préstamo.  
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles, para surtir su bodega, aceite arroz, azúcar y leche.
El sueño D. Maria es que su negocio crezca más y abrir un restaurante por que le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank “Melcochita.” She is a 44 year old widow and mother of four children, the youngest of whom is 14 and a student in the state school. After having worked as a cook in private homes for several years, Maria had saved enough to open a small grocery store in her home. Her store has been open for two years but she continues to work as a cook while her daughter watches the store. Maria has learned to value the money she has and to make her loan payments responsibly. She needs a loan of 1,600 soles to stock her grocery store with oil, rice, sugar, and milk. Maria hopes to grow her business and open a restaurant because she likes cooking.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock small grocery store with oil, rice, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José  es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita. 
José es casado tiene 62 años, tres hijos mayores de 25, 22 y 19 años que trabajan y estudian.
José es Ayacuchano trabajando en varios cosas,  en amigo de los animales por seis años pero se canso y empezó a trabajar en una carpa en venta de caldo de gallina como ayudante, aprendió el movimiento del negocio   y con lo que tenia ahorrado puso su propio negocio de caldo de gallina actualmente cuenta con dos personas que le ayudan.  
Desde que José esta en Finca, aprendió a invertir ha recibido mucha orientación en el negocio.
José necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para comprar arroz, fideos, gallina huevos.
El sueño de José es prosperar y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
José is a member of Melcochita community bank. He is 62 years old, married, and has 3 grown children (ages 25, 22, and 19) that work and are in school. José is from Ayacucho. He has had various jobs; he worked with the non-profit organization Amigo de los Animales (Friend of Animals) for 6 years but got tired and began to work at a tent selling chicken broth. He worked as an assistant in order to learn the business, and with his savings started his own business selling borth. Currently, he employs 2 assistants. Since José began working with Finca, he has learned to invest and has received a lot of guidance in running a business. He needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to buy rice, pasta, and eggs. José's dream is to be successful and have his own store space.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, pasta, chicken eggs

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina  es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita.
Marina es  casada tiene 46 años, tiene 4 hijos de 25, 22, 14 y 9 años los dos últimos están en la escuela estatal.
Marina con su esposo han puesto una panadería, el  trabajaba como ayudante en una panaderías, ellos decidieron poner una panadería recibieron capacitaciones de cómo hacer  diferentes clases de pan y pasteles, también ella  trabaja vendiendo salchi-papas en la puerta de su casa por las noches
Desde que Marina  aprendió a evaluar en que negocio se puede invertir. 
Marina necesita un préstamo de  1800 soles, para la compra de materiales para hacer pan, harina, papas, aceite. 
El sueño de Marina es que su negocio crezca para poner otra panadería.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of Melcochita community bank. She is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children (ages 25, 22, 14, and 9). The 2 youngest attend public school. Marina and her husband own a bakery. Her husband used to work as a bakery assistant before they decided to start their own business. They received training on how to make different types of bread and cake. Marina also used to work selling salchipapas (french fries and sausage, served as fast food) from her home in the evenings. Since then, Marina has learned to evaluate which business opportunities to invest in. She needs a loan of 1,800 PEN to buy ingredients for bread, such as flour, potatoes, and oil. Her dream is that her business will grow enough to start another bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make bread: flour, potatoes, oil

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria  es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita 
Maria es casada tiene 58 años cuatro hijos de 33, 29,25 y 22 años que trabajan.
Maria siempre se dedico a su casa, pero su sobrina la animo para que venda productos de belleza por catalogo, ella es vendedora hace cinco años y le esta yendo bien. 
Desde que Maria esta en Finca  aprendió ahorra, a ser solidaria con las personas, y a ser amiga.
Maria necesita un préstamo de  1200 soles, para invertirlos en productos de belleza.
El sueño de Maria es crecer en las ventas y llegar a tener un cargo en la empresa  donde trabaja.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Melcochita Community Bank. Maria is married, is 58 year old, and has 4 children, who are 33, 29, 25, and 22 years old and are working. Maria has always been dedicated to her house, but her niece motivated her to sell beauty products by catalogue. She has been a vendor for five years, and it is going well. Since Maria has been with Finca, she has learned to save, to be in a solidary agreement with people, and to be a friend. Maria needs a loan for 1200 soles to invest in beauty products. Maria’s dream is to grow her sales and to have a position in the business where she works.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in beauty products

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia  es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita.
Eugenia es casada tiene 8 hijos el menor tiene 15 años y esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Eugenia  vendía golosinas en el tiempo de verano en  las calle,  en el invierno estaba en su casa y una vecina le animo para que entrara al negocio de reciclado, ella sale todas las noches  de 7 a 11 p.m. a recoger cosas y al día siguiente lo lleva a vender a un deposito  de reciclaje, también  ella  compra  reciclaje a otras personas.
Desde que Eugenia esta en Finca  aprendió administrar su negocio y trabajar la plata.
Eugenia  necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para  la compra de reciclaje, todo lo que le lleven a vender.    
El sueño de Eugenia es tener su bodega, ya esta comprando un aparador.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Melcochita Community Bank. Eugenia is married and has 8 children. The youngest is 15 years old and is in a state school. Eugenia sold sweets in the street during the summer, and in the winter, she was in her house and a neighbor encouraged her to start a recycling business. Every night, from 7pm to 11pm, she goes to collect things and the next day, she takes them to sell at a recycling center. She also buys recyclable items from other people. Since Eugenia has been in Finca, she has learned to manage her business and work with money. Eugenia needs a loan of 1200 soles so that she can buy recyclable items, which she will then sell. Eugenia’s dream is to have a small store, as she has already bought a dresser.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy recyclable items, which she will then sell

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
Camila  es socia del Bancomunal Melcochita 
Camila es conviviente tiene 43 años, tiene cinco hijos, los últimos de 12 y 7 años que están estudiando en al escuela estatal.
Camila es se dedica a tejer hace quince años en Yauyos, Cañete, al sur del Perú, pero ella llego a Lima hace un año y medio, a la casa de su cuñada, ella se dedica a su telares artesanales, ella hace mantas, frazadas y lleva a vender  su tierra en Yauyos.   
Desde que Camila esta en Finca  ha sido de gran ayuda, puede invertir y tiene mas ventas.
Camila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de un telar artesanal  y hilos, lanas de colores.
El sueño de Camila es crecer más en el negocio.
texts.en:
Camilia is a member of the Melcochita Community Bank. Camilia lives with her partner, is 43 years old, and has five children, the youngest of whom are 12 and 7 years old and are attending a state school. Camilia has been weaving for fifteen years in Yauyos, Cañete in the south or Perú. She came to Lima, to her sister-in-law’s house, a year and a half ago. She does weaving handicrafts and makes blankets. She sells her products in Yauyos. Being with Finca is very helpful because she can invest in her business and have more sales. Camilia needs a loan of 1000 soles so that she can buy a handicraft loom and woolen thread in different colors. Camilia’s dream is to grow her business more.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a handicraft loom and woolen thread in different colors

loans.name: Nyame Nhyira Group

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old. She is married and has three children. They are all boys and are in school. Her husband is a trader who works hard to support his wife in talking care of the home. She sells food items such as maize, rice, plantain, cassava etc. She has been in this business for over fifteen years now. She says she sells at the market square during their market days. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so that her dream of buying goods in bulk can be achieved. In this way, she can supply to a large number of customers to increase her market size, hence increasing her profit margin to care for her children.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame Nhyira’ which literary means God’s Blessing. She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stocking her little store

loans.name: Pedregal Group

texts.es:
Los miembros del banco comunal “PEDREGAL”, viven en la comunidad de Chifla que pretendes al distrito de Huanoquite  provincia de Paruro, ubicado a 3 y 30 horas de la ciudad del Cusco.

Estos socios son un grupo de 10 miembros, alternando sus diferentes actividades y  dedicados principalmente a la agricultura y a la ganadería, ellos compran y venden todo tipo de ganados vacunos y animales menores, aves de corral, ellos los compran muy tiernos y los hacen engordar y reproducir, de este modo ellos pueden vender sus derivados y vender la producción a mayor precio, por otro lado y dependiendo a los meses, ellos siguen dedicados a la agricultura, trabajan aún en forma arcaica las tierras, sembrando, maíz, diferentes variedades de papa, verduras, cebada, trigo y otros productos; para lo cuál ellos requieren el préstamo  para poder comprar ganados y algunos animales menores, también unas semillas para la siembra de sus tierras.

Nuestros socios se encuentran muy agradecidos y valoran el esfuerzo realizado mediante este medio comprometiéndose así con cumplir en forma disciplinada con el pago total de sus préstamos en las fechas establecidas.
texts.en:
The members of the Pedgregal community bank live in the town of Chifla, some 3 1/2 hours from Cusco, in the Peruvian province of Paruro.

The group has 10 members who make a living raising livestock and farming. They buy and sell cattle and smaller animals and keep birds. They buy young animals, then fatten and breed them so that they can sell what the animals produce for a higher return. They also work at farming, spending more or less time at it depending on the time of year. They still work the land in the traditional way, planting maize, various kinds of potatoes, green vegetables, barley, wheat and other products. They need the loan so that they can buy cattle and some smaller animals, along with seeds to sow their fields.

Our members are very grateful for the help that the receive and are committed to repaying the loan within the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle and smaller animals for livestock businesses.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Bancomunal  las empresarias.
Adela es casada tiene seis hijos todos mayores y están trabajando.
Adela  empezó vendiendo en el mercado en un puesto alquilado papa, y verduras, le fue bien,  pero decidió  vender en su  casa puso una bodega hace un año y medio, también ella tiene maquinas indústriales y con su familia confeccionan faldas 
DesD. que esta en Finca, aprendió a ser cumplida en el trabajo y con las cuotas.
Adela necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, para invertirlos en su bodega, y comprar verduras, saco D. papas, arroz, aceite. 
El sueño D. Adela es crecer mas en el negocio.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the Las Empresarias Community Bank. Adela is married, and she has six grown children who work. Adela started selling potatoes and vegetables from a rented stand in the market. It went well for her. But, a year and a half ago she decided to set up a mini market in her house. She also has industrial machines, which she and her family use to make skirts. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to be very responsible in her work and with her payments. Adela needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy vegetables, sacks of potatoes, rice, and oil for her mini market. Adela’s dream is to grow more in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables, sacks of potatoes, rice, and oil for her mini market

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo tiene 40 años, como esposa y madre de un hijo lucha junto a su pareja por brindarle las mejores atenciones dentro y fuera de su casa. Desde que contrajo matrimonio puso en practica las habilidades que desde niña aprendió gracias a su madre, quien le enseñó a elaborar diversos trabajos de costura. Pues Consuelo se casó con una persona dedicada a la confección de ropa, por lo que tuvo que ampliar sus conocimientos. Ahora trabajan juntos arduamente atendiendo los pedidos que les hacen sus clientes, ya sean personas particulares o instituciones. Esta actividad la vienen realizando hace 5 años en el taller que acondicionaron en su casa, donde ella elabora los diseños de las diversas prendas y posteriormente su pareja los lleve al mercado central donde están la mayoría de sus clientes. Consuelo tiene proyectado instalar nuevas maquinarias en su taller para mejorar la calidad de  acabados de las prendas y con el tiempo tener una marca exclusiva que distingan sus diseños. Los 6 créditos que ha tenido con Microfinanzas PRISMA  fueron de gran ayuda para ella y sus compañeras de banco comunal, y con este 7mo préstamo se compromete a trabajar con la misma responsabilidad y entusiasmo. Los 2000 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de telas para elaborar las prendas que tiene como pedidos para este fin de mes.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 40 years old and is a wife and mother of a child for whom she, along with her husband, struggles to provide with all the necessities. Since being married, she has put into practice the skills that she learned as a child thanks to her mother who taught her various sewing skills. Consuelo married someone that worked making clothing, and as a result increased her knowledge. They now work hard together, attending the requests that their customers give them, whether they are individuals or institutions. They have been doing this for 5 years in the workshop that they set up in their house, where she creates the designs for the various garments and later her husband takes them to the central market where the majority of their clients are located. Consuelo is planning to put new machinery in their workshop to improve the quality of their garment and with time, to have their own exclusive brand which is distinguished by their designs. The 6 loans that they have had with Microfinanzas PRISMA were of great help to her and her friends in the communal bank, and with this 7th loan she promises to work with same responsibility and enthusiasm. The 2000 Nuevos Soles that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of cloth to make garments for which she has orders by the end of the month.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Enith

texts.es: Enith tiene 35 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia, ya que producto de su esfuerzo es la casa que logró construir junto a su esposo. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, sale todas las tardes a visitar a sus clientes  para entregar sus pedidos y ofertarles nuevas prendas que deja al crédito para luego cobrar los fines de semana. Sin embargo, Enith anhela tener un bazar en su casa y actualmente está en plena construcción de este local, que espera terminar en un par de meses para ambientarlo e iniciar su proyecto, que está segura será de gran beneficio para su progreso económico. Ella es nueva en Microfinanzas PRISMA, por lo que espera trabajar con mucha responsabilidad para seguir formando parte de la institución. Con los 3000 soles que solicita incrementará la cantidad de ropa que vende aprovechando las  ofertas y liquidaciones de las tiendas.
texts.en:
Enith, 35, is a very hard working woman who is devoted to her family. The house she was able to build with her husband is the result of her efforts. She has been selling clothes for six years. She goes to visit her customers every afternoon to deliver their orders and offer them new clothes. She sells on credit and then collects on the week ends. Enith strives to have a store in her house. The place is currently under construction. She hopes to finish in a couple of months in order to be able to set it up and start her project. She is sure that it will be of great benefit to her economic progress. She is new to Microfinanzas PRISMA. She expects to work very responsibly to be able to continue as part of the institution. She will use the 3,000 PEN that she is asking for to increase the quantity of clothes that she sells and take advantage of the liquidation sales in the stores.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Ahobrasie Group

texts.en:
Kwame works very hard to bring food and joy to his family. He sells engine oil, kerosene and grease. He has been in business for the last eight years. He supplies villages where there is no hydroelectric power. He is 37 years old, married and the father of three children. All his children are currently in school. Kwame has purchased a portion of land to build a house. He requests a loan to buy engine oil, grease and kerosene, etc. in bulk. With this loan, he believes he can save enough money to support his children in school.

Kwame is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ahobrasie’ which literally means ‘Humility’. He is the one sitting in front of the group in the photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy engine oil, grease, kerosene, etc.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee es una mujer muy emprendedora, ya que trata de trabajar con el fin de progresar y brindar lo necesario a su familia, con quienes vive en la casa propia que obtuvo con mucho esfuerzo. Siempre estuvo interesada en la venta de cosméticos y gracias a una amiga logró formar parte de las promotoras de una reconocida línea de belleza. Desde entonces, hace 5 años, se dedica a visitar a sus clientas para ofrecerles los productos por catálogo, aunque lo difícil son las cobranzas, ya que por la puntualidad de pago recibe bonos y premios, pero no siempre sus clientes le pagan a tiempo. Sin embargo, Haydee tiene proyectado a ser una gran empresaria y trabajar para varias líneas de belleza, pues esto le ayudará a diversificar sus productos, precios y calidad, con los cuales puede llegar a satisfacer a mayor cantidad de personas. Este es su octavo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, ella comenta que el tiempo de permanencia en su banco comunal le ha permitido aprender a trabajar en equipo junto a sus compañeras de grupo. Con los 1000 soles que viene solicitando aprovechará las ofertas y campañas de los catálogos para comprar productos a menores precios.
texts.en:
Haydee is a very entrepreneurial woman, who works to move forward and provide what is necessary for her family, with whom she lives in their own house, which they obtained through a lot of effort.

She has always been interested in selling cosmetics and thanks to a friend she became one of the promoters for a certain line of beauty products. For the past five years, she has been visiting clients to offer them products from the catalog. The difficult part of her job is the collection of money. She receives bonds and awards for on time payments, but her clients do not always pay on time.

All the same, Haydee plans to be a great businesswoman and work for several cosmetic brands, which would allow her to diversify her products, prices, and quality in order to appeal to a greater variety of customers.

This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She says the time she has spent with the village bank has allowed her to learn how to work as a team with her group members. With the 1000 soles she plans to take advantage of the catalog’s offers and campaigns to buy more products at a lower price.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba  es socia del Bancomunal  las empresarias.
Elba es casada tiene dos hijos de 16 y 10 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Elba estudio visitadora medica lo dejo por que salio embarazada y tenia riesgo de perdida, se dedico a su casa y a sus hijos hasta que estuvieran grandes para poder nuevamente trabajar, es como empieza con la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo y la venta de joyas, esta incursionando en la venta de  comidas por las noches en su casa.
Desde que Elba esta en Finca aprendió a programarse en su pagos y en su cuentas, a sacar su ganancia y no tocar su capital.
Elba necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de cosméticos, joyas de plata y oro y la compra de una parrilla grande.    
El sueño de Elba es crecer en el negocio y tener una tienda bazar.
texts.en:
Elba is a member of the Empresarias Community Bank. Elba is married and has two children. They are 16 and 10, and they attend the state school. Elba studied to do medical visits, but she left her studies when she became pregnant with a risk of miscarriage. She devoted herself to her home and her children until they were bigger and she could start working again. That is how she started selling beauty products by catalog and selling jewelry. She also sells food in the evenings from her house. Since Elba has been with Finca she has learned to schedule her payments and how to take her earnings and not touch her capital. Elba needs a loan of 2,000 PEN to buy cosmetics, silver and gold jewelry, and a large grill. Elba’s dream is to expand her business and have a bazaar style store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics, silver and gold jewelry, and a large grill

loans.name: Karim

texts.es: Karim tiene 22 años, es soltera y su deseo de progreso es por el bienestar de su familia. Hace 2 años se inicio en la venta de cosméticos, pues es una actividad que siempre le agradó realizar, tiempo atrás ayudaba a una amiga a ofrecer estos productos y en su corta experiencia  pudo darse cuenta que era un negocio con muchos beneficios debido a la cantidad de pedidos que obtenía de sus familiares y amigas. Entonces decidió independizarse con la finalidad de  mejorar su capital de trabajo e invertir en mayor cantidad de productos y que con el paso del tiempo lograr instalar en su casa un bazar donde pueda ofrecer estos productos y brindar algunos talleres de maquillaje. Sin embargo, para llegar a su meta tiene que salir todas las tardes a visitar a diversos clientes en sus respectivas viviendas para mostrarles el catálogo o los cosméticos que tiene en stock. Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP y lo que más le agrada de su banco comunal es la responsabilidad y dinamismo con el que trabaja su grupo. Con los 2000 soles que ahora solicita comprará más productos de belleza, sobre todo aprovechará las ofertas de los catálogos.
texts.en:
Karim is 22 years old and single; her primary motivation is the well-being of her family. She has spent the past two years selling cosmetics, a career she always wanted to pursue. Before starting her own business she used to help a friend sell these products and with a little experience realized that this business could be very profitable due to the large number of orders that she received from family and friends. Karim decided to establish her own business with the goal of making a solid profit and investing it in a large variety of products, in addition to eventually establishing a makeup studio and store in her own home where she could offer these products. Nevertheless, to accomplish this goal, Karim spends every afternoon visiting various clients in their homes to show them new catalogues and cosmetics that she has in stock. This is Karim's eighth loan with MFP and what she loves most about her loan group is the responsibility and dynamism with which they work. With this 2000-sole ($675) loan, she will buy more beauty products in order to take full advantage of the makeup catalogue's new offerings.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory for her makeup business.

loans.name: Ymelda

texts.es: Ymelda tiene 48 años, ser madre y esposa la comprometen a velar por el desarrollo y progreso de sus seres queridos, con quienes vive en la casa que adquirió desde que se casó. Su buena sazón la impulsó a tomar la decisión de dedicarse a la venta de comida, pues su interés de ayudar en los gastos de la casa la motivó a iniciar su propio negocio, el cual viene realizando hace 6 años en su casa. Ymelda prepara grandes cantidades de tamales que distribuye en las tiendas de su localidad y también vende de forma ambulante, lo cual le toma  varias horas fuera de casa todos los días de la semana. A pesar de ser una actividad agotadora, por las largas caminatas en las calles, Ymelda tiene muchas ganas de progresar y espera que en un futuro cercano pueda tener un puesto estable donde venda diversidad de platos de comida. Este es su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, y junto a sus compañeras, trata de mejorar cada vez más en los trabajos que realizan como organización dentro de su banco comunal. Con los 2000 soles que viene solicitando adquirirá los comestibles necesarios para la preparación de sus deliciosos tamales.
texts.en:
Ymelda is 48 years old. Being a mother and wife obliges her to watch over those she holds dear. She lives with them in the house she has had since getting married. Her maturity drove her to make the decision to sell food, while her interest in helping with the household expenses motivated her to begin her own business, which she has been operating for almost six years out of her house.

Ymelda prepares large quantities of tamales that she distributes in local shops and also sells to take away. Her work takes her outside the house for several hours every day of the week, in spite of this being exhausting due to the long walks through the streets.

Ymelda is very determined to progress and hopes that in the near future she will be able to have a stable place where she sells diverse plates of food.

This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and each time, together with her partners in her community bank, she tries to bring more improvement to the work of the organization. With the 2000 soles she is applying for she will acquire the foods necessary for her delicious tamales

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of ingredients for her tamales

loans.name: God Is Love Group

texts.en:
Mustapha is 23 years old and single. He is a business-minded young chap. He sells phone accessories like phone chips, units transfer, phones and accessories. He identified an opportunity to provide customers with phone products three years ago, and started the business with a small amount of money given to him by his uncle. He is jovial and has a very good approach to his work. He buys his stock of goods from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. He is requesting this loan to increase his stock.

Mustapha is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘God is Love’. He is the one squatting in the front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy phone units, mobile phone chips, phone accessories, etc.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara es socia del Bancomunal  las empresarias.
Sara es casada tiene 47 años, cuatro hijos mayores de edad que trabajan y estudian.
Sara  tenía una ferretería y también vendía materiales de construcción, la cerro por que sus hijos viajaron a otro país y no tendía quien le  ayudara, ella se quedo en casa, pero después de un tiempo regresaron a Perú, abrieron un negocio de excavación de materiales de construcción, ella es la recepcionista del negocio.  
Desde que Sara esta en Finca aprendió administrar mejor el dinero y aprendió ahorrar.
Sara necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, materiales de oficina y arreglo de su impresora.
El sueño de Sara es seguir prosperando cada vez más.
texts.en:
Sara is a partner at the Businesswoman Village Bank. Sara is married and 47 years old. She has four grown children who work and study. Sara had a hardware store and also sold construction materials, but closed it because her children moved to another country and she didn’t have anyone to help her. She then stayed at home, but after a while her children returned to Perú, so they opened a construction material excavation business. She is the receptionist for the business. Since Sara has been with FINCA she has learned how to better manage money and how to save money. Sara needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy office materials and to repair the printer. Sara’s dream is to always continue prospering.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase office materials and repair printer

loans.name: Wonderful Jesus Group

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old, widowed and a mother with ten children. Currently all her children are in school except for her last born who is still breastfeeding. She is a trader who sells assorted products like cooking utensils and plastics like lunch boxes, etc. She treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She mostly sells by hawking (that is house-to-house selling). She has been in business for four year now. She has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock.

Mary requests a loan to buy more products like cooking utensils which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers. With this loan, she believes she will be better resourced and able to make more profit. Then, she can build a store to reduce the amount of walking on the street required to sell. She would be grateful for your assistance.

Mary is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Wonderful Jesus’. She is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase inventory of cooking utensils, etc.

loans.name: The Ownership Is God Group

texts.en:
Lawrence is 40 years old. He is married and the father of three children, two boys and one girl, who are in school. He is a salt trader. He supplies salt to food vendors and others. He travels to Accra to buy his salt, but he buys only a few bags of salt on each trip, because he does not have enough money to buy more. He must travel to Accra frequently to get enough salt to sell. He asked some family members for financial assistance, but to no avail. Lawrence is requesting a loan to buy a bulk supply of salt. He believes this will reduce the risk of frequent travel. He dreams of saving more to pay for his children's education.

Lawrence is the leader of a trust bank group called "The Ownership is God." He appears in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are small-scale traders, food vendors, and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy salt in bulk to resell

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María  vive en el sector de Zhidmad, a cinco minutos de la comunidad de Santa Ana, en la provincia del Azuay, su clima es variado al igual que la ciudad de Cuenca,  la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, María tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil casada, tiene cuatro hijos de 10, 8, 4, 2 años de edad, los tres primeros hijos estudian en la escuela de Santa Ana, vive en casa propia, su esposo trabaja en la construcción de casas (albañil), de lunes a viernes con el horario de 8 AM. a 16PM. María se traslada a la ciudad de Cuenca para trabajar en quehaceres domésticos, sus pequeños hijos se quedan en casa en compañía de la abuelita de su esposo que tiene 80 años, y vive con ellos, al llegar a casa por la tarde se dedica a velar por sus hijos y dar de alimentar a sus animales que tiene.
En su propiedad tiene cuatro reses preñadas, chanchos que cría para la venta, gallinas, y unos cuantos cuyes para consumo doméstico; Con el préstamo de 1100 dólares que solicitó piensa comprar pollos de cría, alimentación(balanceado), y lo que haga falta para el negocio, así también buscar ayuda para que le asesoren en este proyecto.
María es socia de la Fundación espoir hace cinco años, ya anteriormente a realizado algunos créditos y está muy agradecida con espoir por el apoyo que le está brindando.
La meta que tiene en su vida es llegar a comprarse un carro (camioneta) para poder distribuir personalmente los pollos en diferentes lugares de la ciudad.
texts.en:
María lives in the area of Zhidmad, five minutes from the community of Santa Ana, in the province of Azuay. The climate is varied as in the town of Cuenca and the majority of the inhabitants are farmers. María is 32 years old, married with four children, 10, 8, 4, and 2 years old, the three oldest attend the school of Santa Ana. She lives in her own house, her husband works in construction (builder), Monday through Friday from 8 am to 4 pm. María commutes to the town of Cuenca to work in housekeeping. Her young children stay at home with her husband's grandmother who is 80 years old and lives with them. When María returns in the afternoon she looks after her children and feeds her animals.

On their property they have four pregnant heads of cattle, pigs she raises to be sold, hens, and a few guinea pigs for domestic consumption. With the loan of US$1100 requested she will buy chickens to be raised, food (balanced) and other necessities for the business as well as search for consultancy with this project. María has been a partner of the "Fundación Espoir" for five years, she has had previous loans and is very grateful to Espoir for the support being offered. It is her goal to be able to buy a vehicle (pick-up truck) in order to distribute the chickens herself to different places of the town.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, food (balanced) etc. for business.

loans.name: Maria Rosa Dolores

texts.es:
María Rosa es oriunda de Zhidmad, comunidad de Santa Ana, provincia del Azuay, tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad, su hijo estudia en el colegio de Santa Ana (Técnico Daniel Ermida), vive en casa de sus padres ya que fue la última hija de cinco que les acompañó hasta su muerte, tiene animales como vacas lecheras, cerdos, pollos, cuyes, gallinas, y los vende según como se presenta la oportunidad. 
Se dedica al comercio informal en los mercados de la ciudad de Cuenca vendiendo legumbres, frutas, verduras, y cualquier cosa que pueda negociar, de Lunes a Sábado, tiene un horario aproximado de 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, según como este la venta. Luego de esto se traslada a su casa para hacerse cargo del cuidado de sus animales, los fines de semana comercializa ganado vacuno, los compra flacos y luego de unos tres a cuatro meses los engorda para  nuevamente sacarlos a la feria o los vende en su propia casa. Lo que le preocupa hoy es la enfermedad que están teniendo los animales (fiebre aftosa) lo que dificulta el libre negocio del los animales.
María Rosa es socia de la Fundación  espoir aproximadamente unos 3 años y ahora solicitó un crédito de 440 dólares para comprar abonos para su terreno y también un torito para hacer yunta ya que se acerca la  temporada de siembras, luego de terminar las siembras nuevamente pondrá a la venta los animales.
Su meta en la vida es seguir comprando animales y comprar más terrenos para sembrar diferentes productos como maíz, fréjol, papas y muchos productos más.
texts.en:
María Rosa is from Zhidmad, community of Santa Ana, province of Azuay. She is 48 years old, single with a 15-year-old son who studies in the school of Santa Ana (Técnico Daniel Ermida). She lives in her parents' house as she was the oldest daughter of five who stayed with them till their death. She keeps animals such as milking cows, pigs, chickens, guinea pigs, and hens which she sells whenever there is an opportunity.

She is an informal vendor at the markets of the town of Cuenca. She sells vegetables, fruits and whatever can be sold from Monday through Saturday from approximately 7 am to 5 pm, depending on sales. After work she takes care of her animals and on week-ends she sells cattle, which she has bought and raised for three-four months, at different markets or from home. At the present she is worried about the disease attacking the animals (foot and mouth disease) which makes business difficult. María Rosa has been a partner of "Fundación Espoir" for approximately 3 years, and is requesting a loan of US$440 to buy fertilizers for her land as well as a young bull for a yoke as the sowing season is getting close. After the sowing season she plans to sell the animal. It is her life goal to continue buying animals and more land to be able to sow different products such as corn, beans, potatoes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers as well as a young bull.

loans.name: Clorinda Elena

texts.es:
Clorinda vive en la parroquia de Zhidmad comunidad de San José, se encuentra ubicado al noreste de la ciudad de Cuenca, es un sector rural, a 45 minutos del centro de la ciudad, Zhidmad tiene un clima muy variado parecido al de Cuenca, en este lugar se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.
Tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos la primera tiene 19 y la última 2 años de edad, todas sus hijos viven con ella, da gracias a Dios que la primera  le ayuda a mantener su hogar ya que trabaja en Cuenca en quehaceres domésticos y lo que gana comparte con su familia, Clorinda trabaja de dos a tres días en la ciudad realizando limpiezas en departamentos, también huertos en los campos aledaños a la ciudad, y los demás días de la semana se dedica a cuidar a sus hijas y cultivar las tierras que posee, tiene pocos animales pero solo para uso familiar.
Clorinda vive sola hace un año y medio con sus hijas ya que su esposo las dejó para irse a trabajar en la ciudad de Guayaquil, los primeros dos meses venía cada quince días a visitarnos, pero ahora viene cada 7 u 8 meses trayendo alguna cosa como yuca, naranjas, frutas, pero que de allí no deja ni un centavo para sus hijos.
Es socia de la Fundación espoir ya muchos años, el crédito que solicita ahora es el sexto o séptimo, pidió 330 dólares para invertir comprando pollos de cría, y otra parte para alimentación y vitaminas de los mismos, espera que lo que invierta pueda duplicar o triplicar con el tiempo ya que venderá los pollos en pie y pelados luego de unos dos o tres meses según como vayan creciendo los animales.
texts.en:
Clorinda lives in the parish of Zhidmad, community of San José, located north-east of the town of Cuenca. It is a rural area, 45 minutes from the center of the town. Zhidmad has a varied climate like Cuenca and people farm or raise animals for a living.

Clorinda is 40 years old, married, with 5 children, from 19 to 2 years of age. All her children live with her and she thanks God as the oldest helps maintain the home as she works in Cuenca in housekeeping and share her earnings with her family. Clorinda works two-three days in the city cleaning apartments as well as orchards close to the town, and the rest of the week she looks after her daughters and farms her land. She has few animals only for family use.

Clorinda has lived on her own with her daughters for a year and a half as her husband has gone to work in the town of Guayaquil. The first two months he would come to visit them every fortnight, but now he comes every 7-8 months bringing yuca, oranges, fruits, but does not give money for his children. Clorinda has been a partner of "Fundación Espoir" for many years, this is her sixth or seventh loan. She has requested US$330 to be invested in buying chickens,food and vitamins to raise them. She expects to double or triple the investment over time as she will sell the chickens live or plucked after two or three months depending on their growth.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in chickens, food and vitamins.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: La Superacion Group

texts.en:
Guillermina S. is a budding entrepreneur who is currently employed in retail clothing sales. She sells new, fashionable clothes from her home and in the streets. The selling of used clothes in the Dominican is big business, but Guillermina has decided to sell new clothes in an effort to separate herself from the masses who are selling used clothes. Her clothes may be more expensive, but the newness of clothes is an effective selling tool.

Even though Guillermina has been successful selling new clothes, she needs capital to really expand her business. It had been very frustrating for her, because she knows that she could expand her business, but she couldn’t find anyone to lend her money. She was extremely ecstatic to learn about Esperanza, and you could tell by listening and talking to her that she was eager to receive her loan and begin investing and growing her business.

loans.use: To purchase a more clothes to sell in her neighborhood

loans.name: Las Obreras Group

texts.es: Es un grupo que esta en su 2º ciclo, formado por señoras que viven en un mismo Barrio "Valle hermoso", donD. se conocen bien, el Banco D. Emprendimiento "LAS OBRERAS" esta conformado por la socia Erika A., quien dirige al grupo, muy bien, ella tiene como negocio , la venta D. calzados y cosmeticos por catalogos, tambien tiene una tienda D. barrio, ella esta concubinada y tiene un solo hijo, es una persona muy sacrificada para salir adelante. Como tesorera esta la socia  Martha  Flores quien actualmente esta separada del esposo, tiene una hija, recibe renta D. su auto ella contola al chofer, pero tiene pensado tener alguna otra entrada mas por que desea tener su casita propia. Y como secretario esta es socio  Elmer C., es un socio que trabaja con taxi en la linea nº 131 en el Sindicato San Miguel, es soltero, no tiene hijos, pero si colabora a sus padres. dice que el credito lo usa para mantenimiento D. su vehiculo.
texts.en:
This is the Las Obreras community bank's second cycle. The members are women who live in the same Valle Hermoso neighborhood and know each other well. The group is well-led by member, Erika Argandona, who has a business selling footwear and cosmetics that she buys from catalogs and resells. She also has a neighborhood shop. Erika is patnered and has one son. She is someone who has give up a lot to get ahead. The treasurer, Martha Flores, who is now separated, has one daughter. She receives an income from a car that she leases to a driver and is thinking of getting another so that she can ultimately make enough to own her own house. The secretary, Elmer C., has a taxi business that he operates along Line 131 for the San Miguel cooperative. Elmer is single and childless, but he helps out his parents. He says that he will use the loan to service his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ena Susana

texts.es:
la sra. ENA SUSANA S. tiene mas de 10 años de dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de pan actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación con ayuda de una empleada, su producto lo distribuye en diferentes negocios de la zona,  con los ingresos que le genera le ayuda a su esposo a cubrir los gastos en el hogar, tiene tres hijos y estan en la escuela de la comunidad,  ella se siente muy feliz ya que ha logrado comprar un molino para moler el MAIZ para elaborar su producto facilitandole de esta manera la elaboracion de su producto ya que antes ella tenia que acarrear y pagar para que se lo molieran.
Su producto hoy en dia es bien buscado por su clientela.
su sueño es tener su propia casa por los momentos solo tiene el terreno pero piensan construirla.
Su esposo es de gran ayuda para ella ya que trabajan los dos y se ayudan mutuamente para hacerle frente y cumplir con todos compromisos y lograr que sus sueños se hagan realidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. ENA SUSANA S. has been baking and selling bread for a living for more than 10 years. She does this with the help of an employee at home and her product is distributed to different businesses of the area. With the income she helps her husband cover the family expenses. She has three children who study at the community school. She is very happy as she has succeeded in buying a mill to grind the CORN she uses for making her product thus making it easier as before she had to carry it and pay for having it grinded.

Her product is very popular with her customers. It is her dream to own a house. For the time being she owns the land but would like to build. Her husband is of great support to her as both work and help each other face and honor all the commitments and make their dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, fat, flour, candy, eggs, margarine, sugar, cheese, firewood.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fabiana Flavia

texts.es: La señora Fabiana se encuentra en su quinta secuencia durate todo el tiempo que a trabajado junto a la institucion siempre a demostrado ser una persona trabajadora y con ganas de superacion.  La actividad economica que realiza es la venta de articulos varios lo cual realiza en una pequeña tienda de barrio ubicado en la misma calle de su domicilio.  Ella vive conjuntamente con su señora madre a la que colabora con los gastos familiares, tambien vive su hermano.  La sañora Faviana invertira el prestamo en la compra de insumos para su negocio.
texts.en:
This is doña Fabiana's fifth loan and during the time she has worked with the institution she has proven to be a hard-working person wanting to improve. She sells different articles for a living at a small local store in the same street where she lives. She lives with her mother whom she supports with the family expenses. Her brother lives there too. Mrs. Fabiana will spend the loan in the purchase of supplies for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in supplies for a business.

loans.name: Gloria Alejandrina

texts.es:
la Sra. GLORIA ALEJANDRINA V. se dedica a la venta de golosinas y venta de queso al por mayor. Tiene mas de 4 años dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, durante todo este tiempo
le ha ido bien ya que su negocio esta ubicado en un punto muy estrategico y de mucha afluencia de personas que transitan por ese sector.
la comida todo tiempo se vende ya que es una necesidad basica que obligatoriamente hay que suplir y aquí el queso es un producto que se procesa en grandes cantidades lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda  local y regional,  ya que es una zona apta para la ganaderia.
con las utilidades que le genera este negocio le permitide suplir los gastos del hogar y la crianza y educacion de sus hijos  tambien otros compromisos adquiridos que tiene y de esta manera contribuye a su esposo en el hogar, ella quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria Alejandrina V. sells candy and cheese wholesale. She has been working in this business for more than 4 years and she has done well since her business is located at a very strategic point where there is a great inflow of people who travel in the area. The food always sells because it is a basic necessity. Here, cheese is a product that they process in high quantities in order to satisfy the local and regional demand since it is an area that is very suitable for cattle farming. With the profits this business generates she is able to pay for household expenses and the upbringing and education of her children. Also, other deals that she obtains in this matter she contributes to her husband and her household – she wants to improve her and her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beef, chicken, vegetables, drinks, condiments, tortillas, lard, and cheese

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia  es socia del Bancomunal  las empresarias.
Alicia es viuda hace 36 años, ella tiene 76 años, tiene seis hijos todos mayores y trabajan.
Alicia  desde que se caso siempre se dedico a su casa y a cuidar a sus hijos, hasta que su esposo falleció, siguió dedicándose a sus hijos pero hace tres años ella empezó a vende marcianos  en su casa y con el préstamo de Finca ella puso una bodega de venta de dulces, golosinas y gaseosas, ella se distrae mucho, ella también recibe la pensión de su esposo.    
Desde que ella esta en Finca, agradece por el préstamo que le esta ayudando a invertir en su negocio.  
Alicia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de gaseosas, cervezas y golosinas.
El sueño de Alicia es  que su negocio crezca y vender de todo y acabar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Las Empresarias Community Bank. Alicia, 76, has been a widow for 36 years. She has six grown children who work. Ever since she got married Alicia devoted herself to her house and taking care of her children. When her husband died, she continued to devote herself to her children. However, after three years she started to sell popsicles in her house. With the loan from Finca she set up a mini market selling sweets, candy, and soft drinks. She really enjoys it. She also receives her husband’s pension. Since she has been with Finca, she is grateful for the loan that is helping her invest in her business. Alicia needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy soft drinks, beer, and candy. Alicia’s dream is to expand her business, sell all types of things, and finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, beer, and candy

loans.name: Juliana Aurora

texts.es:
Juliana  es socia del Bancomunal  las empresarias.
Juliana es madre soltera tiene dos hijos  de 21 y 11 años el mayor estudia en una universidad  estatal y el ultimo en la escuela estatal.
Juliana trabajaba en un taller de archivadores dejo el trabajo por que su hijo sufre de asma y constantemente le daban crisis de asma  y ya no le daban permiso, decidió poner un negocio en su casa empezó con una vitrina  vendiendo dulces en su casa, poco a poco fue creciendo, y   las empresas fueron llevando maquinas exhibidoras.
Desde que Juliana esta en Finca aprendió ahorrar, antes no  lo asía.   
Juliana necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para la compra de abarrotes para surtir su tienda.
El sueño de Juliana  es tener un minimarket en su casa.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the Las Empresarias Community Bank. Juliana is a single mother. She has two children; they are 21 and 11. The older attends the state university, and the younger goes to the state school. Juliana worked in a file cabinet factory. She left work because her son, who suffers from asthma, had constant asthma attacks, and they would not let her leave. She decided to set up a business in her house. She started with a display case selling sweets in her house. Little by little the business was growing, and the business got coolers. Since Juliana has been with Finca she has learned to save. She did not do that before. Juliana needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy groceries to stock her store. Juliana’s dream is to have a mini market in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet es socia del Bancomunal  las empresarias.
Janet es conviviente tiene 39 años tres hijos de 21, 17 y 10 años, los dos últimos estudian en la escuela estatal.
Janet trabajaba en una fabrica de medias en ventas dejo de trabajar por que su esposo  no quería que trabaje, pero después de un tiempo ella se dedico a vender productos de belleza por catalogo de dos empresas, y también vende pasajes aéreos.  
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió ahorrar.
Janet  necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de pasajes aéreos para  negociarlos 
El sueño de Janet es tener una peluquería.
texts.en:
Janet is a member of the community bank Las Empresarias. Janet lives with her partner, and is 39 years old. She has three children, who are 21, 17, and 10 years old. The last two study at the public school. Janet worked in a stockings factory, but she left her job because her husband did not want her to work. But after some time, she sold beauty products from a catalog from two companies. She also sells airline tickets. Since she has been with Finca, she learned how to save. Janet needs a loan of 2,000 soles to buy airplane tickets to sell. Janet´s dream is to have a hair salon.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy airline tickets to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, beans, tortillas, shortening, churros, soft drinks, coffee, bread, crackers, candy, oil, toilet paper, milk, dairy products, meat, soup, pastas, soap, pills, salt

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Bancomunal  las empresarias.
Carmen es casada tiene 37 años,  dos hijo de 16 y 10 años que esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Carmen  empezó vendiendo chicha con su suegra allí aprendió la preparación hasta que su suegra le dijo que ella  tenia que  independizarse y ella compro su carreta, baldes,  vasos, todo lo necesario para salir a vender chicha, ella sale a vender chicha  por las mañanas de nueve de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde, y en las noches  a partir del las ocho de la noche hasta las seis de la mañana ella vende hamburguesas. Con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió a invertir en el negocio y a ser responsable.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de un saco de azúcar, quinua, habas, cebada, maracayá.   
El sueño de Carmen es que sus hijos terminen el colegio hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Las Empresarias Community Bank. Carmen is 37, married, and has two children ages 16 and 10, who go to the state school. Carmen started selling “chicha” (a drink made from corn or fruit) with her mother-in-law. She learned how to make it, and her mother-in-law told her she needed to become independent. She bought her cart, buckets, glasses, and everything she needed to go out and sell chicha. She leaves to sell chicha at nine in the morning until two in the afternoon. With help from her children, she sells hamburgers from eight at night until six in the morning. Since she has been with Finca she has learned to invest in her business and to be responsible. Carmen needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy a sack of sugar, quinoa, beans, barley, and passion fruit. Carmen’s dream is that her children finish school and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sack of sugar, quinoa, beans, barley, and passion fruit

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Bancomunal  las empresarias.
Julia  es casada tiene 57 años, tiene 8 hijos, el menor tiene 17 años y esta  estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Julia vendía en los mercados y en las puertas de colegio  golosinas, dejo de vender por que se descapitalizo, nuevamente empezó a vender y a juntar su dinero  iba comprando poco  apoco sus cosas vitrinas hasta que puso una bodega en su casa, ella atiende con la ayuda de su hija     
Desde que Julia esta en Finca tiene mas capital y puede comprar mas productos.
Julia necesita un préstamo de  1000 soles para  surtir su bodega, con arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, huevos.
El sueño de Julia es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the female entrepreneurs' village bank. Julia is 57 years old, married, and has eight children, the youngest of whom is seventeen and attends public school.
