Julia used to sell sweets in the markets and at the entrance to the schools. She stopped for a while when profits decreased, but then started selling them again. With the money she is little by little buying things to display in a store in her home, which she and her daughter attend to.

Since joining Finca, Julia has had more capital and been able to buy more products. Julia needs a loan of 1000 soles to stock her store with rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and eggs.

Julia's dream is to increase the size of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store with rice, sugar, oil, pasta, and eggs.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita  es socia del Bancomunal  las empresarias.
Anita es conviviente tiene 40 años, tiene dos hijos de 17 y 3 años, el mayor esta en la escuela estatal.
Anita  trabajaba en una empresa de plásticos, lo dejo por que salio embarazada, después de un tiempo le regalaron una vitrina y le dio la idea de vender  en su casa, compro  dulces,  ropas productos de belleza, joyas desde hace un año.
Desde que Anita esta en Finca aprendió a invertir y sobre todo en que tiene que invertir, ella solo pide lo que va poder pagar. 
Anita necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo,  de ropa y joyas.
El sueño de Anita es tener una tienda grande donde pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Anita is a member of the communal bank group “Las Empresarias”. She is 40 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 children (ages 17 & 3). The oldest child attends a state school.

Anita worked at a plastics company but left after she became pregnant. About a year ago, she was given a glass display case as a gift and thought it would be a good idea to start a home business selling candy, clothes, beauty products and jewelry.

Since joining FINCA, she has learned to invest and knows what it takes to run her business. Anita needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy beauty products from a catalog, clothing, and jewelry. She dreams of opening a large store where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products by catalog, clothing & jewelry

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: la sra. MARIA DOLORES Z. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un FOTO Estudio y venta de joyas de oro, actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace mas de 12 años, es madre de familia y tiene 3 hijos 2 de ellos estudian, junto a su esposo son los que administran el negocio, gracias a los ingresos que ellos tienen les ha permitido suplir los gastos familiares y otras obligaciones que tienen , es notoria la solidez y el deseo de superacion que tienen como familia ya que para lograr tener estabilidad en su negocio don Juan Varela su esposo sale ha realizar su trabajo fotografico en los diferentes eventos sociales y escolares que se desarrollan en el Municipio de Trojes y lugares vecinos. este credito lo necesitan para comprar los articulos al por mayor ya que asi es cuando se tiene mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Dolores Z. is dedicated to her business, a photo studio and selling gold jewelry, which she has done for the last twelve years.

She is the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She manages the business with her husband. Thanks to the income from this business they are able to supplement family expenses and fulfill other obligations.

Their strength and the desire to overcome obstacles to make their business stable is evident. Her husband, Juan Varela has to leave in order to do his work as a photographer at different social and school events in the city of Trojes and neighboring areas.

They need this loan to buy items at wholesale price to increase profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rolls of camera film, frames, and gold rings and bracelets

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Humberto

texts.es:
el sr. JUAN HUMBERTO M. Se dedica a la venta de verduras y granos de maiz y frijoles. tiene mas de 14 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, el y su esposa son los encargados de darle vida a este pequeño negocio que esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion del municipio de trojes. El Sr. M. realiza las venta de manera domiciliar, tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo una depende de ellos y es pasante de la licenciatura en enfermeria.
para la compra de granos basicos tiene que salir a comprar donde le vendan mas comodo y de esta manera ofrecerle un mejor precio a su clientela a la que atienden junto a su esposa con 
esmero y dedicaion , M. tambien se dedica a la caficultura lo que le genera otros ingresos para bienestar de su familia , El nos esta solicitando el credito para invertirlo en su negocio ya que por los momentos no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Humberto M. sells vegetables, corn and beans. He and his wife started this business from the living room of their house in the city of Trojes. He has been in business for 14 years. Sr. M. sells his products by direct payment. He has three children – only the youngest is still a dependent and is currently an intern studying nursing.

In order to buy basic grains to sell, he must leave the comfort of his house in search of the best price. Together he and his wife attend to their customers with great care and dedication. Sr. M. also grows coffee beans, which generates additional income to maintain his family’s well-being. He is requesting a loan to invest in his business because, at the moment, he does not have sufficient capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, corn & beans

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
el sr. Jose Maria D. se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pequeña tienda en la cual vende utencilios de plastico como ser baldes, pailas, vasos, etc. tambien vende sandalias y chancletas, cepillos para baño y fajas de cuero para caballeros. este negocio le a dado muy buenos resultados, ya que comenzo su  negocio vendiendo en su carrito y ahora tiene 3 puestos ubicados en diferentes puntos  comerciales del municipio de trojes. Don Chema se caracteriza por los  precios comodos que brinda a sus clientes y por la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes.
tambien sale a vender en su carrito a diferentes aldeas y caserios de la localidad lo que le genera ingresos permanentes, como dice el dicho si la montaña no biene ha Maoma, Maoma va a la montaña entoces don Chemita va donde ellos. Este credito lo va a invertir para surtir mas su negocio donde tenga de todo un poco de tal manera no dejar al cliente irse sin comprar nada.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Maria D. works in retail and has a small store. He sells plastic goods such as buckets, pans and cups, etc. He also sells sandals and flip flops, toilet brushes and men’s leather belts. This business has been profitable for him. He began his business selling from his cart and now he has 3 stalls located in different commercial locations in the town of Trojes. Mr. Chema is known for the comfortable prices he offers his customers and for his friendliness when dealing with his customers. He also goes out and sells with his cart to different villages and country houses in the area. This generates a permanent income. Like the saying says, if the mountain doesn’t come to Mohammad, Mohammad goes to the mountain. So Mr. Chemita goes where they are. He is going to use this loan to stock up his business so that he has a little of everything. This way he won’t let the customer leave without buying something.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase plastic goods, sandals, flip flops, brushes, leather belts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora es una madre muy empeñosa, desde que formó su familia se dedicó a brindarles el cariño y atenciones necesarias y gracias a que logró construir su casa propia gozan de estabilidad. Desde muy joven trabajó en la venta de comida, pero tuvo que interrumpir su actividad para dedicarles mayor atención a sus hijos y ahora que ellos ya son mayores, ha reiniciado sus actividades con el apoyo de su pareja e hijos, quienes la ayudaron a adquirir un coche de comidas, con el cual sale a vender en la puerta de su casa. Esta actividad la realiza todos los días, sobre todo los fines de semana debido a la gran demanda que hay, trabaja desde las 5pm hasta la media noche, ya que aprovechar la clientela que hay por las noches. Sin embargo, Flora   se proyecta para instalar un bazar en su casa, donde pueda iniciar la venta de ropa, ya que sus vecinos están empezando a realizarle pedidos que ella espera entregar con prontitud, sin descuidar su negocio de venta de comida. Este es su crédito número 14 con MFP y lo que más la alienta a continuar con su banco comunal es la unión como grupo y el apoyo que hay todas sus compañeras. Los 1000 soles que viene solicitando le permitirán comprar los comestibles necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas, así como ropa para su  nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Flora is a very determined mother. Ever since she formed her family, she has worked to give them the love and attention they needed. Thanks to her managing to build her own house, they have enjoyed stability. She has worked selling food since she was very young. She had to interrupt her work in order to dedicate more attention to her children. Now that they are older, she has started working again with the help of her partner and children. They helped her get a food cart with which she sells meals from the door of her house. She works every day, above all on the weekends due to the great demand. She works from 5 p.m. until midnight since she takes advantage of the customers that are out at night. Nevertheless, Flora plans to install a store in her house where she can begin to sell clothes. Her neighbors are beginning to make orders which she hopes to deliver shortly, without neglecting her meal-selling business. This is her 14th loan with MFP. What encourages her the most to continue with her community bank is the group unity and the support of all its members. The 1000 PEN she is applying for will allow her to purchase necessary food to prepare her meals as well as clothes for her new business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es: “Amanecer” es un grupo de señoras con mucha simpatía, todas esperan pacientemente el inicio de su reunión a la cabeza de su presidenta María F., ellas cuentan que se agruparon por la necesidad  de contar con un capital de trabajo, todas tienen sus propios negocios como ser la venta de juguetes, verduras y comida, requieren el préstamo para comprar mercadería, otras se dedican a la producción  de chamarras, tejido de aguayo (tejido colorido) y chompas, ellas necesitan  el préstamo para comprar tela y lana. Baciliza C., una de las integrantes de aproximadamente 40 años de edad, indica  que ella vende comida (pollos a la broaster) en su domicilio que está ubicado en la zona Bautista Zaabedra y ha visto la necesidad de comprar una cocina más grande que le permita fritar mayor cantidad de pollos y poder cubrir su mercado.
texts.en:
"Amanecer" (Dawn) is a group of very pleasant ladies who patiently await the start of their meeting, chaired by María Fernández. They have formed a group because they need working capital. They all have their own business, some of them are selling toys, vegetables or food and need a loan to buy merchandise, others are producing jackets, woven aguayo (a multicolored cloth) or sweaters and need a loan to buy fabric and wool.

One of the group members, Baciliza C., who is approximately 40 years old, said she serves food (broaster chicken) at her home in the area of Bautista Zaabedra and saw the need to buy a larger kitchen to fry more chicken and meet her customers' demand.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Goya

texts.es: Goya tiene 35 años, en su pareja encontró el mejor apoyo y la perfecta compañía, con quien tiene un hijo y juntos viven en la casa que con mucho esfuerzo lograron conseguir. Desde que aprendió el oficio de costurera empezó a recibir grandes pedidos para bordados, decorados, confección de prendas, etc., lo cual le ayudó a mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Goya trabaja en su casa en un espacio donde implementó su pequeño taller de costura y los materiales que utiliza los compra al por mayor para desarrollar mayores cantidades de prendas. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 2 años, tiempo que aprovechó para relacionarse con varios empresarios clientes y espera que esa lista siga creciendo. Para un futuro cercano espera contar con mejor maquinaria para realizar trabajos adicionales que le permitan incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Los 6 créditos que ha tenido con Microfinanzas PRISMA le permitieron mejorar su negocio, al igual que los de sus compañeras de banco comunal, donde vienen trabajando con mucho compromiso, este sería su 7mo préstamo. Los 2000 soles que solicita serán para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de los acabados de las prendas.
texts.en:
Goya is 35 years old. She found the best support and the perfect company with her partner. They have a son and they live together in a house that they were able to get through a lot of effort. Ever since she learned the trade of seamstress, she began receiving large orders for embroidery, decorations, sewing clothes, etc. This helped her improve her income. Goya works out of her house in an area where she set up her small sewing workshop. She buys the materials she uses wholesale to make a larger number of clothing articles. She has been doing this for 2 years. She took advantage of this time to get acquainted with various customers who are business owners and she hopes the list will continue to grow. She hopes to count on better machinery in the near future to do additional jobs which would allow her to increase her income. She was able to improve her business with the 6 loans she has had with Microfinanzas PRISMA, just like the members of her community bank that have been very committed to working. This would be her 7th loan. The 2000 PEN she has applied for will be used to purchase materials to make the clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing material

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es: el sr. Ramon Antonio V. tiene 37 años de edad, tiene mas de 15 años de dedicarse al tranporte de personas, el comenzo a trabajar como cobrador de un bus a los 17 años en la ruta que cubria de la universidad Autonoma de Honduras a su lugar de residencia, luego sirvio de despachador de taxis de la ruta UNAH-KENNEDY, despues uno de sus amigos le propuso que condujera su taxi por una pequeña tarifa que el debia pagarle diariamente, entonces el empezo a ahorrar para comprarse el carro que tiene ahora y ahora ya no tiene que pagar alquiler de carro, el actualmente necesita el credito para comprar el vidrio frontal y pintar el vehiculo ya que se lo exijen en el punto de taxis donde el trabaja.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramon Antonio V. is 37 years old. He has been transporting people for more than 15 years. At 17 years old he began working as a bus conductor for the route covering the Universidad Autonoma de Honduras to it's residence area. Then he served as a taxi driver for the UNAH-KENNEDY route. Later, one of his friends suggested that he conduct a taxi for at a small rate that he must pay him daily. Then he began to save to buy the car that he has now and now he no longer needs to pay a car rental. Now he needs the loan to buy the front windshield and to paint the car as it is required by the taxi stop where he works.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy a windshield and car paint

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 35 años, está casada y es madre de un hijo. Junto a su esposo pudo concretar la realización de su casa propia a base de mucho esfuerzo. Desde soltera se dedicó a trabajar en la venta de cosméticos, pues apoyaba a su familia con los gastos de la casa y ahora tiene una responsabilidad mayor en su propio hogar. Los 15 años de experiencia en este negocio le permiten desenvolverse adecuadamente en el comercio, además tiene gran cantidad de clientes que le hacen pedidos mensualmente. Todos los días se dedica a visitar a sus clientes regulares y por las tardes va en busca de otras personas para ofrecerles sus productos con la finalidad de que sus pedidos aumenten. Actualmente, Luisa ha puesto en marcha un nuevo proyecto, que es de instalar una tienda en su casa, local que está en construcción, pero pronto funcionará como una tienda de productos de belleza. Es por este proyecto que Luisa se está esforzando al máximo en sus horas de trabajo, realizando grandes recorridos por las calles de su localidad en busca de clientela. En los 14 préstamos que viene teniendo con Microfinanzas PRISMA ha trabajado con su banco comunal de manera muy responsable, gracias al empeño que ponen cada una de sus compañeras. Con los 2000 soles que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, en especial los más solicitados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luisa is 35 years old, is married and is the mother of one son. Together with her husband and with much effort she has been able to solidify the realization of owning her very own home. From the time she was single she worked in cosmetic sales, since she was supporting her family with the household expenses, and now she has more responsibility in her own home. Her 15 years of experience in this business have enabled her to manage properly in the business. What's more she has a large quantity of customers who order from her monthly. Everyday she visits her regular customers and in the afternoons she goes searching for new people to offer them her products with the aim of increasing her orders. Currently, Luisa has set a new project into motion, which is installing a store in her home, a location which is still in construction, but soon will function as a beauty products store. It is due to this project that Luisa is working her hardest during her work hours, carrying out large trips down the streets of her town in search of customers. In the 14 loans that she has had with Microfinanzas PRISMA, she has worked with her communal bank in a very responsible way, thanks to the effort put out by each of her partners. With the 2000 soles that she is requesting now she will buy a larger quantity of beauty products, especially those most requested by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer muy emprendedora, los años de dedicación en su trabajo y en su hogar le han permitido tener buenos frutos, pues junto a su esposo se esfuerzan por satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos dentro y fuera del hogar. Con su trabajo en diversas actividades logró ahorrar una buena cantidad de dinero que le permitió instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa, la cual viene funcionando por más de 37 años. Sin embargo, las largas horas de atención son muy pesadas debido a que hay gran demanda por las noches y trata de aprovecharlas a pesar del cansancio, aunque en compañía de su pareja y su hijo se torna menos pesada esta labor. Ahora, Rosa tiene pensado implementar nuevos productos en su negocio y requiere del capital necesario para la inversión, es por ello que atiende todos días en su tienda, brindando el mejor trato a sus clientes, quienes todos estos años se acostumbraron visitar la tienda de doña Rosa, quien es una persona muy amable con sus vecinos. Este es su crédito 14 con MFP y lo que la ha mantenido todos estos años (casi 7) en su banco comunal es el trabajo en equipo y el empeño que ponen todas sus compañeras. Con los 2000 soles que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtir mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is a hard working businesswoman. Her years of dedication to her work and home have enabled her to bear good fruits; along with her husband they work to meet the needs of their children within and beyond their home. With her work in various jobs she was able to save a good quantity of money that enabled her to open a grocery store in her home, which she has been running for more than 37 years. Nevertheless, the long hours are difficult because there is a high demand for remaining open at night and she tries to provide her best service in spite of being tired; with her husband and son this work is less intense. Now Rosa is thinking about adding new products to her business and needs capital to make the investment. So she is working in her store every day, providing the best customer service possible to her customers who all these years have become accustomed to visiting Rosa’s store, as she is very friendly with her neighbors. This is her 14th loan with MFP and what has supported her all these years (almost 7) with her communal bank is the teamwork and effort all her colleagues put into the system. With these 2000 soles that she seeks she will buy a large quantity of merchandise to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is a long-time business woman. She has been working in the beauty industry since she was 18 years old. In Columbia, where she immigrated from 8 years ago, she used the money she saved to open her own beauty salon. Six years ago, Bibiana decided to try her hand at a business in New York City. While working as a hair stylist, she began to sell perfumes and jewelry to some of her clients.

She first went to a bank to get the money she needed to start her business, but was turned away because of a lack of prior credit history. She came to ACCION USA, and because she was able to demonstrate a business cash flow, such as $3,000 from merchandise that she sold at Christmas time last year, she was approved for a small loan to purchase inventory.

With her new loan from ACCION USA, Bibiana is purchasing color pigments for applying permanent make-up to her clients. Each color pigment costs about $60 dollars. Although Bibiana continues to work as a hair stylist, her small business helps to increase her income. With this income, she has hopes to open her own store someday. Bibiana calls herself “happily divorced.” She is a single woman with an 18-year-old daughter who is optimistic about the life she can create for herself.

loans.use: To buy pigments for permanent makeup.

loans.name: Pasos Firmes Group 2

texts.en:
Ana Luisa J. is 54 years old and runs her own business selling fresh produce, meat, and used clothing from her home in the sugar cane community (called a "batey") of La Gina, which lies in the eastern part of the Dominican Republic. Today, Ana Luisa is requesting a new loan - her seventh loan to date -- from Kiva and Esperanza International so she can buy more merchandise, including onions, eggplant, potatoes, salami, chicken, and used men's and women's clothing, for her store. When her loan is funded, Ana Luisa will travel by bus and/or motorcycle taxi to La Romana, the closest big city, to buy the used clothing for her business, and she will go out further into the countryside to buy her produce from local farmers.

Ana Luisa's independent business is certainly a success story in its own right. She has been able to expand her business steadily over time, and she owns one of the most vibrant home enterprises in the La Gina batey. For example, the loan she will take out today is over twice the size of her very first loan, and she has expanded her merchandise offerings from chicken and used clothing to a whole variety of food and clothing goods. This is no small feat, considering that bateys are often the most economically stagnant communities in the Dominican Republic. Geographically isolated, and populated mostly by Dominicans of Haitian descent, who face the greatest difficulties in securing citizenship rights, starting and expanding a business in a rural batey is no easy task. Furthermore, it is especially impressive that Ana Luisa is able to take out a loan of this size at this time of the year, since commercial activity in the batey generally slows down considerably during the sugarcane off-season.

Ana Luisa uses the revenues from her business to help support her three grandchildren who live with her and her husband. She helps to pay for their school uniforms and school supplies, and she hopes that her business will continue to fund their education in the future. Ana Luisa has six grown children of her own and 25 grandchildren!

Ana Luisa appears in the center of the photograph with her four fellow group members of the Pasos Firmes (Solid Steps) Bank of Hope.

loans.use: New food items and used clothing for general store

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: el sr. Wilfredo J. tiene 47 años de edad el es un microempresario quien comenzo trabajando desde muy temprana edad en los talleres de talabarteria de la familia. esto le ayuda mucho porque a sus 19 años de edad dedidio crear su propio taller elaborando fajas, el tenia en su poder una pequeña maquina de costurar. ahora su empresa a crecido, tiene 3 empleados y todos se dedican a fabricar fajas, Wilfredo se dedica a vender las fajas en los mercados de Honduras y tambien las vende en El Salvador que de ahi es donde compra el cuero para fabricarlas, el necesita el credito para poder comprar mas cuero y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilfredo Jiménez is 47 years old and is a micro-business owner who began working from a very young age in the family leather goods shop. This helped him because at 19 years of age he decided to open his own shop making belts. He had at his disposal a small sewing machine. Now his business has grown, he has three employees, and all of them work making belts. Wilfredo works selling the belts in the markets of Honduras and he also sells them in El Salvador, where he purchases the leather that he uses. He needs a loan in order to be able to purchase more leather and thus increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase leather

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fanaticas Group

texts.es:
La asociación “fanáticas” esta formada por catorce integrantes, una de ellas es Rosalía C., actual presidente de la asociación, ella trabaja junto a su esposo prestando servicio en transporte publico, ella precisa comprar repuestos para su vehiculo,  otras de sus compañeras se dedican a la chiflería (elaboración y venta de  remedios caseros), tejidos a mano de mantas y chompas, venta de material escolar y otros.
Todas desean  mejorar sus negocios con la compra de productos, tienen la seguridad de obtener mejores ganancias, para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Fanáticas is an association comprised of 14 members. Rosalía C. is the current president. She works together with her husband providing public transportation services. She needs to buy replacement parts for her vehicle. Other members of the group make and sell home remedies, make hand woven blankets and sweaters, and sell school materials and other things. All of them wish to improve their businesses by buying products. They are sure that they will get better earnings to help their families’ well being.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
la sra. Candida O. tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera que se dedica desde muy temprana edad a la compra-venta de especias y condimentos, dicha actividad le a ayudao  a mantener y darle los estudios a su hija quien tambien tiene la misma orientacion para los negocios.
ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas condimentos al por mayor ya que asi tiene buenas ganancias y tambien quiere atender un sector mas amplio del actual con esto ella quiere tener mayores ingresos y asi poder salir adelante con su hija.
texts.en:
Mrs. Candida O. is 45 years old and is a single mother who has been buying and selling spices and condiments from a very young age. This activity helps her take care of and educate her daughter, who has the same inclination for business. She needs this loan so that she can buy more condiments wholesale, since this gives her better earnings. She also wants to serve a larger market, which will allow her to earn a larger income and will allow her to go forward with her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spices and condiments

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Granito De Oro Group

texts.es: La asociación “Granito de Oro” pertenece al centro focal Germán Buch, a la fecha esta formada por doce integrantes. Diferentes son los negocios de este grupo, como ser; venta de caramelos, cosméticos, ropa, comida, pero  en su mayoría son artesanos, se dedican al trenzado de mantas. Tal es el caso de Tatiana, una joven madre de vente años, que aprendió este oficio de sus padres, ella desea comprar una maquina tejedora que le permita aumentar su producción. Del mismo modo sus compañeras solicitan créditos para la compra de materia prima y maquinaria especial,  de este modo  aumentar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Granito de Oro Association belongs to the Germán Buch community center. There are currently 12 members. The members of the group have different businesses like selling candy, cosmetics, clothes, and food. However, most of them are artisans. They weave blankets. Such is the case of Tatiana, a young 20 year old mother. She learned this skill from her parents. She wants to buy a weaving machine that will allow her to increase her production. Her colleagues also are asking for loans to buy raw material and special machinery to increase their sales and get greater income for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Alba Lorena

texts.es: la sra. Alba L. tiene 33 años de edad, ella tiene un pequeño negocio en la colonia sagastume de la ciudad capital de Tegucigalpa, su negocio es una pulperia, tiene un año de tener su negocio, antes se dedicaba a la venta de golosinas en el porton de un centro de estudios de la colonia sagastume, junto a su esposo se ayudan mutuamente y salen adelante con todos los gastos del hogar. Alba es una mujer preparada, con el credito que esta solicitando lo quiere invertir en la compra de mas mercaderia para sutir mas su pulperia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alba L. is 33 years old. She has a small business in the Sagastume district in the capital city of Tegucigalpa. She has had a general store for one year. Before this, she sold sweets in the door of a school in the Sagastume district. She and her husband help each other and take care of all the household expenses. Alba is a competent woman, and with the loan she is requesting, she wants to invest in the purchase of more merchandise to increase the supply of goods in her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks, churros, bread, cookies, sweets, soups, pastas, sauces, salt, butter, candies, toilet paper, canned juice, and razors

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La Sra. Catalina P. D. Q. (60 años) está casada con el Sr. Rosendo Q. Andia por más D. 30 años. Tienen 6 hijos D. los cuales tres todavía viven con ellos. 

Se dedican a la lechería desD. hace más D. 30 años y cuentan con 10 cabezas D. ganado leche. Entregan toda la leche que producen a una empresa que elabora toda clase D. productos lácteos. El Sr. Rosendo también es agricultor y cultiva maíz para luego poder vender en los mercados locales. Con los ingresos percibidos pagan los estudios universitarios D. sus hijos. Se esfuerzan mucho para que sus hijos tengan una buena educacion y asi puedan enfrentar el mercado cada vez mas competitivo. 

La Sra. Catalina necesita el dinero para poder construir una cocina y un baño en su casa y así poder vivir mejor. En un futuro desea mejorar sus ingresos comprando mas vacas lecheras para seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Catalina P. D. Q. is 60 years old and has been married to Mr. Rosendo Q. Andia for more than 30 years. They have 6 children, three of whom still live with them. They have had a dairy for more than 30 years, and they have 10 milk cows. They deliver all of the milk they produce to a company that makes all kinds of dairy products. Mr. Rosendo is also a farmer, and he grows corn, which he then can sell in the local markets. With the income they earn, they pay for their children’s university educations. They work very hard so that their children can have a good education and can then face a more and more competitive market. Mrs. Catalina needs a loan so she can build a kitchen and a bathroom in her house, which will enable her to live better. In the future, she wants to increase her income and buy more milk cows so she can continue supporting her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build her house

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es: el sr. Jose Orlando P. tiene 40 años de edad, junto con su esposa Sandra Salvador tienen un negocio de venta de accesorios para carro como ser halogenas, pitos, porta placas, empaques, parabrisas, papel polarizado, el esta ubicado en el parque el obelisco de la ciudad de comayaguela, el hace el trabajo de polarizar carros y la esposa vende los accesorios. tienen 5 hijos a los cuales les han logrado dar educacion, salud y hogar. el necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jose Orlando P. is 40 years old and together with his wife Sandra Salvador runs an automotive accessory business selling items such as halogen lights, horns, licence plate frames, windshield washers, and window tinting film. He is located at the El Obelisco park in the city of Comayaguela. He tints car windows and his wife takes care of selling accessories. They have 5 children and they have managed to provide them all with an education, with health care and with a home. He requires a loan to purchase more merchandise, so as to increase his earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase automotive accessories

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pasos Firmes Group 3

texts.en:
Maria F. is 39 years old and owns her own home decorating and accessories business in the sugarcane community (called a "batey") of La Gina, which lies in the eastern part of the Dominican Republic. Today Maria will take out a new loan - her seventh one to date with Kiva and Esperanza International - so she can buy new merchandise, such as bedsheets, curtains, tablecoths, silverware, artificial flowers, and assorted ceramic decorative pieces for her store. Once her loan is funded, Maria will travel over three hours by bus to buy her merchandise in the capital city of Santo Domingo, and she will then sell her wares in her own community and in neighboring bateys.

The revenues from Maria's in-home enterprise are crucial to the well-being of her family. Along with her husband's earnings from cultivating and harvesting sugarcane, Maria's business supports six dependents, including four of her own children (ages 18, 16, and 15) and two nephews (ages 7 and 4). All of Maria's children attend school, and she hopes to be able to send them to the university some day. Maria recognizes the connection between the success of her business and the opportunities available to her children. She hopes her business will grow so that her children and nephews might have a better life. Currently, opportunities for socioeconomic mobility in the batey communities are scarce. The bateys are generally geographically isolated, and, because a majority of batey residents are of Haitian descent, they often face great challenges obtaining citizenship and other political rights in the Dominican Republic.

Maria is a member of Group 3 in the Pasos Firmes (Solid Steps) Bank of Hope. In the accompanying photograph of the borrowers in Pasos Firmes Group 3, she is second from the right.

loans.use: New merchandise for home decorating and accessories store

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
JUANA M. D. S., pertenece  al  Banco  Comunal “LAS LIBERTADORAS” su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Wayna Capac, tiene 52 años, 4 hijos mayores, y su esposo es pescador.

	Ella  tiene una bodega y además venD. comidas por la noches, el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en compra D. algunos abarrotes, para surtir su pequeña bodega, y desD. 3 años que está trabajando con Manuela Ramos ha ido creciendo su negocio cada vez y por eso le ha sido necesario subir el monto D. sus préstamos.

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles,  invertirá en  la inicial para comprar un motocar y el resto en compras D. abarrotes para surtir su tienda.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad  y porque contribuye con las mujeres D. esta región.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the "Las Libertadoras" (The Liberators) Community Bank, and her business is located on Wayna Capac street. She is a 52-year-old mother of four grown-up children, and her husband is a fisherman. She has a convenience store and also sells food in the evenings. The first loan she received from Kiva partner Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles, which she used to invest in the purchase of some groceries to stock her small store. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for the past three years and has grown her business with each credit, which is why she has had to increase the amount of her loans. With the current loan she is requesting of 1,500 soles (approximately $500), she plans to use it first to purchase a motocar and the remainder to purchase groceries to stock her store. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community and contributes to helping the women of the region.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motocar and grocery supplies

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Angel es una persona joven de 24 años de edad, vive en la zona de Villa Armonía. Tiene un Taller de Reparación de Calzados hace 3 años, pero trabaja reparando calzados hace cinco. Su padre, el señor  G., fue quien le enseñó esta actividad por que tambíen se dedica a lo mismo. Miguel tiene un hijo pequeño a quién quiere mucho. Además de trabajar en su taller, Miguel, tiene por hobby jugar futbol y wally los fines de semana junto a sus amigos de la zona. Él solicita el crédito para comprar material de trabajo como ser plantas de goma, suela y otros. Miguel es una persona muy conocida en su barrio, por que es responsable y puntual y todos sus clientes estan satisfechos con los trabajos que él realiza.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel is a young man of 24 who lives in the Villa Armonía zone. He has had a shoe repair shop for the past three years, but he has worked with footwear for the past five. His father, Mr. G., was who taught him the craft because that's how he made a living as well. Miguel has a young son whom he loves very much.

Along with working in his shop, Miguel's hobby is to play soccer and wallyball (a mixture of volleyball and racquetball) on the weekends with his friends. He is requesting the loan so he can purchase materials for his job, such as glue, soles and other items. Miguel is a person well known in his neighborhood for being responsible and punctual, and all his clients are satisfied with the work he does.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase glue, soles and other items

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Alma Rosa García ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente. 
En esté momento está Solicitando un préstamo para empezar la construcción de una cuarto ya que sus dos hijos están creciendo, necesitan su propio espacio en la casa. 
Pagaría el crédito con los ingresos de su trabajo como vendedora de servicios funerales, ya que su esposa el señor Tomas Flores se encargaría de los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Alma Rosa García has already received three loans with Kiva partner FVP, all of which she has repaid punctually. Currently she is requesting a loan to begin construction on a room in her home, since her two children are growing and need their own space in the home. She will repay the credit with income from her work in funeral services, while her husband, Tomas Flores, takes care of household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add a room to her home

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
El señor Marcial F. G. esta muy agradecido con la ayuda que le brindaron con el crédito anterior con el cual pudo poner una parte del techo pero le está haciendo el techo en un de los cuartos.
Solicitando nueva mente un préstamo para poder terminar el cuarto y así poderlo habitar lo más pronto posible ya que sus hijos están creciendo y necesitan su privacidad en la casa.
Don Marcial trabaja en una tortillería en el aria de producción, este es el ingreso que tiene para su familia, y con el cual una parte será para pagar esté nuevo préstamo.
 Cunado se realizo la visita a la vivienda del señor Marcial el se encontraba en su trabaja quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Carmen Hernández y uno de sus hijos quienes aparecen en la foto.
texts.en:
Marcial F. Garcia is very thankful for the help which they gave him with his previous loan with which he wa able to put up part of a roof, but he is making a roof on one of the rooms. He is asking for a loan again to be able to finish the room and so be able to occupy it as soon as possible now that his children are growing and need their privacy in the house. Marcial works in the production area of a tortilla factory, which is the income he has for his family, and with part of which he will pay this new loan. At the time of the visit to Marcial's home to take his picture he was at work, so his wife Carmen Hernandez and one of his children appear in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Putting up a roof

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es: El señor Pascual vive con su esposa la señora María y juntos son un matrimonio estable; tienen una tiendita de abarrotes de nombre “Abarrotes Mary” con una antigüedad de 15 años establecido, son personas muy constantes, trabajadoras y que se proponen lograr sus objetivos; están solicitando este crédito para la compra de mas mercancía para su negocio y así cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pascual lives with his wife María and they have a stable marriage together; they have a small grocery store named "Abarrotes Mary" which has been in establishment for 15 years. They are very hardworking and persevering people that are intent on achieving their goals; they are requesting this loan in order to buy more merchandise for their business and thereby meet the needs of their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the business

loans.name: María Angelina

texts.es:
La señora María Angélica C., está muy agradecida por el gran ayuda que le brindaron para invertir en su negocio el cual le está generando ingresos.
Nueva mente está solicitando su cooperación para un crédito, ya que tiene la necesidad de reparar el techo de su casa ya que el actual está en muy malas condiciones y teme que le pueda pasar un accidente. 
Planea pagar el préstamo con los ingreso de su esposa el señor Juan Francisco Mendoza quien trabaja en el ferrocarril en el aria de obrero.
texts.en:
María Angélica C. is very grateful for the great help that you have given her by investing in her business, which is generating income.

Now she is requesting your help in providing another loan, which she needs to repair the roof of her house. It is in bad shape, and she is afraid it could cause an accident.

She plans to repay the loan with the income of her husband, Juan Francisco Mendoza, who works for the railroad as a laborer.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing her roof

loans.name: Fabiola Haide

texts.es:
La señora Fabiola HaiD. es casada con el señor Marco Antonio quien trabaja para una empresa en el área D. mecánico desD. hace 18 años.
Juntos forman una familia muy unida, estable y trabajadora. 
Ella es líder y vendedora D. una línea D. joyería, cosméticos, bisutería, etc. sus ventas son através del catalogo D. pedidos así ella no solamente siempre esta al pendiente D. su familia y del hogar sino que además obtiene otros ingresos que contribuyen con el apoyo económico familiar, este es el motivo por el cual se esta tramitando este crédito, para realizar una inversión en este negocio practico, e incrementar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fabiola HaiD. is married to Mr. Marco Antonio, who has worked for a mechanics company for 18 years. Together they form a tight-knit family, stable and hard-working. She is a leader and seller of a line of jewelry and cosmetics that she sells through catalog orders, through which she does not always just look after her family and the home but can also obtain some income that contributes to the family's economic support. This is the motivation for processing this loan to make an investment in this business practice and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a business

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe A. tiene ya más de ocho con su negocio de papelería. Ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente.
Ella quiere invertir en compara mas mercancía para el regreso a clases es cuando tiene las mejores ventas, pero en esté momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
Es por eso que esta solicitando el préstamo y planea pagarlo con las ganancias del negocio.
Cuando se realizo la visita del negocio de la señora Guadalupe ella no se encontraba andaba comprando mercancía para el negocio quien nos atendió fue su esposo el señor Santiago Olguín quien es la persona de la foto.
texts.en:
Mrs. Guadalupe A. has been with her stationary business for more than eight years now. She has already gotten two loans with FVP which she has repaid punctually. She wants to invest in buying merchandise for the back-to-school season since it is when she has the best sales, but she currently does not have the necessary capital for the investment and she does not want her business to lose money since it is her family's source of income. It is for this reason that she is requesting the loan and plans to pay it back with the profits from her business. When the site visit was done Guadalupe was not there because she was out buying merchandise for the business. The person who helped us was her husband, Mr. Santiago Olguín, who is shown in the picture.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the "back-to-school" season

loans.name: Junior

texts.es:
Junior Zúñiga es una persona que esta muy agradecida con la fundación ya que se le apoyado para el mejoramiento de su vivienda. El ya lleva 2 créditos el cual ha sido excelentísimo cliente y ahora va por el tercero. El primer lo utilizó para la construcción de un cuarto el cual termino y ahora quiere mejorarlo por dentro, le hace falta el enjarre y una pintada ya que Junior lo construyo para sus tres pequeñitos. El segundo fue para levantar una barda como pueden leer este señor ha aprovechado totalmente de este apoyo ya que el se ha beneficiado como también su propia familia.
Con esta construcción el le da a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y un patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Junior Zúñiga is someone who is very grateful for Fundación because it has helped him with home improvements. He has already taken out two loans which he has been an excellent customer for and now he is going for his third. He used the first one for building a bedroom which he finished and now he has to fix it up on the inside; it needs stucco and a paint job since Junior built it for his three small children. The second loan was for building a wall. As you can see, this man has taken full advantage of this support since it has benefitted him and his own family. With this construction he is giving his family a better quality of life and inheritance to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to fix up a bedroom

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana S. is from the village of San Roque, Valencia City Bukidnon. She is 58 years old. Susana is married and has five adult children. Susana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Susana has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (about $167) a month for these activities.

This year, Susana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susana is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Susana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

Note: This picture was taken at Susana's store during her non-operating day.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.en:
Perfecta U. is from the village of San Roque Bukidnon. She is 54 years old. Perfecta is separated from her spouse and has eight adult children. To make a living, Perfecta owns & operates a food stall or "ala carte" which operates at nighttime. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products like grilled chicken and pork parts in the local community. Perfecta has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Perfecta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perfecta is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase chicken and pork for her "ala carte" business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Perfecta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and save for future emergencies. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase chicken and pork

To make a living, Jean owns & operates a specialized retail business peddling food products, including snacks and viands, in the local community. Jean has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Maribel C. is from the village of San Roque, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Maribel is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Maribel owns & operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community including bananas, spices and others. loans.name: Roem

texts.en: Roem S. is a single mother blessed with seven children. Two of the children are married and living in new homes, while the other five are single and earn a living by cultivating a rice crop. Roem S. was married, but divorced her husband years ago. She currently owns a plot of farmland that was inherited from her grandmother, where she plants various crops to make a living. She grew rice two months ago, but her rice tree is growing not so good due to the lack of fertilizer. Facing that fact, Roem S. would like to seek a loan to buy fertilizer to fatten her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad S. is from the village of San Roque, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Natividad is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Natividad owns & operates a business peddling specialty food products, specifically snacks, in the local community. Natividad has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Natividad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Natividad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe P. is from the village of Unidos. She is 53 years old. Fe is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a business running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 16th loan taken out by Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Nellie Fe

texts.en: Nellie Fe J. is from the village of Unidos. She is 38 years old, is engaged, and has four school-aged children. Nellie Fe owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. In 1999, Nellie Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Nellie Fe is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 16th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to be used as working capital

loans.name: Sesariana

texts.en:
Sesariana S. owns and operates a business venture providing hairdressing and beauty services such as manicure, pedicure and others in her community. She is 42 years old, married and has six adult children. They are from the village of Marilag, Bukidnon. Sesariana has been in this business for over 29 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Sesariana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Sesariana is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children and supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand beauty services provided

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en:
Chheang H. is a 40-year-old farmer and father. He is blessed with three kids, one of whom is attending the public high school while the other two are no longer in school and work in the farm field. His wife, Rose Saroeun, is 46 and works in the farming business. Chheang H. inherited the farmland from his grandmother and he and his wife use it to grow different kinds of crops.

The rice-growing season is coming; Chheang H. lacks farming equipment to facilitate growing a rice crop. Hence, he has decided to seek a loan to purchase rice seed, fertilizers, and a plowing tool.

Note: Chheang H.'s wife appears in the photo above.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed, fertilizers, and a plowing tool

loans.name: Herolyn

texts.en: Herolyn T. is from the village of Marilag, Bukidnon. She is 23 years old, married, and has a school-aged child. Herolyn owns and operates a business selling fish and vegetables in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Herolyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn E. is from the village of Marilag, Bukidnon. She is twenty-nine years old and married with one school-age child. To make a living, Genelyn owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Genelyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 8000 PHP for 4 months for these activities.

In 2009, Genelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Genelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to expand her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Sol Group

texts.es:
La señora Nelly M., tiene 31 años  D. edad, conviviente y tiene  06 hijos.
Asume el cargo D.  presidenta D. la alcancía comunal “Mujeres del Sol”,  conformada por  11 socios. Trabaja con  EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad  hace 1 año, se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. segunda, lleva 4 años dedicada en este negocio, también se dedica a la venta D. tejidos  manuales hechos D. lana D. alpaca como ponchos, chales, etc.
Con este préstamo D.  S/.800.00 Nuevos soles lo invertirá para compra D. mercadería D. ropa y a la vez comprar un poco D. lana D. alpaca  para poder incrementar sus ganancias y ayudar a su familia, hasta el momento le ha podido dar una carrera  técnica D. mecánica a su hijo y también a podido construir su casa con material noble.
En el futuro le gustaría poner una bodega en su casa y una cabina D. Internet.
Los demas 10 Integrantes, compartiran el saldo restante del prestamo, los cuales seran utilizados en la adquisicion D. productos para la venta.
texts.en:
Nelly M. is 31 years old, is a live-in partner, and has six children. She holds the position of president of the "Mujeres del Sol" Communal Bank, comprised of 11 members. She has been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for one year, has been selling second-hand clothing for four years, and also sells handwoven fabrics maD. of alpaca wool like ponchos, shawls, etc. With her portion of this group loan, which is 800 nuevos soles, she will invest in more clothing to sell and at the same time buy a little bit of alpaca wool to be able to increase her profits and help her family. So far she has been able to proviD. her son with a technical education in mechanics and also has been able to build a house with good material. In the future she would like to put a cellar and an internet cubicle in her house. The other members of the group will share the remaining balance of the loan, the majority of them using it for the purchase of products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth B. is from the village of Lopez Jaena. She is twenty-two years old and married with two children, both of whom are infants. To make a living, Janeth owns and operates a business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $85 a month for these activities.

In 2005, Janeth joined PMPC, one of Kiva's field partners, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Janeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. That loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Janeth is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will also be used to purchase more fish to sell. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en: Chhom H. is fifty-seven years old and a widow with three children. Her husband died of senility years ago. Two of her children are single and employed in different jobs, while the other one is married and lives independently. Chhom is an energetic and determined woman who has worked hard to earn enough money to feed all her children ever since they were very young. Because farming is her main source of income, Chhom H. will use her loan to hire a laborer to plow the farm field and then will buy rice seed and fertilizers.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow the field and to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda S. is from the village of Marilag, Bukidnon. She is fifty-two years old and separated from her spouse. She has two grown children. To make a living, Minda owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells several different products in the local community. Minda has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Minda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Minda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Minda's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: The smiling person in the photograph above is Mr. Tan H. in his farm field. Since 1979, he has been growing various crops on his own farmland in the village. His wife works with him on the farm. Beside his farming business, he uses his old car to transport passengers every day for additional profit. The family has eight children: five are married and have started their own households, and the other three are still living at the family home. Tan H. will be using the loan money to buy more fertilizer for his rice crop that is not doing well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky M., 28, is from the village of Marilag, Bukidnon. Vicky is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Vicky owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling bags and sandals to local businesses and community members. loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is married with four children. Her family of five lives in the city of Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Dilorom sells kid’s clothing in the local market “Ganjina”. She started this venture about 10 years ago. Dilorom has a perfect credit history with IMON International. She has requested a loan of $800 for one main purpose; she would like to use the loan as working capital to buy necessary inventory in order to further develop her business. With her history thus far as an entrepreneur, it will be exciting to watch how her business grow and prosper in the future. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
