loans.name: Alimardon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Алимардон  Мажидов проживает в городе Истаравшане. Для того чтобы содержать семью: жену Садокат, 3 детей, родителей и сестренку Дилнозу, он занимается откормом скота и переработкой молока. Дома Алимардон имеет 6 голов овец и 2 коровы. Два раза в день, утром и вечером жена Алимардона доит коров, и из части полученного молока готовит масло, творог, кефир, сливки. Вторую часть молока и молочных изделий  мать Алимардона каждое утро продает на рынке. 
Алимардон начинал свою деятельность животноводства 5 лет назад. Он купил двух овец и корову, откормил их и продал на рынке. Получив от проданного скота прибыль, он   снова купил молодых  ягнят и теленка, но количество его ягнят, уже составляло 4 голов.
И так, он уже делает 5 лет.
Алимардон планирует увеличить количество своего скота, путем их размножения, и поэтому подал заявку на получение кредита  для откорма своего домашнего скота.
texts.en:
Alimardon M. lives in the city of Istaravshan. In order to support his family: wife Sadokat, 3 children, parents and sister Dilnoza, he is involved in raising livestock and processing milk. Alimardon has 6 heads of sheep and 2 cows at home. Alimardon's wife milks the cows twice per day, in the mornings and evenings, and uses some of the milk to make butter, cottage cheese, kefir and heavy cream. Alimardon's mother sells unused part of the milk and dairy products at a market every morning.

Alimardon started his animal husbandry business 5 years ago. He bought two sheep and a cow, raised them and sold them at a market. Using the profits he received from the sale, he bought lambs and a calf, and his quantity of lambs now consisted of 4 heads. And he has been doing so for 5 years already. Alimardon plans to increase the quantity of his livestock by breeding it. This is why he put in a request for a loan to feed his domestic livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding livestock

loans.name: Santa Cecilia 2 Group

texts.en:
Santa Cecilia II is a new communal bank with Kiva partner, ManueL. Ramos.  It was founded a year ago by member Victoria O. C., who named the bank after the patron saint of music.  She chose this name to honor her grandfather, who very much enjoyed music.  

Santa Cecilia II has 11 members who want to take out a loan during this cycle.  All are women who live in different parts of the city of Pucallpa.  The total amount of loans needed by Santa Cecilia is 5,700 soles.  Indivdual communal bank members are asking for loans ranging from 300 soles (about $100) to 1000 soles (about $333).  These loans will be paid back in four months.

The women of Santa Cecilia dedicate themselves to a variety of different businesses, including selling cooked food from their homes in the evenings, selling beauty products, sewing, making beaded sandals, and running small grocery shops.  The women will be using their loans to invest in necessary goods for their businesses.  

The women of Santa Cecilia II are pictured here with their loan officer, Iris Diana, in ManueL. Ramos's Pucallpa office.

loans.use: Food for restaurant businesses; various other products for sale

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Добрая и трудолюбивая женщина с 20 летним стажем в сфере животноводства и переработки молока  Мамлакат Хочибоева подала заявку на КИВА, для того чтобы ее поддержали в сфере ее деятельности. Мамлакат запрашивает сумму в размере 1200 сомони, и планирует потратить ее для откорма скота, за которым она ухаживает в домашних условиях. 
У  Мамлакат 6 детей, ее супруг Чуманазар работает преподавателем в местной школе. Его заработная плата составляет  всего  лишь 250 сомони, поэтому  дополнительно семья занимается сельским хозяйством, а Мамлакат животноводством и переработкой молока.
Ей помогают ее старшие дети.
texts.en:
Mamlakat H. is a kind and hard-working woman, who has 20 years of experience in the animal husbandry and milk processing fields. She put in this request to Kiva to get support in her business. Mamlakat is requesting a loan in the sum of 1200 somoni and is planning to use it for feeding livestock that she cares for at home. Mamlakat has 6 children, and her husband, Chumanazar works as a teacher at a local school. His salary is only 250 somoni. This is why the family is also involved in agriculture, and Mamlakat is involved in animal husbandry and milk processing. Her older children help her.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For livestock feeding

loans.name: Naseem Muhammad Khan Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji has been a citizen of a city called Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is M. K. and he works in animal husbandry. He fattens goats and sells them at the animal market. His hard work gives him good income. His customer list consists of butchers because they prefer to buy naturally bred animals.

Naseem baji also helps him by taking care of his goats. She is applying for a loan to buy animal feed so that her husband can complete the orders from his customers and earn more income. She is the group leader for four other women from her locality. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Another Naziran baji wants a loan to buy a lathe. Parveen Akhtar baji and Sajida baji each want a loan to buy bakery items (biscuits and chips) to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Naseem baji is seated third from the right in this photo.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for their animal-selling business

loans.name: Jonie

texts.en:
Jonie C. is a farmer. He is 33 years old and still single. He wants to have a family but before he can do that, he will make it sure he has enough savings for a brighter future. He grows rice and vegetables.

He would like to ask for a loan worth Php 7,000. He will use the loan to buy complete fertilizers and rice seeds. This will really make his business even better.

CEVI provides Mr. C. with not just loans but training in business and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy complete fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Гулшан Саидмахмадова родилась в 1982 году,  замужем, заботливая мать малышки Гулбахор. 
Гулшан в домашних условиях ухаживает за скотом, это основной источник дохода в их семье. Корова в день до 10 литров дает молоко, которое и перерабатывает Гулшан. Она хочет дополнительно купить еще одну корову, чтобы получать больше литров молока и готовить из них молочные изделия на продажу. С этой целью она обратилась в нашу организацию и в КИВА. Планируемая сумма для получения в кредит 1200 сомони.
Супруга Гулшан зовут Гоибназар, он работает трактористом в колхозе. Дополнительно супруги занимаются сельским хозяйством, арендовав 20га земли, они посадили картошку.
 Урожай картошки получат осенью.
texts.en:
Gulshan S. was born in 1982. She is married and is a caring mother of her child, named Gulbahor. Gulshan takes care of livestock at home; this is the primary source of income in their family. A cow gives up to 10 liters of milk, which Gulshan processes. She wants to purchase an additional cow in order to obtain more liters of milk and make dairy products from it for sale. She reached out to our organization and Kiva to accomplish this goal. She plans to obtain a loan in the sum of 1200 somoni.

Gulshan's husband is named Goibnazar. He works as a tractor driver at a collective farm. In addition, the husband and wife are involved in agriculture. Having leased 20ha of land, they planted potatoes. They will harvest potatoes in the autumn.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina E. is from the village of Alangilan, Sagay Camiguin. She is 45 years old. Marina is married and has 8 children. To make a living, Marina owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling root crops including camote (sweet potatoes) and cassava and others in the local community. Marina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from HSPFI. Marina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Abida Muhammad Tariq Group

texts.en:
Abida baji is the wife of M. T. who has lived in a city called Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. She is a very hard-working lady. She prepares embroidered dresses and sells them to the clothing  shops and earns income. She uses her income as it becomes necessary. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community. People prefer to buy groceries from his shop because of his normal rates and quality items. Abida baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop.

She is the group leader for three other women from her locality. Ramzana baji and Gulnaz begum baji each want a loan to buy clothes to sell. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Abida baji is seated second from the left and showing her handmade dresses by hanging them in the window in this photo.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her family's grocery shop

loans.name: Tayyaba Parveen Rahmat Ullah Group

texts.en:
Tayyaba Parveen baji has been a citizen of a city called Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. She is a very hard-working lady. She runs a beauty salon in the community. She has been in this business for over 5 years. All the women of her community come to her for different purposes. Some come to dye their hair, and some come for different hair styles. Tayyaba baji is applying for a loan to buy materials (scissors, creams, and cosmetics) for her beauty salon.

She is the group leader for two other women from her locality. Sarwar baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Tayyaba baji is seated in the center of the baji’s.

loans.use: to buy materials for her beauty salon

loans.name: Lowela

texts.en:
Lowela O. is from the village of Quiboro, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 25 years old. Lowela is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lowela owns and operates a business venture in the service sector. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transport services with the help of their motor vehicle in the local community. Lowela has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lowela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lowela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lowela is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used partly for repair and maintenance; a portion of it will be used for venturing into a food sector business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Lowela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: a portion for repair and maintenance of motor vehicle and the other portion to start up a food business

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Заботливая мать 3 детей и любящая жена  Махбуба Джураева имеет 15 летний опыт работы в сфере животноводства. Махбуба проживает вместе со своей семьей в городе Истаравшане. Благодаря своему трудолюбию  в течении 15 лет, она смогла укрепить сферу своей деятельности. Дополнительным семейным доходом, которым занимаются супруги, является выращивание сельхозкультур. 
Махбуба запрашивает сумму в размере 1200 сомони, для откорма скота и переработки молока.
texts.en:
A caring mother of 3 children and a loving wife, Mahbuba D. has 15 years of experience in the animal husbandry field. Mahbuba lives together with her family in the city of Istaravshan. Thanks to her hard work during the last 15 years, she has been able to strengthen her business. In addition, Mahbuba and her husband supplement their income with agriculture. Mahbuba is requesting a loan in the sum of 1200 somoni for livestock feeding and milk processing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding and milk processing

loans.name: Amber Shaheen Asghar Ali Group

texts.en:
Amber Shaheen baji is the wife of A. A. and he has lived in a city called Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community and Amber baji helps him by selling the groceries when her husband gets tired. They both are very efficient in their work. They have been running a grocery shop for over 5 years. Amber baji is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her husband’s grocery shop.

This loan group is consists of three additional people:

Rani baji and Riazan baji each want a loan to buy fertilizer to sell.
 
Waziran baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart to carry loads.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: Amber baji is standing second from the right in this photo.

loans.use: To buy groceries for their grocery shop

loans.name: Sikudhani

texts.en:
Sikudhani is a member of the Maendeleo borrower group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is a 23-year-old woman, married, and the mother of 2 children. Her children are aged 6 and 2.

Sikudhani started her own wholesale business 3 years ago. She works 5 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 70,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Sikudhani’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to expand her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Sikudhani hopes to pay school fees, save money, to do repairs, get more food for family, and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Khalida Rajab Ali Group

texts.en:
My name is Khalida and I have been a citizen of a city called Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 18 years. I am married to R. A. who is a very nice person. He keeps me motivated to move forward. I operate a milk-selling business and my husband helps me by selling it. I buy milk from the milk shops and sell to the community and earn income. I have been doing this work for the past 6 years. People have trust in my business and they give me orders for milk. I am applying for a loan to buy milk to grow the income of my milk-selling business. 

This loan group is consists of five additional people: 

Shamim baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. 

Mairaj baji and Khursheed begum baji each want a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. 

Ramzana baji and Ghulam Fatima baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their animal-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: Khalida baji is standing third to the right among the baji’s.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell

loans.name: Moshi

texts.en:
Moshi is a member of the Mwangata C borrower group in Ilala, Iringa. She is a 38-year-old woman, married, and has 5 children. Her children are ages 18, 16, 13, 5, and 3 years.

Moshi started her own business selling CDs 2 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 90,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Moshi’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 300,000 Tsh in order to to buy more CDs. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Moshi hopes to save money, repair her house, get more food for her family, and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more CDs to sell

loans.name: Mukhtar Begum Muhammad Hanif Group

texts.en:
Mukhtar begum baji is the wife of M. H. and they have lived in a city called Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 19 years. She never got an education because her father was a farmer and had the responsibility for a big family. Her husband is involved in animal husbandry. He feeds various animals such as goats and buffaloes and sells them at the animal markets. He has been doing this work for over 5 years. Mukhtar baji is applying for a loan to buy animal feed to expand her husband’s animal-selling business.  

She is the group leader for four other women from her locality. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy another bike for her bike rental business.  Munir baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Razia baji wants a loan to buy wheat to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Mukhtar baji is standing in the middle of the baji's in this photo.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for their animal-selling business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy E. is from the village of Naasag, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 35 years old. Nancy is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nancy owns and operates a business venture in the specialized retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling agricultural products like bananas, coconuts, sweet potatoes, etc. in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nancy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional agricultural products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Nancy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Shahnaz Allah Ditta Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji has been a citizen of a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. She is married to A. D. who is involved in a fertilizer-selling business. He provides fertilizer to the farmers and takes orders from the shops. He earns good income from this business. He has 10 years of experience in this business. Shahnaz baji is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer to grow her husband’s business. 

This loan group consists of four additional people: 

Siani baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her dairy business.
 
Farida baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

Naseem baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for her bike rental business. 

Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Shahnaz baji is standing in the middle of the baji’s.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Geraldin

texts.en:
Geraldin L. is from the village of Naasag, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 22 years old. Geraldin is single. To make a living, Geraldin owns and operates a clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general clothing or Ready-to-Wear clothing to local community members. Geraldin has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Geraldin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraldin is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Geraldin from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Махбуба  Хучаназарова  родилась в 1983 году.  Махбуба  замужем, мать двоих  детей. 
   Ее основное занятие это откорм скота и переработка молока. За 6 лет своей деятельности она получила неплохой доход, который и помогает содержать семью.
Муж Махбубы работает трактирщиком в колхозе. Супруги дополнительно на 30га земли вырастили картошку и продают ее на рынке.
Кредит Махбуба хочет получить для откорма скота и переработки молока.
texts.en:
Mahbuba H. was born in 1983. Mahbuba is married and is a mother of two children. Her primary business is feeding livestock and processing milk. Throughout the six years of her business activity, she received a good income, which helps support the family. Mahbuba's husband works as a tractor driver at a collective farm. The husband and wife also grow potatoes on 30ha of land and sell them at a market. Mahbuba wants to obtain a loan for feeding livestock and processing milk.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding livestock and processing milk

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila M. is from the village of Umycco, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 29 years old. Laila is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Laila owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector in peddling. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetable products including spices in the local community. Laila has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Laila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laila is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Laila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Chabor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Чабор  Бобоев животновод с 18 летним стажем работы. Очень опытный человек в сфере животноводства. Знакомые и соседи Чабора, которые начинают заниматься животноводством, часто обращаются к нему за советом. Этот добрый и отзывчивый человек готов всегда придти на помощь и дать дельный совет.
Жена Чабора Шоира домохозяйка, она уделяет особое внимание  воспитанию и учебе своих детей. 
 В откорме скота и переработке молока Чабору помогает дочь Мохира. Чабор подал заявку на получение кредита  для откорма скота.
Дополнительный семейный доход Чабор получает от продажи сухофруктов на рынке своего города.
texts.en:
Chabor B. has 18 years of experience in animal husbandry. He is very skilled in this field. Chabor's friends and neighbors, who begin to get involved in animal husbandry, often come to him for advise. This is a kind and receptive person, who is always ready to help and give business advise. Chabor's wife, Shoira, is a homemaker. She devotes special attention to raising and educating their children. Chabor's daughter, Mohira, helps him with livestock feeding and milk processing. Chabor requested this loan for livestock feeding. Chabor also receives supplemental income from sales of dried fruits at a market in his city.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

texts.en:
Tes P., 54, lives in Pursat province, Cambodia. She has owned a plot of land since 1999 where she grows both rice and vegetable crops. She can plant her crops twice a year: in the dry season and the rainy season – a skill she learned from her grandparents.

Tes P. is married to Souy Kimsean, 56, who works with her on the farm. This couple has given birth to four children, three of whom are married and the other one attends the local high school.

Tes P. will be using her loan to buy a half-hectare (1.25 acres) of farmland and ten sacks of fertilizers in order to successfully grow crops.

loans.use: To buy a half-hectare of farmland and ten sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: George Kiura

texts.en: George N. is a 37-year-old married man with two children. His primary business is showing videos and satellite TV in a small theater, and he and his wife also have a bread-distribution business. He has been in the business for eight years and is currently making a profit of about 11,500 Kenyan shillings ($150 U.S.) a month. George was introduced to KADET by the chairman of the KADET borrowing group he joined. George's business is situated in an area with a high population of young people who like watching football on DSTV. He would like to use his loan to expand his video showroom to accommodate more viewers who are growing in numbers. He hopes to open a hardware business in the future. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To expand his small theater that shows movies, videos and satellite TV

Алимардон ознакомившись с условиями организации, впервые кредитовался  на сумму 1600 сомони. Успешно использовав полученный кредит и примерно его погашая,  он увеличил количество своего скота. 
В данный момент он запрашивает сумму в размере 2000 сомони для откорма скота и переработки молока.
texts.en:
With the help of his wife, Mukaddas, brother, Kamol, and sister-in-law, Hursheda, Alimardon S. raises cattle at home. After familiarizing himself with our organization's conditions, Alimardon obtained his first loan for 1600 somoni. Using that loan successfully and repaying it in a timely manner, he increased the quantity of his livestock. Currently, he is requesting a loan in the sum of 2000 somoni for livestock feeding and milk processing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

texts.en:
Ester is a member of the Rafiki borrower group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. Her children are 19 and 15 years old.   

Ester has had a tailoring business for 12 years. She works 8 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Ester’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more material. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Ester hopes to do repairs, pay school fees, improve her home, get more food for her family and expand her business. 

Sikudhani, another member of the Rafiki borrower group, has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to support her own business of selling charcoal and bites.

loans.use: to buy more material

loans.name: Nonette

texts.en:
Nonette A. is from the village of Langcangan, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 27 years old. Nonette is single and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Nonette owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nonette has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month from this activity.

On December 16, 2008, Nonette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nonette has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Nonette is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Гуласал женщина 45 лет , замужем , имеет четверых детей. Сама нигде не работает , муж работает в колхозе поливщиком земли. Он получает очень маленькую заработную плату, поэтому занимается вместе с семьёй откормом скота. Когда он на работе , за скотом смотрит Гуласал.Сейчас у неё  три коровы, для закупа ещё пары дойных коров Гуласал решила получить кредит.
texts.en:
Gulasal is a 45-year-old woman, who is married and has four children. She is not employed, and her husband works at a collective farm, watering land. He earns a very small salary and, thus, is involved in raising livestock with the help of his family. When he is at work, Gulasal looks after the livestock. She now has three cows. Gulasal decided to obtain a loan to purchase two more dairy cows.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two dairy cows

texts.en:
Irina is married with one daughter. She sells clothing at the central market in the city of Kherson. She has been in this business for 12 years. Irina is very persistent, disciplined and creative. All these character traits help her to succeed in her business. Irina's kiosk is located at a good spot at the market and she always has many customers.

Irina would like to borrow 15,222 UAH to increase her assortment of clothing for sale. She works hard to develop her business. Irina's goal is to be a successful and independent person, able to provide for her family and help others as well.

texts.en:
Hélène G., 52, is married and the mother of 5 children. She sells generic products in Assahoun, a village situated about 50 km from Lomé. She has been in this business for 5 years and is hoping with this loan to expand her little business by buying new products. She is counting on this opportunity to satisfy the demand of her clientele and earn more money to support her family.

С раннего утра Хушвахт готовит корм своему скоту, его жена доит молоко и поит скот. Так начинается утро Хушвахта и его семьи. В течении дня ухаживать за скотом ему помогает брат Суюнбой.
Дополнительно Хушвахт занимается сельским хозяйством. Он запрашивает сумму в размере 2000 сомони, для того чтобы использовать ее для откорма скота.
texts.en:
Hushvaht B. is involved in animal husbandry. He has 7 heads of cattle at home. Hushvaht lives in the city of Istaravshan. Early in the mornings, Hushvaht prepares feed for his livestock, and his wife milks the cows and gives them water. This is how mornings start for Hushvaht and his family. His brother, Suyunboi helps him look after the livestock during the day. In addition, Hushvaht is involved in agriculture. He is requesting a loan in the sum of 2000 somoni to use it for feeding livestock.

loans.name: Baasantsetseg

texts.en: Baasantsetseg L. is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter is 23 years old and studies in a local university. Baasantsetseg L. has a small retail business in women’s and men’s clothing and shoes. She rents a small stall in Bambagar shopping center, one of the large indoor shopping centers in the city, and sells various women’s and men’s apparel. She mostly purchases her retail clothes from Ereen, China, a border town from where many of the Chinese cheap products are imported to Mongolia. Since the start in 2004, her business has been quite successful. Her business capital has increased from 200,000 MNT to 2,500,000 MNT (1 USD = 1,450 MNT). Baasantsetseg L. says that she would like to use her business profit to help launch her son's business. Upon his high school graduation, her son intends to start a retail business similar to his mother's. She requests a loan to purchase more clothes as her inventory of clothes has run out. About XacBank: Founded in 1998, XacBank is a community development bank and microfinance institution in Mongolia, and is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar. It currently serves approximately 16,000 micro-clients at 76 branches in all 21 aymags (provinces) in Mongolia, making it the largest microfinance institution in the country. XacBank's mission is to contribute to sustainable development of Mongolia that can come only from educated and skilled people and competitive and dynamic businesses concerned equally about Planet, People, and Profit. The Bank will provide equitable access to transparent, reliable and responsive banking products and services to the Bank’s clients, including its traditional micro-entrepreneurs as well as small and medium businesses. Your loan enables XacBank to expand its micro-loan capacity and to return a portion of the interest back to the borrower at the end of the loan term. To learn more, please visit the XacBank website at: www.xacbank.mn.

loans.use: To purchase spring and autumn shoes for her business

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en: Sergei is married with two daughters. He sells shoes at Dneprovski market in Kherson city. He started this business 10 years ago. At that time, he lost his job and his family needed a stable source of income. Sergei saw the positive experience of his friends and decided to try. Sergei is the kind of person who can finish things he starts. He is disciplined and responsible. He is persistent enough to overcome barriers on the way to success. Today this business brings 7,000 UAH of income and enables Sergei to provide for his family. Sergei would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to purchase more shoes. Sergei enjoys his business and wants to develop it even further.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn T. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 32 years old, is married to Lloyd, and has two school-aged children. Merlyn owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling processed food products such as longganisa (Filipino-style sausages) and dressed chicken in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month. In July 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Jekafo 1 De Toura Kalaga Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe JEKAFO 1  est composé de femmes mariées du village de Toura Kalaga de la ville de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans, au moins 5 enfants et  cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe JEKAFO 1 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  le  prêt précédent, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Kimparana  ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe JEKAFO 1 de TOURA KALAGA comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25 000 à 20 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The JEKAFO 1 group is made of married women of the Toura Nabitokan village, in the city of SAN (Ségou Region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), who live in traditional families. They average 45 years of age, and have at least 5 children. They grow peanuts.

Eager to make their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the JEKAFO 1 group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago. After having repaid the previous loan without problems, they are now seeking their second farming loan.

This loan will be used to buy, exclusively at the grand market in Kimparana, a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, the crops are stored for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Kimparara and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their products, the members of the JEKAFO 1 group count on turning a profit of XOF 25000 to 20000 (ca US$ 55 to 45) each, to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seeds, small materials, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina S. is from the city of Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Regina owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2003, Regina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Regina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her seventh from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kibwabwa Group

texts.en:
Jojina is a member of the Kibwabwa borrower group in Ruaha, Iringa. She is a 33-year-old woman, married, and mother of 2 children. Her children are ages 4 and 16.

Jojina has had her own shop for 5 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 250,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Jojina’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 300,000 TZS in order to buy more items for her shop, like rice and oil. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Jojina hopes to do repairs, to get more food for her family, to pay school fees, and to expand her business.

Romana, another member of the Kibwabwa borrower group, has also requested 200,000 TZS in order to support her own shop business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her shop

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina E. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 50 years old. Adelina is widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Adelina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, butchering and selling meat in the market. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering and selling pork in the market. Adelina has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Adelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Adelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family and improve/expand the business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Oyuntuya Samdan is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two children are both small and stay home. Her husband works at Zamiin Uud, a border town with Ereen, China—the busiest and largest border with China. As her husband works full-time in Zamiin Uud, he is rarely at home. That's why she decided to pursue a small business by herself, instead of solely depending on her husband's salary. In 2005, she rented a small space and ran a small teashop. However, due to high rent, she decided to exit the teashop business. In 2009, she acquired a license to become an official distributor for a Russian company that sells health products extracted from bees' honey. Since she is the only one with the license in her town, she hopes to do well with the business. Since the start a few months earlier, her sales of health products have been doing considerably well. She says that she is working hard to introduce the honey products to locals and needs a personal computer to make marketing materials and purchase products online. She requests a loan to purchase a computer with Internet capabilities, with which she can do her own less costly marketing and order her products online.

About XacBank:
Founded in 1998, XacBank is a community development bank and microfinance institution in Mongolia, and is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar. It currently serves approximately 16,000 micro clients at 76 branches in all 21 aymags (provinces) in Mongolia, making it the largest microfinance institution in the country.

XacBank's mission is to contribute to sustainable development of Mongolia that can come only from educated and skilled people and competitive and dynamic businesses concerned equally about planet, people, and profit. The bank will provide equitable access to transparent, reliable, and responsive banking products and services to the bank’s clients, including its traditional micro-entrepreneurs as well as small and medium-sized businesses.

Your loan enables XacBank to expand its microloan capacity and return a portion of the interest back to the borrower at the end of the loan term.

To learn more, please visit the XacBank website at: www.xacbank.mn

loans.use: To purchase a personal computer for her business

loans.name: Haleema Muhammad Yousaf Group

texts.en:
Haleema Baji is the wife of M. Y.. They have lived in the mid-size city of Vehari, Pakistan for the last 15 years. She is a very supportive lady and always ready to help others. Her husband runs a scrap business in the community and has four years experience.  Haleema Baji is applying for a loan to buy scrap in order to increase the profits of her husband’s business.

This loan is a group loan with four other people:

Rani Baji wants to buy materials (rice, cooking oil and spices) for her business of making Punjabi food (Biryani). 
Razia Baji wants to buy timbers to sell. 
Waziran Baji wants to buy plastic beans for making plastic bottles. 
Nazia Baji wants to buy scrap for her scrap business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Haleema Baji is seated in the center of the group.

loans.use: To buy scrap

loans.name: Gadoy

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Гадой Бойкузиев работает плотником, из дерева он мастерит окна и двери. Но основным источником дохода в его семье является занятие Гадойя животноводческой деятельностью. 20 лет Гадой занимается выращиванием и откормом крупнорогатого скота. У него достаточный опыт в этой сфере деятельности. Помощники Гадойя – это его дети Чурат и Соат, а так же жена Назира. 
Гадой хочет получить кредит для откорма скота и переработки молока.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Gadoy B. works as a carpenter, he makes doors and windows from wood. But the main source of income for Gadoy's family is the animal husbandry business. For twenty years Gadoy has been growing and feeding large cattle. He has sufficient level of experience in this field. Gadoy's helpers are his children Churat and Soat and also his wife Nazira. Gadoy wants to get a loan to feed the cattle and for processing of milk.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To feed the cattle and process milk

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca Z. is 60 years old and from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City. She is married to Adriano and has four adult children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,020 PHP a month from these activities.
In July 2009, Rebecca joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fabrics and other needed materials for her tailoring business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family

texts.en: Bola A. is 34 years old and married with two children. She is a tailor and also sells sarongs. Bola is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Ton

texts.en: Ton S., 49, is a married mother blessed with six children. Two of her children are construction workers and the others sew clothes in the garment industry. Ton's husband is a domestic construction foreman in the village. Since early 2003, Ton has been selling a few produce items to her neighbors from her store in front of her home. She works very hard in order to sustain her business growth. Ton says that her business is running well but she needs the capital facility to upgrade her inventory. She is seeking a loan to accumulate a large quantity of grocery to sell.

loans.use: To accumulate a large quantity of grocery to sell

loans.name: Salamat Muhammad Ilyas Group

texts.en:
Salamat is married to M. I., who is a loader by profession. He uses his donkey cart to load items such as furniture and flour sacks and delivers these to their assigned destinations. He has been doing this work for more than 5 years. Salamat baji is a very caring lady and she is aware of the difficulties of this work. She feels very sad when her husband must unload the cart by himself. But she always encourages him and takes care of his health. The donkey cart has become rough and has rotted, so Salamat baji is applying for a loan to buy a new cart for her husband.

This loan application is shared by four additional people: 

Zareena baji and Rajan baji each want a loan to buy scrap for their scrap business.
 
Reshma baji wants a loan to buy a juicer machine for her juice corner.

Karam Ilahi baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Salamat baji is seated in the middle of the bajis.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen U. sells provisions and drinks. She has been in business for the past 10 years. Queen lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. Queen is requesting a loan of N150,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders for considering this application.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions

loans.name: Mary Dale

texts.en:

To make a living, Mary Dale owns and operates a specialized retail business. Mary Dale is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Dale from HSPFI. Ester started her own shop 3 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzania Schillings (TZS).

This is Ester’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 250,000 TZS to buy more products for her shop. With the additional profit she expects from the use of this loan, Ester hopes to expand her business, to do repairs, to provide more food for her family and to pay school fees.

texts.en:
Asia baji, wife of A. H., has lived in a mid-sized city named Vehari, Pakistan, for the past twenty years. Her husband runs a fruit-selling business and has four years of experience in this business. He treks to different areas and sells his fruit on a cart by calling out in a loud voice. He buys fruit wholesale and in this way he pays less and earns more profit.

In the photo, Asia baji is seated in the middle of the baji’s. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruit to advance her husband’s fruit-selling business. 

This loan group consists of four additional people:

Qamar baji wants a loan to buy packets of tea to sell.

Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

Pathani baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

У неё сейчас несколько десятков коз и баранов. Насиба хочет кредитоваться в "Аранде" для увеличения оборотного капитала бизнеса животноводства. Насиба очень любит занимается откормом скота.На снимке Насиба в день выдачи.

Nasiba is a 31-year-old woman, who is married and has four children. She is involved in manufacturing goat yarn. She currently has several dozens of goats and rams. Nasiba wants to obtain a loan through Arvand in order to increase her animal husbandry business working capital. Nasiba loves the business of livestock feeding very much. The photograph shows Nasiba on the disbursement day.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

texts.en:

Having a large experience Yuriy knows this business well and has many repeat clients. Yuriy's purpose is to develop this business further by purchasing necessary equipment and learning to fix new cars and leave it for his son to continue when he retires.
