loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Selling grocery items is part of 35-year-old Mom P.’s daily routine. She runs her business very well and gains much income through selling her goods, items like cakes, candies, cooking ingredients, and some canned goods. In addition, her husband works driving a trailer-motor taxi.

This modest couple is responsible for three school-aged children who are living at home. Mom P. has sold her wares from her stock supply and she hopes to be able to replenish her other items by using a Kiva loan to buy additional grocery inventory for resale. Note: In the picture is Mom P.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery inventory for sale

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en:
Bosede lives in Lagos. She sells hair extensions and she is also a stylist. Bosede learned her business in 3 years and she has been in the business since the year 1985. She is 45 years old and married with 2 children.

Bosede has been borrowing from LAPO for the past 2 years and the loans have helped her to increase her productivity and profitability. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair creams to sell

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera I. is 28 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City. She sells drinks to make a living. Vera hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Remario

texts.en:
Remario L. is a rice farm owner and father of four children. He admitts that its really hard being a father especially when the children are starting to ask for their school allowance, books, and money for projects. Good that he has a rice farm and the harvest that he gets helps a lot in providing the needs of his family.

He is asking for a loan of Php 10,000. He will use it to buy complete fertilizers and insecticides. Farming is his only way to pay everything in their home; he needs to at least improve his harvest to help his family more. CEVI helps him in growing his business. He receives loans, training, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy complete fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen E. is doing pretty well in her rice farm business. She has been doing this since she got married to Ramel E., a farmer also. She has three children and her only wish is to be able to send all her kids to school and let them pursue a degree in the future.

She needs capital to grow her farm. She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 to be able to buy complete fertilizers and chemicals.

Now, she is actively participating in the CEVI credit program. CEVI provides their clients loans, training, and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Oyuntuya

texts.en:
Oyuntuya S. is 34-year-old and lives with her husband and two children in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two children are both small and stay home. Her husband works at Zamiin Uud, a border town with Ereen, China - the busiest and largest border with China.

As her husband works full time in Zamiin Uud, he is rarely at home. That's why Oyuntuya decided to pursue a small business by herself, instead of solely depending on husband's salary. In 2005, she rented a small space and run a tea shop. However, due to high rent, she decided to exit the tea shop business. Since 2009, she acquired a license to become an official distributor for the Russian company that sells health products extracted from bee’s honey. Since she is the only one with the license in the town, she hopes to do well with the business. Since her start-up a few months ago, the sale of health products has been doing considerably well. She says that she is working hard to introduce the honey products to locals and needs a personal computer to make marketing materials and purchase products online.

She requests a loan to purchase a computer with internet, with which she can do her own marketing in a less costly fashion and order her products online.

About XacBank:

Founded in 1998, XacBank is a community development bank and micro-finance institution in Mongolia, and is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar. It currently serves approximately 16,000 micro-clients at 76 branches in all 21 aymags (provinces) in Mongolia, making it the largest micro-finance institution in the country.

XacBank's mission is to contribute to sustainable development of Mongolia that can come only from educated and skilled people and competitive and dynamic businesses concerned equally about the Planet, People, and Profit. The Bank will provide equitable access to transparent, reliable and responsive banking products and services to the Bank’s clients, including its traditional Micro-entrepreneurs as well as Small and Medium businesses.

Your loan enables XacBank to expand its micro-loan capacity and return a portion of the interest back to the borrower at the end of the loan term.

To learn more, please visit the XacBank website at: www.xacbank.mn.

loans.use: To purchase bee-honey related products for her business

loans.name: Pick

texts.en:
Pick O. is a 50-year-old woman with insufficient capital who lives in Takmao District in Phnom Penh City. She is currently working as internal cleaning staff for a company while her husband works in building wooden houses. The family is blessed with seven children, five of whom are working in different jobs: three are garment workers and two are in construction.

Pick O. finds it hard travelling to work or anywhere else, because she doesn’t have her own vehicle for her and her family’s traveling needs. Therefore, she would like a loan of $600 to buy a second-hand motorcycle for transportation purposes.

Pick O. was not available for the photograph, so her husband is shown in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle for family transportation needs

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Ulambayar P. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Bayanzurh district of  Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son is 14 years old and goes to a local secondary school and her 4-year-old daughter stays home. 

Ulambayar has a small business in shoe retail. She rents a small stall in the Hantalst shopping mall, one of the large indoor shopping centers in Ulaanbaatar. She sells women's and men's shoes that she brings from Ereen, China, a  border town, where many inexpensive Chinese products are imported to Mongolia. Because Ulambayar chooses the
cheapest shoes, her shoes are sold fast and easily. Besides shoes, she also sells dried fruit at the market, which shoppers purchase as snacks. 

Ulambayar says that she would like to continue building a small house that she has already started on the plot of land that her family owns. She would like to expedite the building process with profits from her business. She requests a loan to purchase more shoes for her business.

About XacBank:

Founded in 1998, XacBank is a community development bank and microfinance institution in Mongolia, and is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar.  It currently serves approximately 16,000 microfinance clients at 76 branches in all 21 aymags (provinces) in Mongolia, making it the largest microfinance institution in the country.

XacBank's mission is to contribute to sustainable development of Mongolia that can come only from educated and skilled people and competitive and dynamic businesses concerned equally about Planet, People, and Profit. The Bank will provide equitable access to transparent, reliable and responsive banking products and services to the Bank’s clients, including its traditional micro-entrepreneurs as well as small and medium businesses.

Your loan enables XacBank to expand its microloan capacity and return a portion of the interest back to the borrower at the end of the loan term

To learn more, please visit the XacBank website at: www.xacbank.mn.

loans.use: To purchase spring and autumn shoes for her business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Rice farming is the business of Fe S.'s family. When Fe married her husband Jurlito S., she learned the whole process of farming. Fe is now 31 years old and has four children, and she wants to achieve something in her business so that she can help send her kids to college.

Fe is seeking a loan to buy all of the fertilizers and herbicides needed for her farm, so that she can improve the likelihood of an abundant harvest.

Fe is happy to be with the CEVI program. Through CEVI, she has easy access to loans whenever needed and to business training and insurance coverage for herself and her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. is 35 years old and she is married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. Grace sells foodstuffs, and she is seeking a loan of N70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ipogolo E Group

texts.en:
Lustika is a member of the Ipogolo borrower group in Ruaha, Iringa. She is 48 years old  and married.  She has two children, ages 28 and 30 years. 

Lustica has had a shop business for 5 years. She works 15 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 190,000 Tanzania Shillings (TZS).

This is Lustika’s  first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 TZS to buy products for her shop. With the additional profit she expects from the use of this loan, Lustika hopes to expand her business, to do repairs, to get more food for her family and to save money. 

Magdalena, another member of the  Ipogolo E borrower group, is also requesting 200,000 TZS in order to support her own shop business.

loans.use: To buy more products for her shop

loans.name: Haitgul

texts.ru: Хаитгул Махмадиева проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 51 год. Замужем, имеет  2 детей. Муж работает "прорабом". Сама клиентка имеет маленькую торговую точку, где торгует разными мелочами. Например: жевательной резинкой, печеньями, конфетами и т.д. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Haitgul M. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 51 years, married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a foreman. The client has a small retail stand where she sells various items, such as chewing gum, cookies, candies, etc. She is requesting a loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Efe

texts.en: Efe U. is 39 years old and married with 4 children.  He produces cellophane bags to sell. He is seeking a loan of  N100,000 to purchase more materials so that he can produce more cellophane bags. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to produce more cellophane bags to sell

loans.name: Regalado

texts.en: Regalado D. started to farm rice when he got married to his wife, Ma. Leah D.. He is the provider in the family and he needs to work to be able to support his three children who are going to school everyday. Regalado needs additional capital on his farm to buy fertilizers, herbicides and to pay the laborer so he is applying for a loan of Php 7,000. He hopes to see that this will improve his yield. CEVI helps small business grow. It provides credit assistance, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides and to pay the laborer

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Хафиза - женщина средних лет, ей 39 лет. Она замужем и мать 4-х детей. Хафиза вместе с мужем занимаются производством и продажей национальных лепешек. Её муж печет дома лепешки а Хафиза продает их на базаре и принимает заказы от потенциальных клиентов. Хафизе и мужу помогают дети. Из дома до рынка лепешки отвозит их старший сын, а продавать лепешки помогает дочь. У детей сейчас летние каникулы, поэтому Хафизе и мужу легче. Хафиза и её муж хотят закупить парию муки примерно 25-30 мешков. Для этого Хафиза просит займ в размере 2500 сомони.
texts.en:
Hafiza is a middle-aged woman. She is 39 years old, married and is a mother of 4 children. Hafiza and her husband are involved in making and selling traditional flatbread. Her husband bakes the flatbread at home, and Hafiza sells it at a market and accepts orders from potential customers. Their children help Hafiza and her husband with the business. Their oldest son drives them from home to the market, and their daughter helps sell the flatbread. Now that the children are on their summer break, things are easier for Hafiza and her husband. Hafiza and her husband want to buy a stock of flour, consisting of approximately 25-30 bags. This is why Hafiza is requesting a loan in the sum of 2500 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour

loans.name: Naim

texts.ru: Гулямов Наим проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 49 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей.  Наим имеет цех, где занимается производством "пирожков" и его продажей. Ему в этом также его жена. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 10 лет. Кредит просит для закупа муки, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Naim G. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 49 years old, married and has 2 children. Naim owns a factory, where he makes pirozhki (pies) and sells them. His wife helps him with the business. He has been involved in this business for over 10 years. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of flour in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida is 48 years old and is a widow with four children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria where she sells soap. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more soap to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more soap to sell

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin is 49 years old and married with five children. She is an active LAPO client. Toyin sells drinks and wine. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and wine to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and wine to sell

loans.name: Galina's Group

texts.en:
Galina, 38, is the group leader. She is divorced and so raises her son and daughter by herself. She works in a clothes factory and also receives orders at home. Galina completed dressmaking courses before starting work in the factory. She has shown great inspiration and energy in her work as her business has started to grow. Among her achievements are that she has bought a three-room flat in Tokmok city, a new sewing machine, and made many customers. At the very beginning she invested only thirteen dollars to purchase thread and a small amount of fabric. Now her monthly income constitutes around fifty dollars. She sees great opportunities in this business.

Galina is requesting a loan to purchase additional equipment and furniture. This will allow her to attract more customers and expand her business. Her son is 17 and will go to college very soon. Galina is doing her best to save enough funds for his higher education. During the last 15 years, she has come to understand that having her own clothes factory would give her financial stability and a better standard of living. She has all the necessary qualities: experience, knowledge, determination and a readiness to take risks.

Tatjana, Ajzada and Nina are Galina’s fellow group members. Tatjana is 35, and has one young daughter, who stays with her sister. She works in a clothes factory. Tatjana is requesting a loan to purchase building materials for her bath’s repair. Her only aim is to build a secure future for her daughter.

Ajzada is 33, and is married with two children. She combines two jobs – she works as a seamstress and also cuts hay for sale. She is requesting a loan so that she can add to her husband’s earnings, enabling them to buy a house in Tokmok city.

Nina is a 27-year-old divorced mother of two children. She also works in a clothes factory. From her childhood, her dream has been to become a couturier, and she has already bought a sewing machine. Nina is requesting a loan to renew furniture at home and prepare her children for school.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan, at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her sewing business

loans.name: Anara's Group

texts.en:
The group’s leader, Anara, is a 41-year-old widow, who works as a saleswoman in her own store. Some friends of hers suggested opening a store and thus she entered the challenging world of business. Now, she successfully provides for her family by selling day-to-day goods. Her eldest daughter is married and two other sons still study at school. After school, her sons eagerly help their mother to substitute for the absence of their father. During four years of running a store, she has helped her daughter get married and has bought a flat. Investing a little more than $300, she now has a monthly income of about $700! Anara is seeking a loan to purchase large quantities of sugar, rice and cereal. With the money gained from selling these, she plans to pay her daughter’s dowry. In the near future, she is keen to start building  a new café “Bistro” next to her store. She also wants to buy a new kitchen dresser. 

Erkinbek, Ryskul and Atyrkul are members of Anara’s group. Erkinbek is 39. To provide for his family, he sells strawberries from his own vegetable garden and also resells clover.  He is able to deliver the clover thanks to a friend, who has a truck to transport it. Erbinek has to work hard, since his wife is expecting another baby! Erkinbek is in need of a loan to purchase more clover. 

Ryskul is forty. She owns a shop, where she sells a wide range of convenience goods such as stationery, foodstuffs, detergent and vegetables. She needs a loan to purchase more goods for her store to enrich the assortment. With the profits she expects, she would like to buy a new bedroom suite. 

Atyrkul, 43, is married. She has two daughters. Once, her relatives suggested opening a pavilion for selling foodstuffs. Within three years, Atyrkul has increased her profits and has bought lots of domestic goods for her house. Now, Atyrkul needs a loan to purchase sugar, cereal and macaroni. After reselling these items, she hopes to earn enough to pay for her daughter’s college education. 


======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase large quantity of sugar, rice and cereals

loans.name: Ochabonu

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Очабону - пожилая женщина 1950 года рождения. Вдова и имеет 6-х детей. Очабону живет с двумя младшими сыновьями и невестками. Очабону откармливает скот дома, а невестки помогают Очабону в откармливании скота и когда скот будет готов, сыновья Очабону продают их на скотном рынке. Очабону кредитуется в нашей организации 2 года. Она успешно закончила 4 предыдущих займов, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Очабону планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. На фото отражена старшая невестка и внук Очабону, которые помогают ей. Очабону очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
Ochabonu is an elderly woman, born in 1950. She is a widow and has 6 children. Ochabonu lives with two of her younger sons and daughters-in-law. Ochabonu raises livestock at home. Her daughters-in-law help her with feeding the livestock, and, once the livestock is ready, her sons sell it at a livestock market. Ochabonu has been a client of our organization for 2 years. She successfully repaid 4 previous loans and now wants to obtain another loan. Ochabonu plans to increase the quantity of her livestock and, thus, increase her family's profits. The photograph shows her oldest daughter-in-law and Ochabonu's grandson, who both help her. Ochabonu likes our lending conditions very much, and she is glad that such organizations that support the public exist.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells foodstuffs like beans, rice, garri etc. She is 30 years old and married with three children. Rose hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anara's Group

texts.en:
Anara is the group leader. She is 57 and divorced; her son and daughter are adults. They work and live separately from her. Usually women of her age are already retired and do not work, they depend on their children. However, Anara is not like that - all her life she depended only on herself and got used to it. Now, she earns her living by selling milk from her cows. Sometimes, her children come from the city to help her around the house. Six years ago, her relatives advised her to buy a cow. Now, keeping this cow lets her live an independent humble life. Now she courageously seeks a loan to help her two grandchildren pay for their college education. After having some experience with keeping cows, she seriously got interested in raising cattle. Her ultimate dream is to buy a big house outside the capital to be near her children, so that her grandchildren could visit her more often.

Anara’s partners in the group are Lyubov, Ainakan, Nazgul and Jiparkul. Lyubov is 51. She and her husband work at school. All their children live separately. Two sons are in Russia, while other two sons work as drivers, and their daughter works at school. Lyubov needs a loan to buy a new fridge. 

Ainakan is divorced; she raised three children. She works as a tailor, receiving orders for manufactured or ready-made garments. She then distributes products to clothing stores. This was her friend’s suggestion. Now she feels ready to try cattle-raising and therefore needs a loan to buy a calf.

Nazgul is a mother of four children. She makes a living by selling hay and milk. What she earns is not sufficient, so she wants to obtain a loan to send her daughter to work in Russia, so that her daughter can help her mother financially.   

Jipargul is 50. She is divorced and has one daughter. She makes a living by selling hay. Jipargul needs a loan to prepare her daughter’s dowry.  


======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To pay for college education of 2 grandchildren

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline owns a bakery where she bakes and sells bread. She is 35, married, and has 5 children. Roseline is requesting a loan of N80, 000 to purchase more flour, sugar, and yeast. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more flour, sugar, and yeast

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira M. grows rice. She is 42 years old and has four children. Her husband, Raul, is also a farmer. Both of them work at the farm to provide for the family needs.

She has applied for a loan of 7,000 Php from Community Economic Ventures Inc. because she needs additional capital for her business.  She plans to buy fertilizers and chemicals in order to have an abundant harvest.

CEVI provides various services. Aside from loans, all CEVI clients including Elvira M. receive training and an insurance coverage package.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a member of the Nyamhanga D borrower group in Ruaha, Iringa. She is a 30-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of 3 children. Her children are ages 13, 10, and 7.

Fatuma has had a clothing business for 7 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 180,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Fatuma’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 300,000 TZS in order to buy more clothes. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Fatuma hopes to do repairs, pay school fees, get more food for her family, and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Soliboy

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Солибою 60 лет. У него есть жена и 4-ро детей. Три сына и одна дочь. Старшие сыновья уехали в Россию для работы. Работая там, они высылают деньги родителям. Родители копят высланные деньги, чтобы потом потратить их на женитьбу сыновей.  Единственная дочь Солибоя помогает по хозяйству. Жена занимается переработкой пряжи. Она сама ездит на рынок, чтобы продать их. Солибой пасет скот в горах и возвращается очень поздно. Солибой очень надеется, что кредитование поможет ему в развитии бизнеса.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Soliboy is 60 years old. He has a wife and four children. Three sons and one daughter. His oldest sons went to Russia for work. They send money which they earn there. The parents are saving this money so they can later spend it on their sons' weddings. Soliboy's only daughter is helping with the housework. His wife spins yarn. She goes to the market herself to sell it. Soliboy shepherds cattle in the mountains and comes back home very late. Soliboy is very hopeful that this loan will help to grow his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Mutalib

texts.en:
A. Mutalib has been dedicated to the business of cattle ranching for the last 10 years. This business requires a lot of dedication for the fact that it demands a lot of effort to carry out the breeding. This is also true due to the fact that it requires the strict control of every one of the animals, while at the same time feeding and caring for those that are older. It is necessary to emphasize that through this business Mutalib is able to maintain his spouse and his 4 children. It is because of this he is soliciting a loan through IMON International. The credit will allow him to buy more animals, which he will raise and sell in the market. Mutalib has gained a reputation for responsibility with his financial obligations and for keeping his word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist him with the operation of his business.

Tajikistan:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en: Abiola sells herbs and drinks. She is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She has been in business since 2003. Abiola hopes for a loan for the amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more herbs and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more herbs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en:
Pablito N. is a 46-year old farmer and the father of three children. He is tilling the farm that he inherited from his parents. He is doing his very best to have an abundant harvest in order to be able to support his children's education. 

He is asking for a loan of 7,000 Php from Community Economic Ventures Inc. in order to buy fertilizers and rice seeds. 

He hopes that someday his family will live a more comfortable life.  He is actively participating in the CEVI credit program including through receiving loans, training and an insurance coverage package.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Dildora

texts.en:
Dildora A. is a married mother of two children. Knowledge from her parents and grandparents has contributed to Dildora's work raising cattle in a special space in her home. Dildora's work in animal sales generates good income for her family. Currently she has two cows in her house. She would like to increase little by little the variety of her animals and is seeking a loan of $ 1200 USD. Dildora’s dream is to see her children complete their education.

loans.use: Purchasing of small cattle

loans.name: Chioma

texts.en: Chioma sells provisions, food and cosmetics in her shop. She is 32 years old and married with four children. She is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more provisions, food and cosmetics to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, food and cosmetics

loans.name: Istatkhon

texts.en:
H. Istatkhon is 29 years old. She has a son with her husband. Istatkhon has been running her own business for more than four years. She has a small saloon where she sells and rents traditional and national wedding dresses. Traditionally families in Tajikistan are large and consequently there are many marriages so Istatkhon has a lot of clients. The stability of her business allows her to make a considerable contribution to the family income. This is Istatkhon's second loan with IMON International and during the previous loan cycle she was accurate and precise in the loan payments. Istatkhon is requesting $ 1300 USD in order to purchase more wedding dresses.

loans.use: Purchase of wedding dresses

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose A. sells tubers of yams on a retail basis to her customers. She is married with seven children and she is 46 years old. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more tubers of yams to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yams to sell

loans.name: Saidanvar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Саиданвару 32 года. Он женат и отец 3-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, нянчит своих детей и кормит скот. Саиданвар занимается откормом и продажей скота. Летний сезон для Саиданвара – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что летом скот и его корм стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Саиданвар экономит на корме скота. С наступлением зимы Саиданвар продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота.
texts.en:
Saidanvar is 32 years old. He is married and is a father of 3 children. His wife is not employed. She stays at home and does domestic work, raises their children and feeds livestock. Saidanvar is involved in raising and selling livestock. Summer season for Saidanvar is the time to purchase livestock because livestock and feed are less expensive during the summer. And he does not have to spend much for animal feed because livestock eats mountain grass, and, thus, Saidanvar saves on livestock feed. With the onset of winter, Saidanvar sells some of the raised livestock, but does not buy any new livestock. He buys animal feed for the remaining livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Husniobod

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Husniobod began her work as an entrepreneur in the markets of Spitamen, Tajikistan. Her hope was to improve the standard of living for her family and to provide education to her two children. Over the past decade, Husniobod has successfully developed her own clothing business with the support of microfinance loans through IMON International. A committed and hardworking businesswoman, Husniobod has successfully repaid each loan. With the profits from her business, Husniobod has supported not only the education of her daughters, but also her aging parents. Currently, Husniobod is seeking a loan of 8000 Somoni to expand her inventory and increase the variety of products for sale. With the additional profits, Husniobod plans to continue expanding her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: To expand her inventory and increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Fatuma D., age 49, is married with three children, ages 25, 18 and 17 years.  She has two businesses; she sells fruits and vegetables and at the same time, she sells tea and chips. She has been doing this for seven years now.  She works daily from 6am to midnight.  She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $301.

This will be Fatuma's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants a loan to buy a sack of potatoes, a bucket of cooking oil and wheat flour. 

Fatuma will share this loan with her group, Unity, which totals 18 members. These members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Fatuma is first from the left in the front row.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Monaniso

texts.en:
K. Monaniso sells perfumery and cosmetics in a store which she rents. She is 50 years old and married with three adorable children. Monaniso has been in this business for five years. She dreams of expanding her business and opening her own store. She wants to establish contacts with constant suppliers of well-known products. Monaniso and her husband are working hard in order to have sufficient funds for educating their children so that they become highly demanded experts in the future. Today, Monaniso requests 5000 somoni in order to purchase new perfumery and cosmetics such as hair color, nail varnish, and lipstick, etc. aiming to increase her range of goods. She would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase new perfumery and cosmetics such as hair color, nail varnish, and lipstick, etc

loans.name: Amarbayasgalan

texts.en: Amarbayasgalan C. is a single mother who has two sons. Her family lives in a "ger" (a Mongolian nomadic housing tent) district on the plot of land she owns in Arhangay, one of the Mongolian central provinces. Her eldest son Nyamdalai, 18, has just graduated from high school and helps his mother's tailoring business. Her youngest son Byambasuren, 15, is attending school. Amarbayasgalan has been running a sewing business since 2006. She sews a variety of men’s and women’s apparel including Mongolian traditional dresses. Most of her clients are local residents. When she started her business her working capital was 150,000 tugrugs (1 USD=1450 MNT) but, as a result of her hard work, her capital has increased and reached 780,000 tugrugs. Amarbayasgalan requests a loan to purchase fabrics as a raw material to increase her business inventory. About XacBank: Founded in 1998, XacBank is a community development bank and microfinance institution in Mongolia, and is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar. It currently serves approximately 16,000 micro-clients at 76 branches in all 21 aymags (provinces) in Mongolia, making it the largest microfinance institution in the country. XacBank's mission is to contribute to sustainable development of Mongolia that can come only from educated and skilled people and competitive and dynamic businesses concerned equally about Planet, People, and Profit. The Bank will provide equitable access to transparent, reliable and responsive banking products and services to the Bank’s clients, including its traditional micro-entrepreneurs as well as small and medium businesses. Your loan enables XacBank to expand its micro-loan capacity and to return a portion of the interest back to the borrower at the end of the loan term. To learn more, please visit the XacBank website at: www.xacbank.mn.

loans.use: To purchase cotton fabrics for her business

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth E. owns a small rice farm in Bunawan Agusan Del Sur. She helps her husband till the land. Farming is their only source of income. Their harvest is intended for family consumption. The excess of their harvest is sold to the neighbors.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy complete fertilizer and rice seeds. She thinks that this move will help increase her harvest and income. In that way, she believes, she will be able to provide the needs of their home.

Now she is actively participating in the CEVI credit program. She receives loans, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy complete fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Joemar

texts.en:
Joemar F. is a rice farmer. He is 28 years old and has one child. Though he is a young father, he has started to worry about the future of his kid. He always worries about where to get the money to spend for their daily needs.

The only thing that supports their family is their farm. He always wants to make it grow in order to have a better income for the family. He is applying for a loan of PHP 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds.

Now that he is connected with the credit program of CEVI, he has loans, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en:
Batbaatar Y. is a 23-year-old single man who has been living in Arhangay, one of Mongolian central provinces, since he was born. In 2008, Batbaatar bought a second hand Japanese vehicle and started running a taxi service business at the local market. Most of his clients are local residents; therefore, it is easy to find passengers locally. He lives with his mother. His mother has already retired and stays at home. Batbaatar's wish is to take good care of his mother and provide her financial and daily needs. Thanks to his humble, hard working and careful personality, since he started running his current business, his living conditions improved dramatically. Batbaatar requests a loan to purchase spare parts for his vehicle. He says that "I wish my mom be healthy and well as long as possible. I love my mom very much"

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en: Bolale is 31 years old and married with three children. She sells foodstuff. Bolale is a LAPO client. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Zuro

texts.en:
M. Zuro is the married mother of an enthusiastic family. She is a very hard worker, who rises early in the morning to feed her cattle. She works for the well-being and happiness of her two children. She wants to improve the setup of her business to increase her earnings. In order to satisfy her goal for a higher quality of life, Zuro needs to buy more cattle to raise for sale. She is seeking a loan of $1200 USD for this. Let’s support this hardworking and talented woman so that she can obtain her goals!

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells palm oil and sachet water (water in plastic bags). She is 45 years old and married with four children. She has been a LAPO client for the past three years.

Virginia hopes for the loan of N150,000 to purchase more palm oil and sachet water to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga E. is 48, married and the father of four. His family lives
in a 'ger" district on the plot of land he owns in Arhangay, one of the
Mongolian central provinces. His three youngest children are university
students and the eldest one is unemployed. Battulga has been running a horse
saddle making and sales business for the last three years.  Battulga purchases
wood, silver and iron as raw materials from the local market. The main body
of the saddle is made of wood, the steple is made of iron, and silver is used
to make a decoration. His spouse Gantuya, 42, helps his business always.
Since he makes quality saddles, they sell quickly. During the last
three years of hard work, his working capital has been increasing from
200,000 tugrugs to 800.000 tugrugs. He says  "For now I'm selling saddles to
local herders only. I'm thinking of finding more buyers, therefore planning to deliver saddles to
Ulaanbaatar, the capital city or neighbor provinces." With this loan, he will be purchasing saddle
wood.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for his business

loans.name: Gayatri

texts.en:
Mrs. Gayatri D., 36 years old and a resident of Kuleshwor, lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. Both her sons are studying in pre-primary school. Her husband, Mr. Shyam D., is a driver.
Mrs. D. opened her grocery store five years ago to strengthen the economic condition of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods in her store. She even sells mineral water and vegetables in her shop.
Now Mrs. D. is requesting an Rs 20000.00 loan to buy grocery goods such as noodles, biscuits, vegetables and mineral water for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Davrondjon

texts.en:
M. Davrondjon is a married man responsible for three children. For three years, he has been selling basic foodstuffs in his grocery located in the central market. He began his business with $200 USD that he saved over a long period of time. It is necessary to note that Davrondjon is a strong and hardworking man. He knows how to respond to the call of being a father who supports his three children who study in elementary school. He has worked with IMON International for a year, having received a loan that he has taken advantage of wisely to better his and his family’s living conditions. Currently Davrondjon is requesting a loan of $3000 USD. He is counting on your help and thanks all of you sincerely!

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Romualdo

texts.en:
Ever since Romualdo C. started to farm, he has always had an abundant harvest. This is because he always uses fertilizers and herbicides when he farms. He is 43 years old this year and still single. He needs capital to run his business. That is why he applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use his loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds. This loan will really help him achieve a better and more abundant harvest.

Romualdo has been actively participating in the CEVI credit program. He has loans, training and an insurance coverage package.

loans.use: To buy complete fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Kunduzoi

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”

     Кундузой женщина 43 лет. Замужем и имеет 3-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с мужем. Кундузой откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, муж Кундузой продает их на скотном рынке. Кундузой кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. Она успешно закончила предыдущий займ, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Кундузой планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Кундузой очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
Kunduzoi is a 43-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. Kunduzoi and her husband are involved in raising and selling livestock. She feeds the livestock at home, and, once the livestock is ready, Kunduzoi's husband sells it at a livestock market. She has been a client of our organization for 1 year. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now wants to obtain her next loan. Kunduzoi plans to increase quantity of her livestock and, subsequently, increase her family's profit. Kunduzoi likes our lending conditions very much, and she is glad that such organizations that support the public exist.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Bavuudorj

texts.en:
Bavuudorj C. is a 38-year-old married man who has three children ranging in age from 9 to 13. His family lives in a ger district, on a plot of land he owns in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. In 2003, his family moved from Hangay, a small administration center, to a central province looking for a better life. As soon as he moved in, he started his own small business selling food products together with his spouse, Gerelt-Od, age 34. Bavuudorj has a secondhand Japanese vehicle. He usually purchases food products from the local central market at wholesale prices, then drives to the countryside to visit local herders and sell his products door-to-door. When he began his retail business, he purchased items for 1 million tugrugs ($1 USD = 1450 MNT). Now his working capital has increased to 2 million tugrugs. In 2007, he bought a plot of land in a central province with his profit. With future profits, he plans to build a house for his household needs. Bavuudorj is a very quiet and hardworking person. His wish is to expand his business as soon as possible, since it is the only source of his family's income. Bavuudorj requests a loan to purchase food products for his business.

About XacBank: Founded in 1998, XacBank is a community development bank and microfinance institution in Mongolia, headquartered in Ulaanbaatar. It currently serves approximately 16,000 clients from 76 branches in all 21 aymags (provinces) in Mongolia, making it the largest microfinance institution in the country.

XacBank's mission is to contribute to sustainable development of Mongolia that can only come from educated and skilled people and competitive and dynamic businesses concerned equally about planet, people, and profit. The bank provides equitable access to transparent, reliable and responsive banking products and services to the bank’s clients, including its traditional micro-entrepreneurs as well as small and medium businesses.

Your loan enables XacBank to expand its microloan capacity and return a portion of the interest back to the borrower at the end of the loan term.

To learn more, please visit the XacBank website at: www.xacbank.mn.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
S. Zamira is a very hard-working and enthusiastic girl. Because the small salary her parents receive was not sufficient to cover all the family's basic expenses, she decided to start her own business selling perfumes and cosmetics. Little by little, she gained more clients and increased her sales. Her wish to provide for her family and improve her living is what motivates her each day to improve and grow her business.

Zamira needs a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase merchandise and continue growing her business. She hopes you will want to play an important role in her business' growth and in the life of her family, and she thanks you for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy goods to increase the range of goods that she sells

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet K. sells groundnut paste in Abura. Janet has received a junior high school education.  She is married and has one child. Her husband is a trader. Janet has been selling groundnut paste since 2004. She is responsible for paying fees and other bills. Her loan will be used to buy more of the groundnuts that she uses to make the paste. She hopes to reinvest the profits from this loan in her business.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a young man aged 28 years old and married with four children. His wife doesn't work, so his business is the only source of income for the family.

Sameer finished his ninth grade but didn't continue his studies because his father died. Instead, he started as a worker in Israel but, after the second intifada where no worker was allowed to enter Israel, Sameer thought of having his own business. So he started cleaning carpets and houses.

Sameer needs this loan to buy some cleaning materials. He appears in the photo while cleaning carpets.

loans.use: To buy some cleanning materials

location.town: Al-Amary Refugee Camp, Ramllah City, West Bank

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is dedicated to improving her quality of life and does not scrimp on any efforts to achieve this. Her responsibility as a mother is her major driving force. She has been working for 12 years raising young cattle. Firuza built a small stable in her house in order to do this, and her earnings represent her long term efforts to care for these animals. She is very enthusiastic about continuing to raise animals, since this will permit her to improve her conditions. Firuza asked for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase young cattle to expand her business. Let’s support this hard-working and talented woman so that she can attain her goals!

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret G. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Margaret sells clothes and shoes in Abura, which she has done since 1991. She carries the clothing on the head and moves from place to place selling them. Her husband is a driver. Margaret uses her income to pay fees and buy clothing for the children. Margaret will use the loan to buy more shoes and clothes for resale. Margaret plans to re-invest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Mubindjon

texts.en:
Y. Mubindjon is 21 years old. He is married and his wife is a student. Four years ago, he started his business selling cell phones. Mubindjon believes that this business is profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family. However, he thinks that it is expensive to purchase the cell phones locally and it will be cheaper to purchase the goods from China. Mubindjon is requesting $2900 USD for this purpose. Having already borrowed from IMON International, Mubindjon has demonstrated that he is a reliable and accurate client. He is grateful to all supporting him and promises to repay the current loan promptly as well.

loans.use: To buy cell phones from China to sell

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena is married. She has 6 children and she is 35 years old. She sells food and groceries in her shop and has been in this business for the past 7 years. Philomena is hoping for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more food and groceries to sell. She says "thank you."

loans.use: To purchase more food and groceries to sell

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en: Chinyere sells table water (a mixture of tap water and other ingredients such as saltwater or mineral water) and sachet water (bottled water). She has been in the business for past 6 years. She is 32 years old and married with 3 children. Chinyere is hoping for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more table water and sachet water to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more table water and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Ananias

texts.en:
Ananias H. is a rice grower from Bunawan Agusan del Sur. He is 59 years old and all of his children are married. He is renting the land. During the harvest, he receives a share from the real owner of the farm.

He needs a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. He is hoping that he will have better yield so that he can have a bigger share for himself.

He is happy about receiving services from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He has received loans, training and insurance from CEVI.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.en:
C. Mukaram is divorced and has three children. After her husband left the family, Mukaram was forced to find ways to provide for her family. She did some market research and decided to take a risk and borrow some money to start a business selling warm clothing. She rented a large shipping container at the local city market and purchased coats, jackets and other winter clothing to offer for sale.

Mukaram has now been in business for 9 years, working hard to meet the needs of her customers. She always makes her buyers feel welcome as she gives each one her full attention and serves them politely and with respect. Her reasonable prices and variety of inventory appeal to many modest clients.

Mukaram has promptly repaid all 6 loans she has received from IMON International. She understands the value of lending services that have helped her business grow and become self-sustainable. Mukaram is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to increase her retail inventory. She is planning to purchase a variety of clothing that will be both durable and practical for a variety of customers. Having an assortment of inventory at exceptional prices will meet customer demand and draw many potential new clients to her business. In the future Mukaram would like to purchase another container and hire a person to help her with sales allowing her to generate additional profits to help finance her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy new clothing for teenagers

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn A. has a shop in Abura where she sells cosmetics and other items. Evelyn has received a junior high school education. She is married and has no children. Her husband is a mason. Evelyn has been selling cosmetics since 2004. She is responsible for paying bills. Her loan will be used to to buy more cosmetics to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Mavjudakhon

texts.en:
Mavjudakhon is married. She sells clothes for boys in a local marketplace called “Sakhovat.” Mavjudakhon works hard and has gained many useful skills in the past 15 years. Now she needs a loan of 5000 Somoni to increase her stock. Mavjudakhon is hoping to generate additional income to purchase some appliances for her house. We believe her personality and ability to handle pressure will guarantee further successful growth of her enterprise and prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To buy new boys' clothing to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida G. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 40 years old. Aida is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Aida raises and sells pigs. Aida is just starting this business.

In 2008, Aida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Aida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Aida's fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions .

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor is married and has three children. She lives in Tursunzade where she sells clothing in the market. She has been in this trade for 14 years. Gulbahor has an active entrepreneurial mind that is always looking for the next big opportunity. Her business is profitable and stable, but she would like to press on and expand it even more. Today, Gulbahor is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to increase her clothing stock and meet the growing demands of the summer season. She is hoping to open a second vending facility in the future.

loans.use: To buy new mens' clothing to sell

loans.name: Adaku

texts.en: Adaku sells articles like shoes polish, hair brush, battries, and mops. She is 25 years old and married with one child. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. Adaku is requesting a loan of N50, 000 to purchase more articles to sell. She says that this loan will help her to meet the demands of her customer. She says "thank you."

loans.use: To purchase more articles to sell

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is a seasoned entrepreneur from Tursunzade, Tajikistan. Married and the mother of three children, she started her business about 13 years ago when she needed to find a job right away and business ownership was her best opportunity. She currently sells a range of men’s shirts at the large central market in Tursunzde. Fotima has a reputation for treating customers with care and kindness, qualities that set her apart from many other businesses that often lack good customer service. Fotima has also proven to be a great client with IMON International, having successfully repaid 6 loans. She has requested a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase new inventory and continue developing her business.

loans.use: To buy new mens' clothing to sell

loans.name: Negmat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
    Негмат – молодой человек 1989 года рождения. Холост. Занимается продажей мобильных телефонов и аксессуаров и бытовой техники в районе Стадион, ряд магазинов Зафар города Худжанда. Негмату привозят товар из Китая а часть из Дубая. Сам Негмат ездит за товаром редко, потому, что транспортные расходы обходятся дорого. Негмат планирует расширить бизнес и закупить партию двух стандартных мобильных телефонов. Поэтому он просит кредит для осуществления его планов.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Negmat is a young man born in 1989. He is a bachelor. He sells mobile phones and accessories and household appliances in the region Stadion, in the store row Zafar in the town of Khujand. Negmat is supplied with merchandise from China and part from Dubai. Negmat himself travels for the merchandise rarely because the transportation costs are expensive. Negmat plans to expand his business and buy a batch of two standard mobile phones. This is why he is asking for a loan to realize his plans.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mobile phones

loans.name: Makhsuda

texts.en:
T. Makhsuda is 43 years old, is divorced, and has two school-aged children. Makhsuda is a businesswoman who sells boys' clothing. She has 11 years of experience and started her business on her own. Makhsuda is requesting a loan to purchase of clothing in bulk so that she can improve her income. In the future, she will grow her business and attract more clients, allowing her to provide higher education to her children.

loans.use: To buy boys' clothing to resell

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is a young man aged 33 years old and married with three children aged 8, 6 and 3 years old. He has a problem with his leg.

Amjad appears in the photo at his store. He started his business from personal savings a year and a half ago. His business is growing since it is based in a busy location near Ramallah hospital.

loans.use: To purchase new products for his shop

loans.name: Muhiba

texts.en:
K. Muhiba is married and has three children. She started as an entrepreneur by selling children's clothing in the central city market. Today, after 20 years, her business is the main source of income for her family and her husband and older son are actively involved, helping her with sales.

Muhiba is a very focused and balanced business owner. She is requesting a loan of $3000 USD to restock her inventory. She wishes to expand the range of goods and hopes that providing a good assortment of inventory at reasonable prices will attract many potential customers, helping her business to grow and expand for the future. Muhiba feels this is the only way to earn enough to ensure that her children can continue their education and have a bright future.
